Reviews.Title: “Best Relaxing Hotel in PR so far...”
Reviews.Author: RozCt
Reviews.Content: I've been to a few resorts/hotels in Puerto Rico, by far this is the best for a relaxing quality time that I have ever been to. I'll be honest for the low price I was not expecting that much or overall an ok Resort, however I was wrong. Actually, it was great- these is the facts: - Great staff, friendly (in PR is very dificult to find a staff that is friendly and w/great customer service) -The room- we/got an ocean view and near the main pools- it was really good, clean and very charming. - The pools were really clean, jacuzzi's- the Hotel is pretty spacious. - I would consider this Resort for couples (wanting to spend time a great quality, quiete time) or seniors. Theres not that much to do for either young or teens. Like I said is very quiete. - Rest. food is okay (I have try great seafood in other places of the island) perhaps for burgers and appetizers will be a good alternative to use the rest. - I mean you do not have an option, if you want any fastfood rest outside the hotel- you have to drive a good 10-15 min out. -The beach- well is not really a swim beach- the water is very, very shallow- it was really clean- but if you want to soak your feet- that will be fine. I would highly recommend- read a great book or sleep and sleep, relaxing w/some great pina coladas!. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy H
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 2 children) recently spent our spring break in Puerto Rico. We have traveled to the island several times, but never stayed at the Copamarina. We rented a car in San Juan and made the drive. We loved the resort. The best part was the setting: lovely pools, beaches, and beautiful grounds. The room cost was a real value, and the meals were good and affordable, compared to other resorts we had stayed in. We loved our trip to Gulligan's Island. The staff was terrific. They went out of their way on many occasions to make sure we had everything we needed. We will definitely return for another stay! The resort was quiet at night, but romantic and they had a lot of things going on during a holiday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: eldavid51
Reviews.Content: Great facilities, nice restaurant, pool, etc. Windows at room a little damaged. Overall experience good....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 3 day visit...want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: PghPerson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Dec. 2011 with my two grown children. Beautiful and peaceful hotel. Clean rooms, very nice staff, great facility. 3 swimming pools (1-kids pool, 2 larger pools) and nice beach. Coin operated washer and dryer were surprise amenities - helped to fully dry soggy clothes from several days of island fun. Guanica is on the Caribbean and thus there are no crashing waves like the north side of PR. Blue waters and blue skies. Dry Forest BioPreserve surrounds the area and thus very little rain. Nice walking trails in the preserve, but be sure to take maps and water! Also, the insects come out at night...that's what you get when you are next to a nature preserve. The food is good and pricey but that is the norm at all hotels. The coconut mojitos were the best! We ate at the outdoor grill and never tried the fancy restaurant indoors, but it was highly rated. This is a good place to relax. We did not have time to scuba or snorkle; it will have to wait until next time. We also stayed at Rio Mar Resort in Rio Grande/Fajardo and in Marriott Isla Verde...all were nice places to stay but I liked the Copamarina the best.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: yuant
Reviews.Content: I agree with much of the content in other reviews here. The resort is secluded. It is very peaceful and family-friendly. The service was good. The staff was friendly and helpful, but they keep "island time." The food selection isn't great as mentioned, but some of the dishes were really good. Only breakfast is buffet-styled. The other meals are by menu. The grounds were nice and well kept, but not spectacular. The seaweed on the beach didn't bother me. In fact, I think it draws in fish and allows them places to hide. We saw a nice variety of fish on the resort. Gilligan's Island was nice, but rather crowded with a party atmosphere every time we visited. Now the major complaints.....we felt that the all-inclusive was quite overpriced. Especially since they made it a point that tips were not included. You sign a bill for everything that you order, including drinks. Our room was bad. We stayed in Building 3. Saying that the room needed remodeling would be quite the understatement. The room was not kept clean. There were many battle scars in the room from the ongoing war against mosquitoes. There were some spiders living on the ceiling, but I didn't mind them that much because I saw them as allies in the war. We saw a centipede and a cockroach in the room. During our 5-night stay, the toilet clogged 3 times. The rooms badly need sound proofing. We heard the people above us when they moved furniture, the people talking outside in the neighboring patios, the people talking inside in the neighboring rooms, the people talking in the hallway outside our door, and especially the people getting ice from the ice machine located right outside our room. The loud AC unit did help to drown out all of this noise, when it was running. In conclusion, fixing up the rooms would go a long way to improving this resort, but we don't see ourselves returning.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet and beautiful grounds! Rooms were average. Restaurant was good.”
Reviews.Author: Jeanetrc
Reviews.Content: Service was good. Shower was leaking and in need of repair. They did come to investigate and said they would repair. If you are looking for rest and relaxation, this is a place to consider!

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever”
Reviews.Author: peterlewis
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Copamarina for 4 nights with my wife. Having been a frequent visitor for the last 18 years, we encountered this resort in better shape and condition than ever. It maintains its Caribbean plantation/South Pacific charm. The rooms are perfectly maintained and daily maid service is outstanding. All of they new units blend right in with the older ones which are kept in mint condition. The general ambiance at the resort is very peaceful and conducive to a graeat romantic getaway or a family vacation. There are two separate pool areas which contribute to different types of vacations. A big plus at Copamarina is the absence of a casino and motorized sports. There are numerous types of non-motorized water sports that can be arranged to be enjoyed at the dive shop. I personally do not dive but the resort is an important PADI base where divers go to several area sites. There are two restaurants, Las Palmas and Alexandra's. The latter was closed during those days but Las Palmas is good. The atmosphere is awesome and the menu is excellent. If you spent many days, be perpared to commute to some of the Guanica and Yauco restaurants, you may get tired of the menu. Breakfast is basically a buffet, unless there are a few folks checked in. You can opt for ordering a la carte. Copamarina feels far away and secluded, but it sits only 15 minutes away from Yauco's american style shopping centers. Las Palmas is a bit pricey but portions are good. If you order iced tea or soft drinks, be prepared to pay for refills; free ones are non existent. There is an excellent public beach adjacent to the property and try to go at least once to Gilligan's Island by boat which can be arranged at the front desk and costs $7 per person. Considering you are already there and the safety of the vessel, it is a pretty good deal. Pack a lunch if you are staying past noon at Gilligan's, a uniquely paradisical offshore island, five minutes away from Copa. Front desk staff will make every effort to makemyour stay as pleasant as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Total Relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: Beachreader7
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Copamarina March 5-12, 2012. We agree with the complimentary things said here on TA about the resort which is undergoing a million dollar plus update as I learned on Twitter @copamarina. I want to skip right to information I had a difficult time finding out about the resort so your stay can be as relaxing as ours. Getting to Copamarina: We rented a car (highly recommemded) at the San Juan Airport. Be sure you have a GPS as you will be driving on a 7 lane freeway which is like driving around LAX at rush hour. Have one person monitor the GPS carefully because it is easy to get off on the wrong exit in San Juan. Next you will drive over the mountains on a well maintained highway through terrain like I64 and I77 through West VA, complete with those semi runoff ramps. After you cross the mountains, it becomes drier and resembles the area south of San Jose, CA. Rt. 52 was a good road. Soon you will think you are driving through dry New Mexico followed by oil refineries in Ponce. There was a lot of road construction on 52 and 2 near Ponce, but traffic kept moving. You get a mini tour of the USA going to Copamarina. The road into Copamarina: We had no trouble finding #333 into the Copamarina. We made sure we arrived in the daylight after reading reviews here. It is twisty, but stay on your side when going around curves and cars can easily pass. White lines are painted on each side of the road. We thought this road was like driving on a country township road in Eastern Ohio. No potholes like Ohio, though! It has a very good surface. As you pass the big park, you will know you are almost there. Checkin: Very welcoming and well trained front desk staff will greet you and answer any questions. (They have a nice booklet about the Dry Forest Reserve next door.) Don't miss the cold water with limes on a table in the open air lobby. It is very refreshing. Check if your room safe will require an actual key so you don't have to go right back to the lobby. Laundry: There is one washer and drier which take quarters located near the spa. Las Palmas Restaurant: This is one of the areas that has recently been completely upgraded. It is beautiful and the views while you drink at the bar or dine are fantastic! There was a large scuba training event going on when we first arrived so dress was very casual--Tshirts and shorts. There was a lovely beachfront wedding Saturday night so some guests were dressed in just a bit more resort style then. All of the fresh seafood dishes were very good. Alexandra's was closed until the weekend , but dishes from it were suggested by the gracious servers each evening. The house green salad was huge and there is enough to share. I also made a meal from the spinach and club salads. The $12 breakfast fruit plate also was a great choice to share. The scrambled eggs portion size can feed a small family. I am still adding fresh, high quality cinnamon to top my homemade oatmeal here at home. Be sure to request it. Thank you, Copa chef! Best of all is the cafe au lait made with Puerto Rico's finest Yaucono coffee. (Yaucono or Alta Grande are also provided in the rooms for the coffeemaker.) You will enjoy the sun sparkling on the water at breakfast and the sound of waves during your candlelit dinners. You can see Jupiter and Venus shining brightly overhead in the wonderful dark skies. And as another reviewer noted, don't miss the coconut Mojitos! Groceries: The Economart in Guanica is quite the experience! You will see a huge Burger King sign as you drive on 116. Turn down the street right by the Burger King and it will take you down to Ave. 26 de Julio where you will find cars stalking the parking lot for a space. Go around the corner and park down the street by the arena. This is not just a little carryout; it is the grocery store heart of Guanica. We bought drinks, fresh fruits, and food for lunches. People at home warned us about prices in Puerto Rico, but food here in the countryside was priced similar to prices in Ohio. (Gasoline just down the street was 96 cents/liter.) The Yaucono coffee is behind sliding glass doors at the front by the checkout lanes. This coffee sells for $12 dollars for 8 oz. in gift stores in Old San Juan; it is $5 for 8 oz. or $3 for 4 oz. here at the Economart. Other guests said it was locked in cases by the checkouts in nearby Yauco. By the way, the Yauco shopping plaza is right by Rt. 2 so you can very easily find it, too! Swimming: I was able to swim laps in the main pool. The other pool is 3ft. 6 ins. deep so you can swim the breaststroke down the center. There are great clean hottubs that are not overly hot for meeting other guests and exchanging travel tips. If you want a perfect beach for lengthy strolls, choose Eagle Beach, Aruba or Cancun. If you want peace and a laid back visit, this is the place. We snokeled off the beach and pier. The much discussed sea grass is not slimy like "seaweed" found in Ohio and Michigan. There are plenty of starfish. Children had a great time in tide pools. Rooms: Bldg. 2 has been updated with new bedding and it looked like new tile floors. Good Wifi is included in the resort fee. We had a new large flatscreen TV with HBO and many channels. It is true that you can hear the neighbors through connecting doors. One night we think someone must have called the front desk at 10 PM, because the newly arrived neighbors tuned their happiness down as if someone had thrown a switch which made us laugh! We do hope to return with family to the well run Copa some day. We have made a lot of people jealous with our lovely photos. I will be happy to attempt to answer any questions you may have.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice place if you accept its limitations”
Reviews.Author: Joseph C
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and found it very relaxing and enjoyable. Room was clean and pleasant. There is grassy seaweed off the beach, but we had no trouble swimming over it or going in off the end of the dock. Adjoining the property is a public beach that has cleared the grass away, and is not much used on weekdays. The food was very good, but menu limited. Not much nearby, so if you are saying long you may get bored with the food and the only nightlife is pleasant conversation. There is calm water (it's inside good snorkeling (take the guided trip), easy kayaking to nearby island, Hobie cats to rent, nice swimming pools, and beautiful grounds to relax on - several species of palms, mahogany, etc (ask at the desk for guide to vegetation). With one minor exception, all of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Joanne1y
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on our PR tour and I wish it had been for longer. This hotel is glorious. The grounds are perfectly manicured, the whole thing is right on the seafront; all the rooms and facilities, including the pools are sea facing. The hot tub by the main pool is HOT - very painful if you've spent too much time in the sun! Our room was slightly worn around the edges, but beautifully furnished and decorated. The one negative was that the air conditioning was way too loud to have on at night. We had to switch it off and rely upon the fan. The night we stayed, the restaurant was not open, but we had a perfectly acceptable meal at the cafe. The menu was not extensive and was the same for both lunch and dinner, zo more variety would-be appreciated for an extended stay. The beach was particularly beautiful, with soft white sand and plenty of shade for those who need it. We would definitely return here and wish we had been able to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back to stay again at this hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: CaptDavey
Reviews.Content: A good friend of mine who had stayed here with her family some years ago recommended Copamarina. We planned to stay in the Guanica area, so we tried it. Beyond surprised! The place is absolutely gorgeous. The landscaping is perfectly designed and maintained as well as we have seen in the most expensive places. Our room was exactly what we asked for, best location and view. Superbly comfortable. With two large pools, we were quite happy. While there is a beach, it's more for sunbathing than swimming. The restaurant on-site was really good. We ate there all the time because it was a switchback hairpin drive to get to other places. It was outside, but roofed, with a great view and breeze. The top end restaurant at the resort was closed on the two days we were there, but we got some of their specials on the menu where we ate. The amazing thing was that there were so few people visiting there. It was perfect weather -- but I don't think they had 30 rooms with guests. The place is huge and must have well over 200 rooms. Anyway, we loved it. We could have stayed there for many days, but had to catch our plane to go home. It's an easy 2 hour drive to the San Juan airport. We had rented a car, which is a much better deal than using the available and costly transport alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: joknecht
Reviews.Content: We decided to sample the south coast of Puerto Rico on our way from San Juan to Rincon. This lovely sea side resort fit the bill. It is about 20 minutes from Ponce and an hour and a half from San Juan. The hotel had a perfect mix of young families, couples and retirees; as well as Puerto Ricans, North Americans and Europeans. The rooms are generic Caribbean, clean but somewhat dated. Our room was quite nice, but did have a door to an adjoining room. This was not a problem on the first night of our stay, but we did hear everything said and done in the room next to us on the second when it became occupied by a young couple. There are two restaurants on the premises, a outdoor casual one and a more formal indoor one. Both were excellent and quite reasonable for the quality of the food. You can order from the more formal restaurant's menu at the cafe. Other than these two, the local restaurant scene is practically nonexistent. You can ride into Guanica for a couple of places, but I suggest you call ahead to make sure they're open on any given day. We did walk each afternoon to the ferry landing (Gilligan's Island, I kid you not) for drinks, where my wife had the best Pina Colada of her life, and there is food available, but we did not eat there. Much has been written here about the quality of the beach. There is a lot of underwater vegetation right off shore. It is protected wetlands and cannot be cleared by the hotel. If this bothers you at all, there is an excellent public beach an easy 5 minute walk down the beach where you can swim without encountering the problem. All in all, we enjoyed our time here and got yet another view into a rich and vibrant culture that exists outside the usual tourist places on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great small resort”
Reviews.Author: Ellen K
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous place to unwind. We drove here from the airport in San Juan. Stayed 3 nights and it was a perfect place to relax, swim, eat really good food, explore the nearby dry forest (Guanica) and a side trip to Ponce. I understand that the beach area is now spoiled with sea grass, but we didn't come here to swim in the beach. We noticed that the resort has a family orientation for guests: lots of multi-generational families! If you're looking for loud night action, this isn't the place to go. The food at the restaurant was quite good, albeit a bit pricey as breakfast alone was $12 to $15 per person with coffee. One of the mornings featured an all you can eat breakfast buffet which was a far better value.We didn't take advantage of the boat trips and watersports activities since we had plans to bareboat charter our own sailing yacht to visit the Spanish Virgin Islands after our stay here. But, I would imagine that these options would be fun. Our room was spacious with a balcony. The only negative was the in-room air conditioner. It made a racket, but after the first night, we kind of got used to it. Some of you may never make this adjustment, though. It could be a deal breaker. The grounds are immaculate and the service was appropriate for the type of resort it is.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place with delicious food”
Reviews.Author: Joy M
Reviews.Content: Our family of five including parents and young adults all enjoyed our 5 day stay at copamarina. Our adjoining garden rooms were just steps away from pool, beach and dining. In addition to enjoying the resort amenities we took short trips in the surrounding area including: dry forest hikes from the parking off 334 (keep left at each fork on 334 until you see the gate) and from 333 (go right out of copamarina), several beaches including ballena and tamarindo (right out of copamarina), gilligan's island (quiet on a monday, cross the inlet to find a path that will take you to the top of the inlet from where you can snorkel down), guenica bakery for cheap delicious food, Paradise in La Paguerra for great snorkeling , the malecon for salsa dancing in Guenica on the weekend. We all thought the food was great at copamarina and the staff was very friendly; special dishes were made for the vegetarians in our group. The breakfast package was well worth it ($12 per person per day). The sea was a little rough while we were there (unusual for this spot), but still enjoyable. Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: mlferm
Reviews.Content: Way off the beaten path, the Copamarina provides the beauty, service, and comfort of a big carribbean beach resort without the "big" or the big price. It reminds us of going to St. John. The property is lush and the water calm. They provide a personal touch. There have a been a few comments about the seaweed, and yes, it does exist. We are not big ocean swimmers, so it wasn't a big deal. The fancy restaurant gets a 3 star rating. It is ok, but not memorable. Good enough for a casual stay at this perfect resort. The casual restaurant is open to the beach and a lot of fun. The food is good and the drinks are great. The rooms are understated but have AC, phone, TV, and wireless internet. The best part is they open out onto the beach. We WILL be coming back and might make this our annual beach getaway.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: markmena
Reviews.Content: beautiful location to stay after visiting Old San Juan; secluded, beautifully situated on Guanica Beach, the hotel has 2 pools,one of which is fairly large; not a large scale resort, but beautifully landscaped; rooms are attractive with small frig...great since during the week only one of two restaurants were open-food at the open air restaurant was very good; during the week, there were few people around---it felt very quiet and private......visits to the center of Ponce and San German recommended! My visit was in early March--temps in mid 80's!

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect location for a honeymoon or anniversary vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Meiguoren1
Reviews.Content: The Copamarina provided an incredibly soothing respite for my wife and i during our 3-day stay. The location is absolutely gorgeous, and the resort is nearly perfect for couples looking to relax and escape the stresses of everyday "working" life. If you want to "get away from it all", this may be the ideal place for you as well. Highlights: â€¢ Lush setting w/meticulous grounds maintenance â€¢ Beautiful flowers and trees throughout the compound â€¢ Friendly staff and quality food â€¢ Isolated, quiet, & safe setting â€¢ Kayaking to Guilligan's island for a day trip full of adventure & natural beauty â€¢ Al Fresco dining â€¢ Casual atmospere â€¢ Clean & comfortable room in Bulding 4 w/ocean view Lowlights: â€¢ Long 2-3 hour drive from San Juan â€¢ Narrow, winding road leading to resort made my wife carsick ( to remedy this, i let her drive the curvy road when we left the resort) â€¢ Food & Drinks are pricey â€¢ cuisine choices are minimal (but tasty!) with only one restaurant (Las Palmas Cafe) open for all meals on all days) â€¢ Sea grass in the ocean water surrounding the dock may be off-putting for some people looking for a "perfect" beach â€¢ some rooms are not well insulated from "neighbor" noise My wife and i both agreed that our next trip to Puerto Rico will include another stay at the Copamarina. If you're looking for an incredible place to relax in a nearly idyllic setting, this is the place to be! Room tip: Get the weekday special rate and request a 2nd floor room in Building 4 or 5.

Reviews.Title: “Caribbean Paradise Sans Passport”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Maryl
Reviews.Content: Copamarina Resort is truly a serene slice of paradise, from the good beach with glassy quiet reef-protected waters to the warm free-form pools and excellent outdoor dining. Everything is geared towards laid-back relaxation. Not many nearby restaurant choices but the on-site ones are excellent and provide enough variability for a week's stay. Rooms are a bit worn, but quite clean and quiet. The grounds are outstanding. Snorkeling the reef is average but a bit overpriced for what you get. A couple hour drive to the dry forest and nearby beaches is worth the minimal effort. Copamarina is easier to get to than other Caribbean spots, and with the reasonable prices the resort is one of the one or two spots that we plan on visiting more than once!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Return!”
Reviews.Author: Springtraveler06
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a prior visit 2 years ago. Thoroughly enjoyed the gorgeous grounds, relaxing pace, and friendly staff & look forward to a future stay. Tips: 1. Be sure to ask about ordering off the menu from Alexandra, the larger restaurant, even if it is closed. It offers wider variety and true gourmet dining. Or simply ask the server if there are any other options. We did, and were rewarded with delicious red snapper! 2. If you will just travel to and from the airport, don't bother with a car rental. If you wish to explore the area, by all means rent a vehicle. There are numerous historic, art, beach, dining, and other opportunities within a reasonable driving distance.

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: BeckyandMike
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here six years ago and we loved it. This month we visited for a second time with our four year old daughter. What an awesome vacation! The Copamarina is super kid-friendly. There are two kiddie pools -- one with a fountain -- and two larger pools. The water temperature in all the pools was just perfect. There are two hot tubs, also perfect temperature. The pools and grounds are impeccably maintained. The rooms are not super luxurious but are perfectly adequate and very clean. You aren't going to want to spend much time in your room here! Las Palmas Cafe, the outdoor cafe where we had breakfast three times and dinner three times, serves good, reasonably-priced food. We particularly enjoyed the whole fried snapper (the pizza, which we ordered the following evening, wasn't the best -- the crust was tortilla-like and not our favorite). One of our favorite things was that there is a small playground right next to the tables at Las Palmas so our daughter could play while we were waiting for our food, scarf down her food, then skip off for more sliding and climbing fun while my husband and I relaxed, chatted and enjoyed a second delicious cup of cafe con leche! The beach is a little grassy and therefore not really suitable for swimming, though there is a better public beach just a few minutes walk away. Taking the ferry to Gilligan's Island was something we enjoyed a lot on our first visit and it was just as beautiful as we remembered, with good snorkeling. We plan to return very soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for seniors”
Reviews.Author: arobiks
Reviews.Content: We've come once again to this resort and we will definitely be coming back! It's a peaceful and tranquil resort that's great for seniors and is also child-friendly (very different from San Juan). Overall, we had another wonderful experience. Just a few items to take note of: it's difficult to swim at the beach because there is still some seaweed that should be removed at the shore; there were lots of mosquitoes this year; and the breakfast service at Las Palmas was quite slow. We prefer the buffet; unfortunately, they only had that when it was busier. Quicker waiting service would be much appreciated. But as usual, all the resort staff was very friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful south coast resort”
Reviews.Author: h20andsunlovers
Reviews.Content: We have friends in PR, so have travelled extensively in the country. This resort is on a quiet seaside road, about 2 1/2 hours from San Juan. The resort is not large, but is well laid out and has all of the amenities that a large resort has. We didn't select the all inclusive option, but did eat at the restaurants on site, and were blown away at the quality of the food. The service was fair - if you have travelled in PR, you'll be familiar with this. The rooms were great. They were large, and had either a balcony or a terrace. Each room had a fridge and a huge shower! One of the best parts was the fact that they had Aveda bath and hair products! The pools and hot tubs are a great way to stay cool. The beach is not that great, but if you have a car, take a drive and explore local beaches - you won't be disappointed. Our favourite part of Copamarina was it's direct access to Gilligan's Island!!! For $7US/person, Copamarina had a private shuttle (pontoon boat) to take you to Gilligan's Island. Gilligan's is a nature reserve in the middle of the bay. It has shallow warm water, and you swim through the mangrove to the open water. It is a fantastic experience, and you cannot travel to Guanica without going. We loved it so much, we went twice on the same week! Be prepared to take absolutely everything you'll need for the day. From food, to beverages, to chairs/towels etc. There are picnic shelter and grills - if it's a PR holiday, it will be packed, so book as soon as main reception opens. You can only book travel for the same day. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Smlgram
Reviews.Content: Jan 23 to Feb 2, 2012 were the best 10 days we've had in awhile thanks to the folks at the Copamarina. From our welcoming arrival, fantastic view from our 2nd floor room, delicious meals and great service at Las Palmas cafe, to the ferry boat ride to Gilligans Island, swimming off the pier or at the adjoining public beach, we can't wait to go back again hopefully next winter. Be sure to go to the Guanica Bakery for great coffee and fresh pastries. All very low prices. They also serve breakfast and lunch at about $3 a plate. The Econo supermarket also in Guanica had everything you could need. We enjoyed trips daily by car to nearby towns and into the mountains. Ask at front desk for reccomendations on towns to visit. The gardens, the pools and the grounds in general were well maintained and very beautiful. Plenty of shade to be found under all the palms and under the palm branch covered beach shelters. Can't say enough about the attentive employees and the resort. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Thank you Copamarina!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, quiet, gracious.”
Reviews.Author: bluestocking78
Reviews.Content: Located near Guanica, in the dry forest. Right next door is what may be the most beautiful, well-maintained public beach on the entire island. No rooms facing the parking lot here! All face the beach side of the property with small patios. We stayed for one night while exploring the island. We checked in, enjoyed a gorgeous sunset at the bar, then hit the jacuzzi, followed by a lovely dinner with absolutely fantastic service at the casual outdoor dining room. Our room was quiet, comfortable, and immaculate. The property is beautifully maintained including the pools. The next morning we moved on. There were not many people staying at the property when we were there midweek. There is hiking available in the dry forest and there is a shuttle to Gilligan's island. Multiple pools. There is also a spa. The sea is calm in this location and the water pretty shallow a ways out. As mentioned elsewhere the site is somewhat remote.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location. Great for a low key vacation.”
Reviews.Author: FayeJ42
Reviews.Content: This property is located near the tiny town of Guanica. It consists of several buildings along the ocean, pools, a hot tub, small playground, game room with air hockey, and two restaurants. It is a beautiful location with picture post card views of the ocean and surrounding hills. The grounds are well maintained with attractive landscaping. The hotel was in good condition â€“ it looked like everything had just been re-painted. The beach is a narrow strip of pale sand with lots of beach chairs and cabanas that are well-maintained by the hotel. The ocean here is tame with few waves. There are some patches of sea grass but easily avoided by either swimming around them, swimming off the hotelâ€™s pier, or strolling down to the adjacent beach park. There were a few small fish, but no spectacular snorkeling right off the beach. The hotel does have kayaks and small catamarans, but we did not try these. They rent snorkels for $15/hour ($25 for the day). There is also a company that will take you snorkeling ($69) or snuba ($99) diving from a boat that leaves from the hotel pier. Our snorkeling trip was cancelled due to poor weather (must have been an issue with the currents as the weather was perfect). There is also a boat to Gilliganâ€™s Island that leaves every 30 minutes from the hotel pier from 10 am to 4:40 pm ($7). The pools are beautiful and clean. There are two hot tubs, two pools, and two shallow kiddie pools. The restaurant on site will serve drinks at the pool for the expected high resort price of about $8 each. The staff is helpful, polite and speaks English well. WiFi was free throughout the property â€“ including the beach which was VERY nice. Our room was in the main building, ground floor facing the ocean. It had a very nice back porch and we enjoyed sitting out, drinking rum, watching the sunset, and hearing the ocean. The room was large and clean with the expected amenities. There is a spa on site that we did not visit. The fitness room was a small room with two treadmills, some weights, stationary bikes, and a stair stepper. The equipment was in good shape and the fitness room was open 24 hours. The only downside to this location was that it is somewhat remote (that may be an upside to some!). There were few things to do in the immediate area. Guanica is tiny with no good restaurants. However, for a 2-3 day vacation, there was plenty to do such as the Dry Forest (ask for a brochure and map at the front desk) and Gilliganâ€™s island. The restaurant on site was good but if you want to go out, you will drive for at least 25 minutes to find a decent place to eat. They add a 10% resort fee to your bill which I found distasteful. Itâ€™s not optional so why not just include it in the room charge up front? However, this is a standard practice in PR and we have learned to expect it.

Reviews.Title: “Tale of two cities, beautiful place, but unfriendly service.”
Reviews.Author: evanstontwins
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous setting for pool and views. Food got old after two days (as no other restaurants anywhere near by). Loved hanging out by the pool and getting to walk into the dry forest (fabulous). In general, the service was hurried and not terribly gracious (the only service we found like this in all of PR). And, though not their fault, two pairs of new new shoes (keens) stolen from outside the room (which we didnt want to bring in as muddy from kayaking), and basically NO follow up from the hotel, apologies or amends at all. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Boring - Expensive - Misrepresented”
Reviews.Author: hulihan1
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort as an all-inclusive as I was traveling with two 20 year olds who like to eat and drink and socialize. Well forget it at Copamarina. There was noone there. We traveled the second week of January and the hotel had no more than 25 people staying there. Then they put us in building 4 - far from everything - not that its a big place but there were empty rooms everywhere. The resort wanted $240 p/person for transportation to the hotel so I rented a car. Then I understood why! It took 2 1/2 hours to get there and people drive crazy! The road into the resort is sooooo windy and narrow, it scared the life out of me and thus we were afraid to ever leave the resort. The area around the resort was extremely poor and I probably wouldn't have ventured out anyways. The food was good but the same everyday - only one restaurant for breakfast and lunch - two choices for dinner. The bartenders were very slow ,even with noone there - so if it had been busy you would have never gotten a drink. The beach was nice and so was the ocean, calm and swimable. Kayaks available and we took them to Gilligans island which was nice. But if we had to pay $12 to rent them (they were part of all-inclusive) it would not have been worth it. They also make you think the ferry to Gilligans Island is free - its not - $8 p/p. Pools and hot tub were nice but it was really BORING, because there was no one there and the people there were in their 70's. So, if you want to pay ALOT of money to be alone - this is your place. Otherwise go to Cancun, where the food, resorts and people are all more vacationer oriented. One more thing - driving is very difficult, roads not well marked and traffic terrible.

Reviews.Title: “All Of The Above”
Reviews.Author: Yoritomo
Reviews.Content: I'll try not to repeat what's already in the other reviews. Based on my family's week-long stay at Copamarina between Christmas and New Years, I can say there's some truth to both the good and the poor reviews. Experiences will vary, depending on your expectations and especially on whether you're looking on the outside (the hotel grounds and natural beauty) or just inside the rooms (which are average). At the resort, we waded in the ocean (yes, shallow with plants) and swam in the beautiful pools (yes, unheated and slightly chilly except for the two jacuzzi's) during at least some part of every day, and our kids loved it. Mostly, though, we used the resort as a jumping off point for day trips around the southern and western parts of the Island (e.g., the picturesque Cabo Rojo lighthouse, stunning Playa Sucia beach, the charming hill town of Adjuntas, hiking and chasing waterfalls in the lush inland forests, etc). Our main concern in planning to stay at Copamarina was food, because we did not go "all inclusive." We paid $265 a night per room (we had two rooms), and the all-inclusive package would have added another $200 or so per day, which seemed unreasonable. But everything worked out okay. The rooms have mini-fridges and coffee makers, and after asking several times over the course of a couple days, the resort put a microwave in our room, because we have a baby and needed to heat milk, but it came in handy for other things, too. (Remember to bring a bottle/can opener.) We wound up eating at one of the resort's restaurants only once. In nearby Guanica, there's an Econo market with everything you can imagine, plus a McDonalds and Burger King (though we managed to avoid both), and a couple good but cheap local bakeries that sell pastries and sandwiches. Several times for dinner, we drove 15-20 minutes to the town of La Parguera, where there are several places to choose from (we highly recommend Moon's Tapas). A word about diving: We dragged scuba gear with us, but never got to use it because the weather, although sunny, was too windy with high ocean swells. You can book diving (and snorkeling or snuba) tours through the resort, which now uses an apparently brand new operator called AquaAdventures, run by a friendly guy named Jose, though they weren't very good about returning messages and letting me know the status of whether the dives were cancelled or not. On a final note, Puerto Rico has amazing natural beauty (no visit is complete without driving through the mountains and getting lost at least once -- even with GPS), and everyone we encountered at the resort and everywhere else was very friendly and helpful. Even the policeman who pulled our car over (for reasons we never learned) immediately apologized and let us go as soon as he saw we were tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go to this place !!!”
Reviews.Author: jeanneschulz60
Reviews.Content: Just got back from copa marina beach resort in puerto rico. and I must say I was very dissapointed! From the checking in to the rules that change every day . The beach sucks there. You cant even get in the water cause there is grass growing and people complained about getting stung by something . housekeeping was not good the corners of the rooms on the floor were filthy ,$19.00 dollars for breakfast buffet.think that is a little high I dont think that I will ever go back to puerto rico ever again because of this experience!! The air conditioning sucked . There was stickey funiture . 80z bloody mary no pickle no olives $8.50 . I cant see how any one can brag about this place it was the worst week vacation that i have ever had. I always go to mexico where the people care about you 1

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and filthy”
Reviews.Author: karmendep
Reviews.Content: Although the setting could be a real paradise what we found was really dissapointing: extremely high prices for dark and dirty rooms, old and sticky furniture, old mattresses and sheets. Outdated air conditionning is a real problem if you want to have a rest and it makes impossible to sleep even if your set is turned off but your neighbour's is working for the night. Not a core value.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: FlyingBurritoGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here two nights and it was great. It has several pools, several nice outdoor lounging areas, and a nice bar and restaurant. All have great views of the Caribbean and the grounds are just beautiful. A very relaxing place to just chill out and be warm and leave your cares behind.

Reviews.Title: “...a dream .... a paradise”
Reviews.Author: LevApart
Reviews.Content: ... I stayed at the hotel for three days... I visited Purto Rico with my family for a wedding.After the wedding we started making excursions at a lot of places!At Guanica we stayed at Copamarina ...The place cannot be described with simple words...Sometimes I look at the photos and I really miss everything.We also visited the island Guillingan but unfortunately because of the jelly fishes I had an allergy.Our rooms were comfortable and equipped with the necessary.The service was more than adequate and staff was very friendly !The price was very low(we stayed at Copamarina during November).We will certainly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: rvbolorin
Reviews.Content: Just returning from a 3 nights stay, with our 3 kids, our 3rd stay this year in Copamarina. We are from Puerto Rico and reallly enjoy to stay here. Clean, well kept, friendly staff, good food; we like to go to Gilligan's island and spend 2-3 hours each day. Keep in mind that if you go this time of the year, bring mosquito repellent. Is best to stay on weekdays. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Love the view and the music!!!”
Reviews.Author: Harlow S
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely dinner at the restaurant!! The Mofongo is to die for!! The views of the beach are super beautiful but the best this hotel has to offer is the live music!! The guitar player , (I believe his name was Tito) was amazing. It was very relaxing sitting at the bar and listening to his music!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Nancy49007
Reviews.Content: This hotel cost more money than we had initially wanted to spend, but after researching a lot of places in the vicinity, we were not able to find another property that we liked, and we knew that at the very least, this resort was located in an area we wanted to see. We arrived at night after driving along the beautiful, winding road that leads to the resort while the sun was setting. The layout of the hotel was very inviting - everything was open air and there was a refreshing lemonade-type drink available at reception. It was nice to have no entrance door to deal with, or any stairs or elevators. As we were checking in, we could see the restaurant, the bar and the beach beyond. When the man at check-in heard we were interested in hiking in the forest the next morning, he produced a nice booklet with lots of details on the trails and the fauna. He also spoke about the mosquitoes, of which we were already aware. We asked about an alternative activity since I wasn't keen on the bugs and he suggested kayaking. After dropping our luggage off in our room, we wasted no time in heading to the terrace for a drink and light dinner to discuss our options. The only negative here is that we were bitten by mosquitoes, and we wish we had put some bug spray on before we sat down. We could have had dinner indoors in the restaurant, but we really liked being outside by the beach. After eating, we saw that the water activities hut was still open, so we asked a few questions about kayaking and promptly decided to do that instead of hiking. Actually, I had decided I wanted to kayak a while back, but my husband loves to hike and needed a few reality bites from the mosquitoes (which we received at dinner) to change his thinking. So, the next morning we asked for a late check-out (from noon to 1pm) and kayaked to Gilligan's Island, where we saw lots of fish in the crystal clear water. We kayaked through narrow passageways in the mangroves where we were all alone. It was wonderful! We spent 2 hours paddling around and got some great exercise, which we had been craving after being stuck in the car most of the previous day. We made the most of our 1 night here, and although it was a bit pricey, it was a great romantic get-away for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: bgins
Reviews.Content: A well kept up resort with nice rooms and grounds. The beach is not so nice due to seaweed, but there is much to do in the area. We recommend the dry forest (bosque seco) for those who like to hike. Remember bug spray though. The food was good but somewhat pricey. Ask about the surcharge when booking as they won't tell you what it is until you get your bill. A real hint, if you like PR bakeries. Go back to Rt. 116, then toward Yauco for one exit on Rt.334 toward the dry forest. In the little town, on the first corner, is a bakery where you can load up for about 1/3 the price of the bigger cities!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds, beautiful views, and very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: crewfox
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 2-night weekend stay at Copamarina, motivated by a special gourmet wine tasting lunch hosted by the resort. We were overall very pleased with the hotel and our stay - the property is absolutely beautiful, and the grounds and facilities are all in impeccable conditions. The resort's privileged location on a quiet, shallow cove in Guanica pretty much guarantees a relaxing stay, as it is essentially bounded by a large nature preserve, so there is very little development in the area. The resort's staff is pleasant and very helpful - they seem genuinely happy that you are there. We took the hotel's complimentary boat shuttle to the nearby "ballenas" and "gilligan's island" beaches, both of which are really the highlight of the location - very shallow (2-3 feet), crystalline waters surrounded by mangrove trees, with gorgeous views over the Caribbean sea. For those who prefer pools to the ocean, the hotel has several, including a few areas that are perfect for kids. The dining at the resort is terrific: the fine-dining restaurant, Alexandra's, is run by one of the top chefs in Puerto Rico, Alfredo Ayala. His cuisine is superb, and we enjoyed both meals we had there thoroughly. The more casual Las Palmas cafÃ© serves a good breakfast buffet, and also has lots of options for snacks, lunch and dinner. We loved its open-air design, with a beautiful view of the ocean and grounds from any table and the bar. Overall, we highly recommend this resort for both couples and families looking for a quiet getaway with good service and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: Jarisa4
Reviews.Content: The most amazing views, rooms, food and employees are in there. All in one place! I love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: haddy0
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent, well run hotel. The Hotel sits on a beautiful, clean beach about ten minutes from the little town of Guanica. Maybe fifteen to twenty minutes south from Route 2. Our room was long and narrow with louvered door and window coverings. All the expected amenities were readily at hand. The room was very quiet both nights we stayed there though I could hear the folks talking in the adjoining room during the early evening while we were getting ready for dinner. The hotel staff was very helpful in arranging scuba diving for my buddy. He was very pleased with both dives he experienced. The food was excellent for all meals and it would be hard to fault the kitchen in either selection or preparation. This is a very refined place and not raucous in any way. It's not a "party" place. The two pools are very large and well maintained. I don't think you will regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a low key vacation”
Reviews.Author: HPHill1015
Reviews.Content: We went here for our honeymoon in mid October 2011 and it was a nice place to stay. We flew into Ponce and had a car pick us up (you can call the hotel to reserve this). Glad we had someone drive because in the dark, the road to the hotel is very narrow with lots of turns. If you don't know it, it's probably frightening to drive. The service was better than average but a lot of the folks seemed bothered by our presence or need for service. It's also very slow...if you're from the NE USA, you'll know what I mean! Alfredo in Las Palmas restaurant gave the best food service but most of the bartenders are terse and slightly rude. The rooms are nothing fancy, but with a private beach, public beach within walking distance and two pools to enjoy, we spent little time in there except to sleep. The beach is not great for swimming and has lots of seagrass which can be off-putting but the water is clear and warm and nice to cool off in! Lounge chairs on the beach aren't the best but they are fine. I suggest walking to the public beach as you can swim out and enjoy not getting knocked over by waves. Gilligans Island was a little disappointing. It's basically a bug filled island full of trees and iguanas and the jellyfish were out in full force. Fun for 2 hours or so, but nothing more. Take water and bug spray with you-there are no facilities there. The food was typical resort food. Alexandras was closed and there were special events over the weekend so it was unavailable to eat in. Las Palmas has an OK menu but is very limited so after the 4th night we started running out of things to eat. But you have to try the conch fritters. Super tasty. Breakfast was great especially the tropical fruit plate. The drinks were definitely watered down, so if you're looking to get a buzz on, drink beer or watch them open a new bottle of liquor. It was almost frustrating. The last night and day we stayed was the weekend and it started to get pretty crowded but before that there were few people there. The grounds are really nicely kept and the greenery surrounding the pool (especially the one near the club house) is absolutely beautiful. If you like to have snacks or drinks at night, make sure to hit up the little shop before 6 because that's when they closed during the weeknights and everything is of course, astronomically priced--$15 can of sunblock! Yikes! Just stock up before you go. Also, the bar/outdoor restaurant closed as early as 9:00 one night we were there even though they say they are open later. All in all it was a nice place to stay...not perfect but perfectly relaxing and quite beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it there!”
Reviews.Author: bkshores
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely spot. The beach is nice and comfortable, and the rooms were just fine. We loved that they had Aveda products in the room. We were there during low season, so we had the beach and the pools often to ourselves. It is a bigger hotel/resort than we are used to, but found it a really nice place. We paid about 149.00 per night and feel that was fair, but would not want to pay much more. One note, pass on the restaurant. It was expensive and we only ate there twice. Dinner and a breakfast. It was not worth it, plus we loved eating in local communities. We went to Yauco several times and found some fun restaurants there. Also, we ate food with the street/truck vendors which was inexpensive and tasty. We did a day trip to Rincon while we were there and spent time in the Guanica' dry forest. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cristina A
Reviews.Content: Just an hour and a half from San Juan but feels a world away. The hotel has beautiful views and surroundings. Just a five minute boat ride to Guilligan's Island one of the most beautiful and secluded beaches in Puerto Rico. It is a great place to relax and unwind. All the staff was extremely nice including spa and wait staff. The food at Alexandra and breakfast at Las Palmas was incredible, try cinnamon ice cream yum!!! We will definitely go back for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: k k
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the Resort. As we have been traveling in low-season, we had to share most of the resort only with a few people - if it is busy, the situation might a more challenging. The beach of the resort was fine, it was a typical tropical living beach with sandy and muddy spots and some fished and crabs around, not the artificially created pure sands which other places may have. We liked also the pools, which have been fine also with the kids. Particularly, we liked the restaurant, which served overall the best food on our trip (we have been in the alfresco part, not in the air-conditioned one, as we hate those fridges). In principle, the two parts have different menus, but as of the low-season, they seemed to share. The rooms have been quite ok and rather well-maintained, though we had to notice that a refurbishment would be an option for future. A major draw-back was the old air condition directly below the sea-side window. As all rooms are adjacent and have the AC at the same location, one couldn't leave the sea-side door and windows open, because - even if you turned off your own AC - the noise level was simply too high because of the neighbor's ACs.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!! It should be called "Crapamarina!"”
Reviews.Author: TamMidland_Michigan
Reviews.Content: We attempted to stay here for the 2nd week of our honeymoon. Tolerated one night only because we were forced to after travelling all day and arrived too late to leave. We paid a one-night's stay in cancellation fee (over $400) just to get out of there! It is not a resort but rather a minimally acceptable 2-star hotel. There is no beach but instead a mucky, fishy-smelling strip of land that meets muddy water. The rooms are run down and in need of repair and cleaning. The pools are overchlorinated and non-usable. Staff is aloof and unprofessional. We've travelled extensively and have many other resorts to compare this to, so it's not without experience that we offer this review. We moved, after one night, to El Conquistator in Fajardo and found a beautiful resort! And, we paid even a few dollars per night less than Copamarina was charging. The website is very deceiving, beware of a stay here. It's not what is presented in the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JustGo69
Reviews.Content: We traveled during the hurricane season, so it was not very busy. Even through the sometimes cloudy weather and rain at times, it was a great time to visit. Our room was very clean and the housekeeping staff did an excellent job! Every person on staff was super friendly and very helpful. Of course the restaurant and bar was a little more expensive due to being a resort, but the excellent hospitality of the servers made up for it!! I would definitely recommend for either couples or families. The area is a little off the beaten path and on the south side of the island and away from the more tourist areas. Rent a car and you'll have no problem getting around. This is not a 5 star New York style hotel but it is worth the stay for a tropical beachfront resort! Also catch a ride to the Gilligans Island while your there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Human Resources in the Industry!”
Reviews.Author: Frances M
Reviews.Content: This trip was intended as a honeymoon for our best friends and an escape for us during school.The attention and effort to offer us a room suited for both reasons were amazing. Haydee and Jen from reservations and Leslie in Front desk help to chose the best room in the hotel. All employees were kind and genuinely devoted to make you feel cherish the whole time. This is my 5th time here and won't be my last. Puerto Rico is full of beaches, but the human factors make it outstanding. If you want great service and a nice place to relax, look no more than the front desk and you'll be blown away. Thank for the Manager Mr.OrtÃ­z, your crew are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time”
Reviews.Author: yolyrodz
Reviews.Content: It is a nice place to be away from everything. Although is not a swimming beach is a relaxation place. Nice for couples or travelling with small children. The food is superb

Reviews.Title: “Average at best...”
Reviews.Author: Longhorn_Frog
Reviews.Content: Gotta go with the other negative comments. We were surprised as well. First thing, we had to change rooms because our first room was close to the side of the hotel that uses "reclaimed" water to water the lawns. The most awful smell of pure sewage was overwhemling. The worst part is that we paid for one of the best rooms! They were, however, gracious and allowed us to change rooms...the next day. They would not move us that evening. This property is more like a glorified motel than a resort - you can actually see daylight around both the front and back door, thereby allowing multi-legged critters to enter; such as the ants in the bed that bit my husband. The food selection was minimal and NEVER changed, plus most of the time they got the order wrong. The concerierge service is poor at best. If you ask the front desk about a place for fishing, they give you a pamphlet and say to call. Same for the spa on the property and anything else you might want. There are no complimentary activities - you must rent everything. Very loud A/C wall units in each room. On the positive side, the property grounds are immaculate. Part of the issue for us may have been the off season, but that is usually when we like to travel - it's very different in Puerto Rico. Off season here means self service and most of the surrounding towns are only open for business on the weekends. We do like the location of this property - be sure you have a rental car and visit some of the surrounding towns if you will be here for longer than just a couple of days. I don't believe the price charged for this property equals the quality.

Reviews.Title: “It was Okay for what it was”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: need to change beds and bedframes need to change the AC system the beach was not nice the trip to ballena island was nice good service we had to wait 2 hours for our room to be ready but oh well

Reviews.Title: “Shocked...”
Reviews.Author: TNTS2011
Reviews.Content: I read these reviews and am shocked by the 4's & 5's.. I cannot believe, like someone said before, they stayed at the same place we came from. I can go on and on as to why you should go somewhere else, but the *poor* reviews here have covered them all. I don't know WHERE the people that give this place 4 & 5's have stayed before, but this is no 4 or 5 star resort. The staff was polite, yes, but that didn't make up for the completely unusable beach, outdated/worn out loungers, beach *beds* are broken, food is horrible AND expensive, rooms cleaning service is sporadic at best, way too isolated considering the town is in is a desolate, sketchy looking part of town, so even when you want to go hunting for food - which any decent palate will - get ready for a trip. My goodness, it was bad and we stood there 10 days! Stuck, because Expedia cannot offer refunds, etc. Really, stay away from this place, don't be deceived, like I was, from the great reviews. I don't know what these people were thinking!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful spot from which to explore southwestern Puerto Rico, but seems to be a bit unsure of its identity.”
Reviews.Author: AHL67
Reviews.Content: The resort has much to recommend it: a lovely, quiet spot, immediately adjacent to the Guanica Dry Forest reserve. The grounds are impeccably groomed, the rooms spacious, the pools clean and refreshing, the staff helpful and friendly (mostly). The food is superb. All in all, it was a lovely spot in which to spend a few days. However, we felt at times as if the resort were having an identity crisis. The prices, and aspects of the ambience, suggest a desire to be a high-end resort. The setting was certainly spectacular enough to support such aspirations. A few details still need to be worked out, however, before we would feel that the high-end prices ($850 per night plus tax and resort fees) were warranted. First: despite paying a 10% resort fee, we discovered that everything required more fees or deposits. $15 per towel as a safety deposit (refundable if you return the towels), $20 per hour for kayak rentals...it adds up, and makes one chafe at also paying a resort fee. Second: our rooms were cooled by air conditioners that were louder than any I have ever heard in my life. It sounded, quite literally, as if an 18-wheeler were idling in our room...we could not hear each other speak while it was on. In a budget hotel, I would happily tolerate this kind of of thing. But at high-end prices, I would think an investment in new, quieter AC would be warranted. These are minor points, and would not change my overall assessment of the resort, but they did temper our enthusiasm for the resort a bit. Overall, though, it is a wonderful place to stay, and we had a relaxing and pleasant few days.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous! Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: donnagn
Reviews.Content: To start off, I absolutely recommend Acevedo Tours for your transportation needs. We chose not to rent a car, and I think it was the best decision. The road to the resort was narrow and very curvy! Arnold was our driver fron Mayaguez airport. Arnold gave us so much information about the city on the way to the resort, which was an "added bonus". We arrived to the resort in style, and were blown away by the beauty. Thank you Arnold! Our trip was during the last week of July, 2011. We reserved an Oceanview room, but the front desk allowed us to take a look at the oceanview and the beacfront rooms, in case we wanted to change. Both room were beautiful, but we stuck with the Oceanview. The grounds are immaculate, full of beautiful Plumeria trees and bouganvilla. There were also mango, coconut and grapefruit trees. The grounds alone would be reason to visit Copamarina! We chose the "All-Inclusive" package from the resort, which was a bit more cost effective for our trip. The meals are a bit pricey from the 2 restaurants. The meals were nice, and I suggest trying the mofongo with grouper from the Palms Cafe(outdoors). Breakfast was the nicest, with an assortment of frsesh fruits, pastries, pancakes, omelettes, etc. And delicious coffee! Watch out for the lizards the sneak underfoot to grab morsels of food! My only complaint was the wait staff at the outdoor cafe. They are VERY laid back. So be prepared to wait for servive. Getting a drink at the bar was also frustrating. I suggest ordering several at once, as to not get your buzz killed. My favorite was the Puerto Rican Iced Tea! The beach at the resort was amazing! The beautiful blue waters and the palm trees beg you to relax... There were plenty of lounge chairs, beds (yes, beds!) on the sand for you to relax. Water sports available are kayaking (fun), snorkeling and wind surfing. There was also a bot to Gilligans Island, but a bridge was broken at the time of our trip, so the Coast Guard closed it until it could be repaired. : ( There is a nice public beach in walking distance, if you want to grill. It was very crowded, though. The staff at Copamarina were all so nice, always greeting you with a smile and a hello. The staff at the front desk always remembered my name (a nice, personal touch), and were very helpful with info regarding what to do around the resort. The Copamarina is a great place for couples, friends and families. There were plenty of kids there, yet we never felt "overwhelmed". I would highly recommend staying at the Copamarina. It's a bit pricey, but it's absolutely worth it and I would do it again(and I plan to)!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice!”
Reviews.Author: gfrary
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Grounds were beautiful. This is not a beach with a crashing surf.It is very calm water. You need to take a water taxi out to Gilligan's Island to do any serious swimming.

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE!!!”
Reviews.Author: tlocations
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort for 2 nights and never wanted to leave. This is a wonderful place. We sipped mojitos in the hot tub while watching the sun go down over the Caribbean. We eat dinner at the outside bar, walked along the beach and enjoyed the spacious room. This place can get a bit pricey but worth every second. Absolutly one of my favorite hide aways in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrific!”
Reviews.Author: lindagaf
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe that the people who wrote these reviews stayed at the same place we stayed at. We are a very experienced travelling family and stay in everything from Waldorf Astoria resorts, to Best Westerns, to self catering, to camping. We've been to Europe, Mexico, the Caribbean, and all over the US, including Hawaii. The Copamarina Beach Resort is hands down the worst place our family has EVER stayed. Frommers recommended it as having a great beach, which left us scratching our heads. Possibly ten years ago, at best, it might have deserved good reviews. Here was our experience: 1. Overpowering musty, mildewy stench in rooms. 2. Bedspreads not washed in years. 3. Squished mosquitos all over walls. 4. Filth in corners of bathroom, stains and marks all over walls. 5. Horribly battered furniture, stained, old and worn out. 6. Nasty cheap pillows, blankets with holes in them. 7. Trash littering the grass of our patio. 8. Stench of sewage wafting over beach at all times. 9. Weird squelchy sand in the sea and too shallow to swim, covered with sea grass with algae all over it. 10. So little sand on beach that kids can't even make a sandcastle, just hard earth. 11. One pool cloudy and unhygenic, the other with a thick coating of grime at water level. 12. Ugly chain link fence running along the boundary of the beach. 13. My family were attacked by horrid biting flies and mosquitos at the restaurant, making it clear that this hotel doesn't adequately spray for insect control. 13. Outrageously overpriced. We paid the exact same nightly rate at El Conquistador, a palace in comparison! 14. The nearby Guilligans Island, one of the primary reasons we chose this place, was nothing more than a nice picnic spot overflowing with trash. VERY disappointing. There were a couple of things that were okay. The staff were friendly. The grounds look nice, at first glance. The beach restaurant was surprisingly good, despite the fact that my family were attacked by insects. This place was a dump in nearly every other aspect. Absolutely appalling. They didn't even argue with me when I refused to pay the "resort" fee. This is fair warning, you will be disappointed and ripped off if you choose to stay here. We also stayed at El Conquistador, a palace, for the exact same price. Consider yourselves warned.

Reviews.Title: “"Be sure you are ready for the breathtaking views, but know about MOSQUITOES!”
Reviews.Author: DollyToy05
Reviews.Content: Ok! This place is breathtaking! It is enclosed in the Guanica Bay, a historic site in Puerto Rico and shielded from the showers that may hurt your few vacation days in Puerto Rico! However, between 7 p.m. and 10 a.m. the mosquitoes are BRUTAL! Be sure you are not looking to dress like a runway model (and who would in PR :), and have all your weapons at the ready. These mosquitoes are commandoes! Also, the real beach is a boat ride away (and $7 per person!) OR you can walk to the "Balneario," the public beach and back to the resort. The beach at the resort is covered with clingy algae that may or may not give you a funny feeling in your legs :) Overall, a very relaxing place with amazing sunsets! Just be prepared!

Reviews.Title: “A piece of paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Bombonsito
Reviews.Content: I haven't stay in this place for quite some time.I booked my night stay through Expedia and got a great deal.This place has changed 100% for the best.Rooms are so clean,bathroom mold free,toiletries-Aveda.The front desk staff,curteous,attentive,polite & friendly.Our coffee maker didn't work,so we ordered a new one.Not only the lady that brought it appologized for it to be warm & late,but she said that she needed to try it and she gave me extra coffee.All the staff was super friendly.From the security guard,to the drink girl.The gardens were pristine & they have a lot of gazebos & platform beds.We took a lot of pictures.Not the place I used to remember. This is a piece of paradise tucked in the middle of nowhere.Perfect place to recharge!

Reviews.Title: “It was terrible and unfortunately my family will not be back.”
Reviews.Author: saridavruh
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Puerto Rico and going to Copamarina as a child and adult. My husband and I currently live in the US but were going to visit family in Puerto Rico. As part of our trip we decided to go and have a few days in the south coast in Guanica with our 6 month old son. Before we went I told my husband that I grew up going to this resort and that it was quite lovely and tropical. When we got there it was not the hotel of my childhood. Our room was full of mold, spider webs, not cleaned thoroughly and the A/C was not working. The first (and only) night our A/C woke us up in the middle of the night making banging noises. The next day we requested for the A/C to be fixed. They immediately came and "fixed" it. In the middle of the day when our baby was taking a nap the A/C started to smoke. After we stopped the A/C, I told my husband that we could not stay. Our baby had gotten diarrhea and allergies from the mold and dust in the room, the A/C was blowing smoke, and the room was moldy and not really clean. We instantly decided to leave and informed the front desk. They told us that they would charge us for the remainder of the day and night, but we did not care. At no point during checkout did they ask why we would leave late in the afternoon, if there was something wrong, or if there was something making us leave. I apologize for the long story, but I had to share my unfortunate experience in Copamarina. I really hope that they fix up the place and make it how it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheGuyLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Copamarina for 2 nights and enjoyed it very much. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are large (we had a king size bed). The front desk personnel are very friendly and helpful as are the restaruant workers. My wife had a pedicure at the spa, and loved it. The beach was lovely as were the pools on site. We were there during the off season, so the resort wasn't very crowded. Our only regret is that we didn't stay there longer.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: FourBeavers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two kids, ages 7 & 8, and had a fabulous experience. The staff are friendly & helpful, the grounds are beautiful, and the resort is completely self-contained. The restaurants might not be winning any awards, but they were good, and the fact that we could walk to the bar & restaurants 50 steps from our room was far more important that award winning food. Our room was clean, bathroom is spacious, and perfectly adequate for a family of 4. You do need water shoes to swim at the beach right outside of your room, and they sell them in the little resort shop for a very reasonable price if you didn't bring any. It might not be the best swimming beach in PR, but we enjoyed it and my kids had a blast anyway. I highly recommend this resort. It was a wonderful break from the high-rises of Isla Verde, which is where we spent the remainder of our 2 weeks in PR. It was relaxing, beautiful, and clean, and offered a different experience than the San Juan area had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “La Gente, La Cultura y La Comida”
Reviews.Author: trivialpursuit
Reviews.Content: We dig a bit deeper than most tourists and enjoy the heck out of it! Much better than schlepping through the streets of OLD TOWN, going through the shops and stops-although that was fun too, for the first and last nights we were in PR. The Five nights we spent at the other side of the island were more glorious and meaningful: Stayed at the Copamarina Resort in Guanica, a self contained , out of the way destination, that shared the richness of the people's hospitality with family centric charm. We were stuck in traffic, saw beautiful clean clear water, beaches in Rincon and had a blast getting to know the populace. (Except for the manager at the Burger King near the National Guard Training Center - who had another attitude, altogether.) We will go back. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Laid-back resort, relaxing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gummycandy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in June. It was quiet, being off-season in PR the resort was not crowded or loud. The beach here is nice to sit on but it's not a swimming beach - there is lots of sea grass and it's very shallow. Gilligan's Island is a quick trip offshore and a better place to swim in the crystal blue ocean. The pools, however, are nice and very refreshing! The food is pricey (IMO) and just OK at the casual cafe. We arranged to have breakfast included with our rate and it saved us from having to pay $15/pp for breakfast out of pocket. Grounds are well-kept and the rooms are comfortable. Flat screen TVs are a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Ivette1969
Reviews.Content: I have to say that our experience had been GREAT. The service was excellent. Thanks to Nicole, Ivan, Adlyn n Alexandra they made our stay more fun.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views outside my bedroom window! Wonderful Service! I want to bring the entire family next time...”
Reviews.Author: lbnytx
Reviews.Content: My room was clean and efficient; the view sells it completely. The amentites were abundant. Make sure you bring swim shoes when you go to tiny island of Gulligans on their boat. It is a worthwile day trip (coral reef). The beach is lovely. Make sure you take pictures of the cactus fields across from the hotel. Also, the bar makes the best Pina Colada you have ever tasted!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful tropical paradise!”
Reviews.Author: glorinadal
Reviews.Content: As you check in you breath relaxation. Every room overlooks the ocean. They are very comfortable and spacious. The grounds of the hotel are extremely manicured and they have a wide variety of tropical plants. The employees are very friendly and ready to assist you. The dinning facilities are satisfying, and the quality of the food is superb. You can choose between a more relaxed, outdoor restaurant; " Las Palmas "or their more formal one, "Alexandra". I highly recommend a visit to Copamarina.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELENT”
Reviews.Author: Frank147320
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well kept, the service is Excelent and the food divine.

Reviews.Title: “Best birthday surprise ever!"”
Reviews.Author: javimorales
Reviews.Content: I planned a getaway weekend to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday in Copa Marina and it turned out to be blast. From the start everything was relaxing and fun. We had dinner the first night at Alexandra Restaurant (excellent food!) and we received a complimentary birthday cake. The next day it was all about the pool, beach and paddle boarding. We were going to try out the Hobbie's, but there wasn't enough time. The trip was too short. Next time i'll stay for the whole week.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in winter time”
Reviews.Author: viviavila_11
Reviews.Content: Last Christmas at the last minute we decided to go to a warm place. First we were thinking about Mexico, but one of our kids had an expired passport, so we had to settle for Puerto Rico. It was the best decision. It was an easy 2 hour flight from Atlanta with no hassles with immigration and passports. The people are super friendly. The hotel is on the caribbean side of the island, which means the weather is warmer and the ocean is beautiful. The hotel's architecture is what you want on a beach vacation, tropical looking, relaxed with gorgeous gardens. The reception doesn't even have walls, the weather is so nice. The rooms are nice, the beds not so soft, but we noticed that the day we were leaving there was a big truck with new mattresses. Across the beach there are absolutely gorgeous islands to go snorkling. The water is calm and safe, perfect for little kids to learn how to snorkle. The water is so clear that back home people thought I was filming a swimming pool. There are kayaks to rent, you can play volleyball, and rent snorkle equipment. The beach right in front of the hotel has a lot of vegetation, but you should walk on the pier and jump on the water. It is crystal clear, and like a giant swimming pool. Fabulous! If you walk the sand stretch from the hotel you will find a public beach where the locals go and it is perfect for little kids. If possible remember to go during the full moon so you can swimm at night in the bioluminescent waters. Out of this world! The restaurant is pricey. We bought food at the grocery store and kept snacks and breakfast food in the mini fridge. The local restaurants in town are reasonable and you can get cuban sandwiches at the bakery for about $2.50. During weekends the hight life is very lively in the little town. Lots of dancing and live puerto rican music. I have 3 teens and they had a blast. If you are ready to have a foreign experience with the comfort of feeling at home, Puerto Rico is the place.

Reviews.Title: “The Wonderful Copamarina!”
Reviews.Author: sarahmclellan
Reviews.Content: We needed a break from the world for 5 days and Copamarina was the ideal tonic! The staff could not have been kinder and more helpful.
