Every time we made a request, it was met with a smile and the feeling that they would do whatever it took to make it happen. The staffs in the restaurants were so friendly--especially, the waitress, Lilliam, provided us with specific details as to the cuisine and individual ingredient questions. The bar tenders were always friendly, and willing to try something new. The resort itself is ideal if you are looking for a relaxed, quiet vacation. The views and sunsets are breathtaking. Make sure you take a few hours to visit Gilligan's Island--it is well worth it. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: jaimitoeldecaimito
Reviews.Content: After seeing some of the negative reviews I wanted to clarify a few things for prospective guests. If you are looking for stuff to do late at night, you will not find it here: this is a place for relaxing. The beach in front of the hotel itself is mucky, as it is adjacent to a mangrove swamp. At times the smell of the swamp gets to the hotel. On the other hand we got to see some of the amazing birds, no doubt due to the proximity of the mangrove. A short walk away is CaÃ±a Gorda Beach which is nice, and the hotel has a private shuttle boat to beautiful "Gilligans's Island" (Cayo Aurora, officially). Gilligan's can get very crowded on weekends, beware- get there early. We have stayed several times at this hotel: the service has been outstanding and the facilities impeccable always. The all-inclusive package is worth every penny. The one time we did have a problem with our bathroom somebody from the hotel staff was there to check it in less than 5 mins, and when they couldn't fix it they changed us to an equivalent room, all within 30 mins... on New Year's Day. You can also take a short drive to some of the outstanding beaches to the east (like Tamarindo). And the adjacent dry forest is definitely worth exploring - with the necessary precautions: the heat can be suffocating even in the early morning, some of the smaller trails are poorly marked, and you must keep an eye out for mountain bikers. Overall an excellent experience. Every time we leave we are already thinking of when we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ouverte
Reviews.Content: I struggle with this review because I want to make it clear that I really enjoyed my stay here very much. The location, grounds, and natural quiet setting of the resort are beautiful. I loved it because it was smaller, and off the beaten path. The pools were wonderful and you could choose the more populated pool by the beach or the more secluded. I do think people need to know that this is a place to relax and not a resort bustling with activities. (One of the main reasons I selected it) That being said, even for a smaller resort, the maid service was lacking, and the showers could use some improvement. The bar by the back pool wasn't open at all when we were there, nor was the sunset cruise, nor the snorkeling...all of which was disappointing but we got over it. The front desk was very helpful. The spa was just okay, but again it's not a luxury resort. It has the potential to be incredible with a little attention to details. We traveled with our kids ages 10 and 17, and stayed for 3 days before heading to San Juan. They did charge us extra for our 17 year old son, which I thought to be odd......

Reviews.Title: “will keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: pmllmd
Reviews.Content: I went with my children during holy week and we enjoyed the vacation very much. The food was excellent. Will continue to come back. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing long weekend with our young daughter”
Reviews.Author: Sya8
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for families! My husband and I were able to rest and relax, believe it or not ,with our active 4 year old!! Copamarina has a great staff, beautiful grounds and dining at Alexander's was just excellent. We all got what we wanted. I wanted to rest, read, have an afternoon cocktail with the best view ever; my husband wanted to exercise at the gym, go paddle boarding, walk on the beach and enjoy great food, and finally our 4 year old went to all 4 pools, Gilligans, met other girls her age and played twice a day on the playground! We loved how the staff is so child friendly, even at Alexander's, we were able to enjoy a nice dinner and wine. We will surely be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: familiaviajerapr
Reviews.Content: Copamarina is a small hotel in a beautiful setting with beautiful landscaping which provides fun for all ages. The room was very clean and very comfortably appointed. We stayed at the "villa", a 3-bedroom, full kitchen, dining room, family room and "hacienda-style" terrace all around, accomodation which was perfect for our family vacation. There are two pools and two kiddie pools plus a jacuzzi, all very clean. We cooked and had most our meals in the villa, but one night we went to the fine dining restaurant on site, Alexandra, which was really good!! The hotel is beach front and also provides transportation by motor boat to a nearby mangrove island known as Guilligan's Island. Copamarina offers a perfect get away to relax and disconnect (there is wi-fi in case you can't). We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Our third visit”
Reviews.Author: ogewyawa
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Copa Marina and we were so excited to return. I still 100% stand behind this as one of the most relaxing places to stay with small children but, we were a bit let down this trip. On our first visit our kids were 2 and 6, the second time 3 and 7 - I feel maybe we overlooked some shortcomings because of how brilliantly suited this hotel is to young kids. The multiple kiddie pools, the super shallow side of the front pool with it's fountain, the shallow surf as well as the breakfast by the playground make for a very relaxing trip. This visit our kids were 7 and 11 so without those great benefits appealing to this age group we found the following shortcomings and standouts: Not much in the way of activities for kids that might like more independent. Though this was our 3rd trip they had no record of us and said we couldn't accrue our visits to the frequent visitor program. Our room, #301 was a handicapped room and the bathroom floor would soak after every shower. It also felt smaller than we remembered which may have been because the handicapped bathroom was larger and diminished the room size. In hind site we should have asked for another room. In the past with the meal plan, we received lunch and dinner on the day we arrived and breakfast and lunch on the day of departure. The policy has changed so for two nights stay we received only dinner on arrival day and breakfast on departure. 5 meals instead of 7. The really is no where else for a nice meal in the area so we took the plan and the food was overall very good. We had exceptional food and service at Alexanders. Another great experience that we remembered was visiting the bar to listen to music and play dominoes. WE FOUND THIS EXPERIENCE TO BE EVERY BIT AS LOVELY AS WE REMEMBERED. Nice place overall.

Reviews.Title: “impressive staff even in difficult situations”
Reviews.Author: davidascanio
Reviews.Content: first night was a nighmare due to a private event in swimming pool 2 with loud music and people screaming until 11pm. But, the manager called on the following days to apologize and reimbursed 50 percent of the room price for that night. Staff and management are obviously trained to serve the needs of their clients.

Reviews.Title: “Picture perfect”
Reviews.Author: KayPrice40
Reviews.Content: We LOVED being there. Right on the beach, very well kept very lovely grounds. The staff were all very friendly. Truly a lovely place to relax. We loved eating on the beachside open restaurant. Our attire: bathing suit and pareo, (sarong). The weather could't have been better. However, the snorkling is not good, even on Gilligan's beautiful island water. We spoke with fellow guests, and many had been there previously, some many times. We would come again. Soooo peaceful and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Back for the fourth time, for good reasons”
Reviews.Author: howkar
Reviews.Content: This small resort in southwest Puerto Rico has become our New England winter antidote for the fourth time. We have found the service to be friendly and competent in each of our stays, with friendly, competent, and completely bi-lingual staff. Our room, yes, we have a favorite room, which Copamarina has provided us each time, is on the second floor of one of the two story buildings on a campus filled with tropical greeneries. The balcony of our room looks past the swimming pools and the beach to the Caribbean - perfect place for afternoon cocktails. The amenities suit our needs - two restaurants, hot tubs, an excellent exercise room and a variety of massage therapies by appointment. For us, the best feature is Copamarina's size. To be there more than a couple of days guarantees meeting very interesting people. What we like the least is the trip from San Juan - about two and a half hours by car. But this is a small thing, considering our objective is escape. Going next year? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Debs692
Reviews.Content: Service awful - staff/management do not care. they take a holding deposit without telling you - they took $1050.00 from us!! Food in both bar and restaurant is the same (only difference being the size of portion and the amount you pay) Book the Hilton in Ponce instead

Reviews.Title: “A Monastery Has Less Rules”
Reviews.Author: Lita1948
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rustic resort with a hidden treasure, Guilligan's Island, that must be visited at least once during your stay. The grounds are beautifully maintained. Pools are the perfect temperature and very welcoming. The least welcoming part of our stay was upon arriving the Front Desk person informed us that we were not allowed to have any visitors of any kind in our very EXPENSIVE "suite". I said that my 85 year old father, who is a resident of the island, would be visiting us for the day and I was told he would not be allowed to enter the suite. When I objected I was told that it was a "new island law" (a lie) and to "speak to the manager". I felt I was checking into a "monastery" where monks aren't allowed visitors in their rooms. The hotel needs to revamp their policies and concentrate more on retraining their staff on making guests feel welcomed i.e. a hello or smile when you pass a guest on the grounds gives a welcoming feeling; their food service staff does not know how to keep their attention on the patrons needs even when there are just two tables of guests & six waiters. All in all I would come back to this resort because it is a real beauty that just needs some tweaking.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like we had the resort to ourselves, beautifuly maintained property.”
Reviews.Author: Brockfamily5
Reviews.Content: This property was beautifully maintained and right on the beach. The water is not at all inviting as it is covered in thick seaweed. We didn't see one person in the water on the hotels property. There is a public beach that is a short 5 minute walk. This beach was filled with locals and wasn't much cleaner. You need to watch your step as there is trash (bottle caps and such) around. I was very disappointed that the hotel did not clean up the beach area. The rooms are older yes, but they are very clean. Every staff member we met was extremely kind and professional. Anything we needed, like extra towels, iron even the microwave was brought to our room within minutes of requesting it. To make your "family dollar" stretch further, I would highly recommend you visit a grocery store before getting into the town of Guinica as there are no large grocery stores to be found, no decent restaurants as far as that goes too. There are small refrigerators in the room and like I mentioned, we requested a microwave too. You are at the mercy of the resorts 2 restaurants. One being very over-priced. The other option is eating at the open air bar. The setting there is very nice and enjoyable. Each night we were there, there was a live musician. The food was very good, although the kitchen staff seems to have problems following special instructions with certain dishes. Each time we ate there, they messed up at least one item. Our last meal was the worst, as my husband's appetizer order was never placed and the waitress delivered 2 of our 4 meals way before the others where prepared. Not to mention the french fry issue...but that's a long story~ Anyway, the manager was quick to respond and made our meal complimentary, which pleased us. There is a small gift shop where you can purchase soda/water and ice cream bars. Three ice cream bars set us back $8.00. There you can rent snorkeling gear and kayaks. My children and I did the "snorkeling tour". Which was a waste of good money. The coral reef which is just off the beach, was dead, the water way to choppy for snorkeling (even dangerous) and super cloudy. We saw just a few fish although, the captain takes you to where there a lot of large, live starfish. That was neat, but not at all worth the money. True snorkeling can happen at Culebra. If you have the opportunity to travel to the east side of the island, try that. Gilligan's Island is a very neat experience. We rented the snorkeling gear and took the little boat ride (which the hotel provides for a small fee). We were there on a weekday and there where roughly 40 locals. We choose to carry our cooler and gear over our heads and waded through the water to the other little island. There we felt as though we had the place to ourselves! There were hundreds of little fish that we could watch along the roots of the trees. We set up camp there and 3 hours went by way to fast. This is the second time I traveled to Puerto Rico. After experiencing the east coast, I wanted to see the south west coast. Even though I did enjoy my stay, I would recommend staying on the east coast. There are more restaurant options and more to "do". Pretty much anywhere you travel on the island, there are poor communities and narrow roads. I was hoping that wouldn't have been the case here, but it was. Also, the front staff recommended we eat at the Blue Marlin Restaurant...big mistake. Please see my review of the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: DD1745
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Copamarina Resort last week and we had the best, relaxing vacation ever!!! The staff was friendly, very clean rooms, quiet setting away from the tourists!!! It was a little hard to find, being it was in a remote area, but that is exactly what we were looking for. The food was good, weather was PERFECT!! We will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Low key resort popular with families”
Reviews.Author: Bobxtwo
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed at only one other resort, so don't have much to compare with the Copamarina. Here's what we liked: the relaxed, lowkey atmosphere; the beautiful setting; the ease of doing various activities (snorkeling & sea kayaking). Our room was large & nicely situated with a view of the bay. And although the resort was full when we stayed, it didn't feel that way. Our children are grown & did not come with us, but we enjoyed that there were many families -- both Anglo & Spanish-speaking -- there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Relaxing Friendly Place”
Reviews.Author: sssbkm
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Copamarina the past two years for Spring Break (March) and we love the place. Of course its location is somewhat remote, and Caribbean sea beach is shallow with lots of seagrass (but crystal clear). However, if you can make do with a beautiful tropical "open air" setting in which to relax, soak up some sun, hang by the pool, snorkel, sea kayak, throw the football on the grass, play tennis, hike, drink and eat outside, then you can't find a better place. At Copa, you are getting away from the usual tourist/vacation scene, you can let the kids roam, and the setting is georgeous. When you are in one of the pools, you are literally 50 feet from the Carribean and your room across the manicured lawn too is so close to the water. Very conducive for cocktails. Yes, there is no carpet on floor in the rooms and the bathrooms are not modern, but when you can comfortably/appropriately never have to wear more than a bathing suit (and shirt) all day, its an easy trade off. But don't let the low key setting fool you, the service all around is excellent (the front desk staff is especially helpful), there are two good restaurants, a great bar, and the grounds are very, very well maintained. While the food is relatively overpriced by mainland standards, that's the case throughout Puerto Rico at good restaurants and hotels, but the overall value/experience of Copamarina is hard to beat anywhere in the Caribbean. Great for families and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Third Visit and disappointed, What happened to the Scuba!!!”
Reviews.Author: stevefig123
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positive, the grounds are beautiful and very well kept and the staff is very friendly. This was my third visit to the hotel and every visit I make they eliminate activities I enjoy. Several years ago there where jet ski rentals, and this past visit they eliminated the on-site scuba diving. Scuba diving was my main reason for staying at Copamarina. Now you have to drive 30min at 6:45am to go diving. My next visit to PR I'll stay in Rincon where the diving boat is only a 5 min drive from many hotels. This hotel is really off the beaten path and there's not much to do in the area so on-site activities for guest should be there priority.

Reviews.Title: “Clean up the beach.”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel0430
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Sw side of PR for a change of pace. We founf the same poor neighborhoods. Copamarine has generic hotel rooms which are okay if you don't pay too much. The beach was unusable due to the floating piles of scum. The pools were fine but on the cool side.

Reviews.Title: “Top two favorites of all our two weeks in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: WorldWonderer77
Reviews.Content: One reason we stayed here was because there were no other hotels of any kind, in the area, that we could find, so decided to treat ourselves and stayed in this resort. We are so glad we did! We had planned to stay for one night but liked it so well we stayed for two. Staff every so helpful - above and beyond what one would expect. On their recommendation, we took their boat out to a near by little island. What a magical place!!!! Huge sea shells caught in the mangrove roots. Great snorkeling but one could see the beautifully colored tropical fish just by wading in the water. Like wading in a huge salt-water aquarium. Would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “A REAL Getaway Vacation....low key and gorgeous property!”
Reviews.Author: vacationct
Reviews.Content: We had an unexpected turn of events and ended up at Copamarina Beach Resort. A friend had recommended this hotel years ago after going there for a wedding. I thought the place was great and had a lot to offer...pools, beach, tennis and lots of grass for the kids to play freely. We decided last minute to do the all-inclusive which i think was a good value if the tipping had been included. I found that to be discouraging as well as the service. Restaurant staff took a solid two- three days of seeing me to actually smile and be friendly. They seemed to not know what they were doing and not happy. I wanted to do happy hour a couple of times but was discouraged by the atmosphere....it didnt seem welcoming and inviting. Even when we checked out we got no thanks for visiting us or have a good trip home...it was a strange vibe. I would love to go back as i came relaxed and the place has the potential to be really great! the rooms and beds were clean. We had some issues with our room....the phone did not work, tv had constant static, back door did not lock and our safe did not work. Some of things got fixed.....but it my mind. we are paying for a service and all this should be perfect. all in all we had a nice time...i hope for enthusiasm next time. Other vacationers felt they same way! Get it together Copamarina...you have a thing going!

Reviews.Title: “Back for seconds!”
Reviews.Author: FrankieJober
Reviews.Content: This was our second January visit -- loved it so much last year we came back again. What we like: Beautiful setting, great climate (1 hour of rain in 11 days' total stay!), quiet and secluded, peaceful, great staff, unusually clean and well-kept property. What has improved: The (two) restaurants are both very good -- better than they were last year -- and the prices weren't out of line by our (Washington DC) standards. What could be better: Rooms are clean, spacious, well-kept and well-appointed, with comfortable beds, but not luxurious. What some may love and some may not like at all: Quiet, peaceful, beautiful ... and not much to do except lay around, on the (narrow) beach or at poolside. There is tennis (a very good pro, Efren Alfonso, is on call and his rates are great -- $45 a session), massage, a dinky exercise room, a boat excursion to a mangrove swamp ("Gilligan's Island"), and not much else. They bring in a guitarist several nights a week which is very pleasant, but otherwise it's not a place for nightlife. The resort is in a relatively isolated spot, about 2 1/2 hours' drive from San Juan. The nearby town (Guanica) is dead. The nearest towns of size are Ponce (about 45 minutes' drive) or Mayaguez (about an hour's drive). We are husband and wife, age 71 and 65 and in good shape, traveling with sister-in-law age 71 in not-quite-as-good shape. No kids traveling with us. It seems like a kid-friendly place, but it does not have organized activities for kids and didn't notice any lifeguards. You'd have to amuse the kids on your own. (Don't know if child care is available -- worth checking.) Still, we loved it last winter and, if anything, loved it even more this winter. It's a good bet we'll go back next winter too. (Note: They offer a frequent-guest discount starting with your fourth stay.)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Romantic Place”
Reviews.Author: Maizy72
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is excellent. Next time I would love to go only with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Perfectly Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: lowanna_mobley
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Copamarina in PR. The service was great, the staff was extremely friendly, the resort was impeccably clean and well manicured. We enjoyed the cozy and comfortable beds and finally got some well needed rest from our crazy schedules. The food was great and of a much higher quality than most resorts. It's very evident they have a well-trained chef on staff. We were there for a full week and never got tired of the wide variety of options there. The house wine was much better than most house wine options at other places. Additionally- it was nice to have the wine included in the all-inclusive option. We had a great time and enjoyed our very relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, relaxing get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: SenorDG
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel easily accessible from the airport in San Juan. It provided a new face to the area of PR we previously traveled to. For a pleasant, relaxing get-a-way where the weather is warm, the sun is shinning, the restaurant is first rate and the staff, Leslie & Roberto especially, were extremely helpful. We would definitely return for an assured respite from the New England winters.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_MIA90
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many resorts in PR, but Copamarina was very different. The place is magical, the staff is great, and we really enjoyed all the weekend beyond our expectations. It is a perfect place for couples but too for family, so I have to say that it is the best kept secret in the industry on the island. Finally I'd like to recommend to take the boat at the resort and go to Gilligan Island, you won't regret about it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing slice of paradise”
Reviews.Author: global_citizen68
Reviews.Content: This was the 6th hotel we stayed in during 2 trips to Puerto Rico in the last 2 years, and my husband & I both just loved it! Super relaxing, beautifully situated, comfortable rooms, and well-managed with good service (unfortunately when you're traveling in PR on a budget that is not easy to come by). The staff and fellow travelers were very friendly. All the rooms seem to have a nice view. The hotel wasn't very busy while we were there; even though it has 100 rooms, the experience felt more intimate than that. It was by far the most family friendly place we stayed in PR. the casual restaurant is open air & has a playground in close proximity. Our 3 year old rarely has an interest in sitting at the table for more than 20 minutes, so he could safely run off to play at the playground where we could easily see him & we could finish our meal in peace. It was also the only place we stayed that had good salads in the restaurants, another item that's hard to find in PR. The babysitting services through the hotel are an absolute steal at $10/hour, take advantage! Seasoned caregiver Nicole took good care of our son, and we were able to rent a Hobie Cat for 1.5 hours & have fun by ourselves in Ballena Bay. Captain Roberto (Hobo) gave us a sailing refresher course for FREE (it had been over a decade for both of us), and sailed out with us in another Cat nearby for safety since the winds were about 20 knots. We tipped him generously. After drinks on the beach we enjoyed a nice dinner in the fancy restaurant while Nicole took care of our son. If you are interested in hiking, check out Bosque Seco, just north of the hotel. We parked near headquarters & did the Ballena trail downhill towards the beach with our stroller, a little rough but doable. Hubby had to hike back up to the car & drive back down to south trailhead to get us, however. By all means be sure to take the ferry to Gilligan's Island for a few hours. The water is crystal clear & it's like swimming in the Blue Lagoon. For swimming I would recommend a snorkel, mask & fins since the current comes in pretty strong from the ocean. For wading & splashing it's not necessary. There are no services on the island, bring your own food & snacks, there are many sheltered picnic tables for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: figue6123
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for relax vacation. to stay in calm.. thats the perfect place. Clean, beautifull area. without noise, crowled areas.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Stinks”
Reviews.Author: AndreaChicago
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation in February for two rooms in December. On the appointed day, we checked in at 3 pm. One room was ready. The other was not. We waited an hour for the room that wasn't ready. A bellman then. helpfully, came to the room we had and delivered the key to the room that we didn't have. We tried the key. It didn't work. This is frustrating. Steam is rising. I went to the front desk. (It's now 4 pm.) The person there explained that the computer system was "slow" and we would have to wait an hour (until 5 pm) to get into our room. I'll be darned. I asked him to send someone with a passkey to let us into the room. No dice. Although the front desk was no help, I eventually found a bellman with a passkey. He opened the room. Wrong bed configuration! Back to the front desk. A very gracious young lady (a big change from the lunk who had provided appalling service previously) helpfully provided a new room -- available immediately -- with the right bed configuration. Was the lunk aware of this factoid? Did he have an IQ in the 3 digits??? Having belatedly checked in, we then went to the beach in front of the hotel. No one was in the water. The folks in the hot tub explained why -- jellyfish. They bite. They bite multiple times if you enter the ocean. Guess they are allies of hte lunk at the front desk. The next morning we went to the restaurant for breakfast. There is one option. The breakfast buffet. It costs $20 per person. For heaven's sake, all I wanted was a grapefruit and a cup of coffee. $15 for the grapefruit and $5 for the coffee??????????????? I could continue, but you get the picture. This place is HORRIBLE. DON'T EVEN THINK ABOUT STAYING HERE. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? Don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “My kids loved it !!!”
Reviews.Author: lcf2001
Reviews.Content: We took a family vacation at the Copamarina, and my two kids still talk about it months later. We loved the grounds, the intimate size of the property, the service and the type of activity offered (the small island of shore, the sail boats, etc.). It was also fun to rent a car in San Juan and have to cross the island to get there. It added a sense of adventure to our trip and gave us a chance to admire great scenery. We didn't think the beach was extraordinary but we would go most days to a longer one a few kilometer east of the resort. The food was okay at best but overall I thought the Copamarina was a great place and I've told my friends with young kids about it.

Reviews.Title: “Copamarina: A wonderful place to vacation”
Reviews.Author: Stulefko
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip in the last twenty-five years. The staff is extremely user oriented in catering to every need in a genuinely friendly and caring manner. The rooms are nice, the grounds are beautiful, and the dining services and food a very pleasant experience. We were so pleased that we know we'll return again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: Stoat71
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would agree with most of the very positive reviews - this is a beautiful, relaxing place with nice gardens and pools. Service is excellent and rooms are all pleasant and modern. The restuarant is nice and the food is of a good quality but is perhaps a little over-priced, choice is quite limited and may not satisfy the appetites to those used to American sized portions. i was also a little disappointed they closed the on-site diving operation. Hence those wanting to dive now need to travel 20mins to scuba operation in Guanica town which is annoying considering some of the best dive sites are not far off shore of the hotel and used to be a 10 min boat ride directly from the hotel. Nonetheless, this is a fantastic place for those wanting to relax and is good for both families or couples ot groups.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: tcunning
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a peaceful, relaxing vacation. The view of the Caribbean is wonderful, although the beach at the resort isn't the best. It was pretty muddy. You're better off going to Gilligan's Island. There's a ferry down the road for $5, or the resort will shuttle you there for $7. Well worth the trip. The grounds are very well taken care of. The pools are excellent and uncrowded. The food is good, although there isn't much variety. There was one restaurant open on site while we were there, and there isn't much close by in Guanica. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Particularly Marlene at the front desk. She gave us a great dinner recommendation in Ponce, and also helped us navigate the confusing streets. (They're not big on street signs there). Pros: Beautiful grounds, easy access to Gilligan's Island, great staff. Cons: Isolated. Few restaruant choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax - great service and beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: ElGiganteJake
Reviews.Content: We traveled with another family, so there were two couples and 3 children (2 of them under the age of 2). It was a great time. We did not do the all inclusive package, but instead took advantage of local restaurants and vendors. (The food truck across from the high school on the drive in is AWESOME!). The one complaint I would have is that you cannot really swim in the ocean at the resort. If you walk down the beach to the west about 1/4 mile (it is an easy walk) there is a swim area that is a lot nicer. However, if you really want to swim in the ocean, take the trip out to Gilligan's Island. The water is beautiful and it is a great time. The staff was excellent, and the lady at the surf shop was incredibly helpful in making sure we had everything we might need and giving us advise. We are looking forward to our next opportunity to stay at Copamarina.

Reviews.Title: “Chef Eric cooked us a wahoo feast to order”
Reviews.Author: zzlangerhans
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I don't stay at resorts and actually stayed at another hotel in Guanica. But after we caught a beautiful wahoo on a charter fishing trip we couldn't find an open restaurant to cook it for us. Finally we called Restaurant Alexandra at the Copamarina and were welcomed there with open arms. Chef Eric came out to receive our kilo chunk of fish personally and cooked us a four course lunch: a clear soup of wahoo and vegetables, a wahoo tempura, wahoo in beurre blanc, and wahoo encebollada. Each dish was exquisite. Money was never discussed and I wouldn't have raised an eyebrow at a $150 bill, but in fact the charge was less than half of that. This was one of the peak experiences of our vacation, having the fish we caught hours earlier prepared personally for us by an outstanding and creative chef.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place.. Great People.. Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: kavithar
Reviews.Content: Copamarina is a great place with friendly staff, especially Carlos was very helpful and informative. The ambience is very good. The most relaxing vacation I would say.. They have good sized pool and jacuzzi. We had a very good time and the children were enjoying every minute of our stay here in-spite of not so good weather. Restaurant is very good and little expensive though. This place is very peaceful. We highly recommend this place to anyone. People visiting Puerto Rico should not only visit San Juan but should visit here as it is not overcrowded and is very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Anniversary EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: archerytaz
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that I stayed at the Copamarina Beach Resort, but this time they really went beyond. First, there are activities for all the gests, the hotel grounds are very well maintained and the location is very romantic and secluded. They prepared a romantic dinner at the beach for me and my wife and they did it with excellence!!! Imagine, Gazebo, candle lights, champagne, at the beach, awesome food and outstanding service. They even took care of the baby sitting service for my 5 and 2 year old siblings. Simply AWESOME!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, so-so beach, super rooms”
Reviews.Author: MJBNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four days on holiday with my partner and 9 month old daughter. The staff was INCREDIBLE - super kind, very helpful and prompted with any request. The resort itself was nicely manicured lawns, two good size pools, nice beach front. The water to swim in isn't that great - lots of sea grass, but a 5 minute walk ends at a nice park, which has better swimming areas. Gilligan's Island isn't that great - no beach what so ever, but interesting to swim around in the mangroves. The scuba diving was great! The restaurant was EXPENSIVE. Load up on food before you arrive, fridge in the room. The room was spotless and great views of the sea. It was really nice. If the hotel is full (which it was not when we stayed - it was almost empty) i think the pools and beach area would be VERY crowded).

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Spot”
Reviews.Author: LKBarryTrips
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Copamarina for our Honeymoon. Our travel agent (who has stayed all over the world) continues to come back here for her own vacations, so that is a great review in itself! It's also such an easy flight from DC to PR, and we wanted a low-stress Honeymoon with little travel frustration. If you're looking for an isolated location, this is your spot! Getting there was a challenge, as it's located down a treacherous road along the coast (I was terrified - it was so curvy and narrow!) but once you get there it's totally worth the trek. We pulled the Honeymoon card when we got there (couldn't help it haha) and they quickly upgraded our room so we had a view of the ocean off the back patio, which was just lovely. We also happened to be there during the off-season (luckily avoided a hurricane) so there were very few other guests to compete with for beach chairs and service. The room was not very lush (and our toilet's pipes made weird whistling noises that ended up being a bit of a joke for us) but with how lovely the beach is, we spent most of our time outside anyway. The beach was wonderful - there are lots of fish swimming around right under the dock that are fun to watch while snorkeling. It's such an quick trip to Gilligan's Island where you can swim down these great channels and see a lot of beautiful underwater life - plus the Copamarina boat takes people back and forth all day long, so you don't HAVE to make an entire day of it. If you go a few kilometers down the road, there are very isolated beaches to explore - great caves and coral areas - it was just LOVELY! And if you just want to relax, there are beds on the beach for a nap and plenty of shaded areas to drift off under (even a few out in the water!) The service was wonderful - especially Robert (who wore many hats at the resort and kept looking out for us to make sure our stay was pleasant) and Jackie (who kept searching us out and made sure the drinks kept coming - and she was always super friendly). Service could have been a bit quicker at the bar and restaurant, but we were also struggling to get on "island time." The knowledge of the dry forest nearby could have been better - we wanted to go hiking one day and asked at the front desk where to go, etc. etc. and were basically just handed a very generic pamphlet and sent on our way without much help. Every sign in and around the dry forest is in Spanish, so if you don't know the language, be prepared to kind of wing it. We went all-inclusive, which I think was totally worth it. It included all of our drinks, food, and non-motorized water sports (kayaks, snorkel stuff, paddle boards) and we definitely took advantage of all of it! If we hadn't gone all-inclusive, we would have ended up spending a lot more on the Honeymoon - definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Dive the wall”
Reviews.Author: wallundeerthesea
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to explore multiple small cays while snorkeling or dive the wall. We saw eel morays, lobsters, lion fish and great tropical fishes with Dive Master Padilla. The hotel arranged it. Gilligan island 'mangle' was interesting under water. We snorkel through a hole in the mangle with Jobo. Kids loved the paddle board. There are lots of things to do away from the crowd. The food is very good too. I wish there were more heart healthy choices in the menu, though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: Rmartinez19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Copamarina garden view rooms for one night while on vacation in July 2010. It is very nice but is on the higher price range for the area. Pools and beach are nice and relaxing. It was also not crouded although it we stayed midweek. they have kayaks and paddle boards but currents can get a little stong if inexperienced. Resort is accross from the launching point to Gulligan's Island and also offers their own service to the it. This is very nice because the local "ferry" can get pretty crouded. Didn't use any of their services or restaurants so I can't comment on that. One bad point is that mosquitoes were everywhere and relentless but thats not their fault. Overall I would recomend this resort if you have the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it!”
Reviews.Author: GAPacheco
Reviews.Content: Copamarina Resort is a beautiful place. It is very isolated with a road that should not be traveled at night and very carefully during the day. The surroundings are very nicely kept but the rooms themselves are not. The bedspreads were dirty and the bed linen needs replacing. They are so old that you can see through them. The mattresses were also old and the room was dirty. So much for that. We did find very nice people working there. Raul makes the best "mojitos" that I have ever tasted. Wanda, who works in the restaurant located outside, is very friendly and helpful and Sam, who works in the Alexandra Restaurant, gets an "A" in service. The food is very good in both places but very expensive for the location. Make sure that you do not share any main meals in the Alexandra Restaurant because they will charge you. Although Wanda tried to provide good service, the restaurant outside had so many flies that the whole experience was not worth it.. I wish that Wanda and Sam would have been working at the front desk. Needless to say, more friendly people at the front dek might have made the stay more tolerable. I usually like to say good things about my stays in Puerto Rico since I was born there but my stay at Copamarina was a big disappointment and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: Plumbus
Reviews.Content: I really can't say I loved or hated my stay.....just average. Pools are clean and big, beach looks great, but you cant really swim in it. Food is a pandora's box, may be good or just barely edible (breakfast is always good). Gilligans is great, but its more of a mangroove than a beach and depending on when you go it might be overun by tourists and locals alike. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The service is also a strong point, they were friendly and competent. All things considered its a good place to stay but remember this is not a fancy resort with amazing beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacations!!!”
Reviews.Author: Viajeros2008Caguas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed from June 25 - 27, 2010; and is the best vacations we ever had in PR. We are from PR, so believe me, is the best deal for the price, the service and the food. The rooms are big, the food is delicious an the service is excellent. The outside of the hotel is beautiful, and the pools and the kayaks are wonderful. The staff are friendly and they have activities during the day for adults and children around the pool. But you definetely need a car because is a little far from everything but thats the point, once you're in the hotel you would not want to go out. Is a real paradise. Ahhh, if you have time and want to go out of the hotel, you must see Guilligan Island too, is beautiful and the hotel have a ferry to this little island. I am planning to come back to this paradise asap!!! Enjoy it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Secluded”
Reviews.Author: travelbug1422
Reviews.Content: The resort is absolutely beautiful! I had a really relaxing time at Copamarina over the weekend. All I did was lay by the pool watching kids play with the floats. I didn't lay on the beach because it looked like a man made beach with a dock.The place is more of a low key family resort, but it didn't bother my boyfriend and me. I thought it was kind of cool that Copamarina had kid activities, such as sand castle building contest and the Easter hunt. The only really downside about this resort is that they didn't have the CBS channel so that we could watch the Final 4 game. We asked the bartenders if we could watch it and they originally thought it wasnâ€™t a problem. Then they realized they do not carry that channel. They seem to have ever other cable channel but the national network channels. The front desk person even mentioned that she did not get it at her own home. So we sat by the outdoor bar and watched the scores change on ESPN (along with 10 other people who wanted to watch the game), and then we decided to watch the Duke game in the business center. The Internet connection was also very slow using wireless and the landline. It couldn't even handle going into my email account much less a video feed. So the lesson is, don't go here if you want to watch any major sporting game during your time here.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Gio10_10
Reviews.Content: If you like a secluded, tropical experience, then this place is for you. Nice pools. Do me a favor and go to Las Palmas restaurant and order the coconut mojito, the best anywhere! Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “The real vacation...”
Reviews.Author: vegalegarreta
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for relax vacation. to stay in calm.. thats the perfect place. Clean, beautifull area. without noise, crowled areas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: cAugusto
Reviews.Content: I travel all around the Caribbean and this hotel does not have to envy any of those big expensive hotels. The facilities are beautiful and there is a lot to do. Rooms are great, food is excellent and they make really mean Mojitos (thanks Michelle and Raul). Had a blast sailing on a Hobie cat to the near small island called Gilligan's island and we even went for a sunset sail with champagne!!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: BeachcombersMV
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at Copamarina The staff was very busy looking down at papers, and making phonecalls. They handed us our keys and left us to our own devices. We started walking, and walking and walking until we arrived at the very last row of rooms, almost falling over our suitcases from the terribly long walk. I couln't believe they did not offer us a ride in their convenient golf cart, we saw later during our stay. We had booked the week without dinners, so maybe we were placed on skid row without a ride. We also had an overlflowing toilet. The parking lot reeked of septic overflow. The pollution of the water in front of the inn is clealy apparent. There's not much life there. The beach next to the Inn was closed due to pollution also, proving this point. The service at the Inn was mediocre for us. Not sure how they treat their other guests, that book the more expensive rooms, but for the price we paid, service should have been exquisite. The staff was moping around and slow, or unresponsive when called upon, like when we called about the plugged up toiled. They waited until the next day, the whole thing overflowed, making us feel grossed out about our room. They did give us a free dinner for the inconvenience, which was nice and tasted great. Again, at their prices it's best to go to the Gilligan's Island next door where they serve very nice, fresh tasting dinner. Finally, getting to the inn is a sad experience with all the litter along the roads. Why does the Inn not see to it that it gets cleaned up. It is their calling card. A beautiful drive to the Inn makes for better expectations. Also, when they vacant rooms they don't turn off the aircondioning so the place sounds like a factory. What a waste of electricity in this day and age of global warming. I did wonder if Puerto Ricans live on another planet in this regard. I do love Puerto Rico by the way!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Sunny Paradise”
Reviews.Author: travelingspirit52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copamarina after reading many reviews here. When we arrived in Guanica, we did not have directions. Both of our phones were out of battery. We stopped in Guanica, and in limited Spanish asked some towns people for directions. They drove us to the road we needed to take. It is just lovely. As we drove up the road, the view of the ocean was amazing. We parked in the lot. The hotel staff is very friendly. They give you their undivided attention. They do not move on to other concerns until all your questions are satisfied. Our room was spacious. The king size bed comfortable. The view amazing. It is a large complex. There are many families staying here. It can be a long walk to the restaurant if you have mobility issues. We did not mind the walk. There are many orchids growing in the trees. We enjoyed every minute of being outside. The beach is shallow and has sea grass. It is so clear though, that as you walk down to the end of the dock, you can see fish, starfish and the grass. The ocean is very warm here. We were able to take kayaks out to Gilligans island with Carlos on a Monday. We were able to snorkel there around the mangrove roots. It was just lovely. We also enjoyed eating at Las Palmas for breakfast and dinner. We enjoyed the guitar player that played each evening. They have a buffet at breakfast. They have three beautiful pools. They also have a kiddy pool. It is very family friendly. This part of the island is dry, and rarely rains. It is near a natural reserve called the DRY Forest. We were able to hike in the dry forest. We ate in town for breakfast several times at a bakery. We were able to learn some Spanish. The Puerto Ricans were very friendly when we attempted our limited Spanish. There is not much shopping. We actually originally only booked three days at this hotel. We did not have reservations for the rest of our trip. We drove north and visited Rincon and Isabella. After several days, we decided that the weather was best at the Copamarina. We called and they had a room. We headed back here and finished out our stay here. I really did not want to leave. It was a great break from winter.

Reviews.Title: “loved copamarina”
Reviews.Author: alisonmrolfe
Reviews.Content: spent 4 nights with my 4 teenagers. great for chilling out and just relaxing. beautiful grounds by the ocean with pools/hottubs. good food and very friendly service. clean spacious rooms. would come again.

Reviews.Title: “A good, relaxing two days, nice environment and nice, spacious, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: lmeuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two night during our island road trip. We were in room 115, facing the grass field, palm trees and the sea. Nice spacious and clean room, Aveda shower gel and shampoo and lotion (will always impress the ladies!). Tiny beachvolley ball court but lots of other things to do... It is a loooong drive to the hotel and quite an isolated place, so we were glad that relaxing by the pool/beach was the only thing planned (lovely poster beach beds outside, with pillows) Restaurant a bit pricey, with no alternative outside the resort. Watch out for mosquitoes!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: elharo
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was good with clean, comfortable rooms, friendly service, and better than average hotel food. Free Wifi was included and laundry machines were available (both things I often miss at so-called five-star hotels.) The surrounding forest is exceptionally beautiful though there are no hiking trails reachable from the hotel without a car. The grounds are very nice but scheduled for further development to maximize room space and minimize the actual garden area. The pools were nice, though as all too common nowadays not nearly deep enough for any real swimming. The jacuzzis were OK, though one was not nearly hot enough. Now the downsides: 1. The hotel is very isolated. A car is a must. 2. PR-333, the road to the hotel, is very narrow, twisty, and scary. It is usually barely wide enough for two vehicles to pass each other with a few inches to spare. There are no sidewalks along the road, and bicycling would be far too dangerous. 3. Food options are somewhat repetitive over a longer stay. 4. The beach was polluted and closed due to excessive coliform bacteria count, or at least the public beach next door was. The hotel did not inform its guests of this problem. Raw sewage occasionally washed up onto the beach. 5. Like many hotels now it has upgraded to HDTVs without upgrading its satellite service which is still standard def and thus everyone on the TV looks extremely fat. 6. The maids routinely swept out the rooms onto the back porch and then left the back door unlocked, almost every single day. The staff knows this and even relies on this to get guests back into their rooms when the key cards stop working. 7. The hotel is excessively obnoxious about controlling your stay, not even allowing your guests to visit your room, the pool, or the beach. 8. The water sports were haphazard. The boat schedule was not reliable, and guests were not informed of the options nor were appointments kept. The Copa is undoubtedly the best hotel for miles around, and certainly the best nearest to Bosque del Seco. However unless you have a particular reason to be in the Guanica region or points west, you'd probably be happier looking elsewhere in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “My scuba class at Copamarina was AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: kcjferguson
Reviews.Content: My name is Katie, I'm 13 years and I live in Virginia. I took the scuba class offered by the resort during my family's vacation. Franklin Rivera was a great teacher. He was fun and very patient. Captain Geoff was the awesomest person ever. I had so much fun and learned soooooooooooo much from both of them! Every kid that goes to Copamarina should take the class or snorkel trip with Franklin and Captain Geoff!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I really want to go back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “mixed but great snorkeling and staff”
Reviews.Author: besoparadise
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Copamarina was mixed. The hotel rooms were â€œokay to poorâ€�, the grounds were beautifully landscaped, the beach was horrible (muddy and grassy), the restaurants were a joke (overpriced, understaffed and a menu without enough fresh seafood choices). Also, the beaches were closed recently due to infections from pollution runoff(yuck), But the real bonus here is the watersports, Captain Jeff and divemaster Franklin were outstanding. My teenagers went from â€œI am not going to do itâ€� to snorkeling like real pros with there help. The reefs were beautiful. Our son learned to scuba and scuba-d while we snorkeled over the top of him, it was one of the most memorable moments in our life. The reefs were healthy. There were several small children in our group that couldnâ€™t keep up so we went off in the advanced group with our son and Franklin. Captain Jeff threw on mask and fins and followed with the little ones. He even made the one kid most afraid of the water his â€œjr snorkel masterâ€�. The kid went from afraid to Jeffâ€™ shadow outswimming and outdiving him on every turn. The little ones did so good that they finally caught up with us. After the reef snorkel, they took us to see the giant sea stars where we snorkeled in some of the clearest water in the world. We went with them for three days and it was great, made our trip. Sadly we understand that they will not be there beginning in May but may be setting up there own business. Definitely check to see if they are there before you book, without them our trip would have been much less than average. David

Reviews.Title: “relaxing & fine”
Reviews.Author: anasazzy
Reviews.Content: was there in octobar,out of season time.was just great to enjoy luxury in peace and quiet.the kitchen they have is excellent,rooms are huge,stuff is very,very friendly and helpful.I suggest renting a car cause without you cannot see anything on island.we rented suv and drove by ourself there.windy street was fun to drive,for european folk ,very familiar.many people write about beach and sea weed,that was indeed a bit strange for the first time,you get used to it.public beach is only 2 min away,and it was empty too.it was very nice and relaxing vacation by all means and i can recomend to those who search quiet places( it was at least in octobar so,in full season should be different,everybody confirmed so) great place,excellent food,big clean rooms,nice pools.will be back again octobar 2010,and i'm looking forward to it

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort to stay and a lot to explore Diving”
Reviews.Author: jonathan-diver
Reviews.Content: The resort count with a great view in the morning and a great sunset landscape wonderfull all clean pools are great for kids and to be relax to go xtreme just go diving to the great spots that we whent the wall fallen rock and andreas wow undiscover coral full of life and lot to see . snorkeling was great and the staff was fantastic, instructor frank and the capt thanks for make us have a great time also the people at the dive shop Rosa and capt ricky they know what their doing thanks again. Restaurant its great

Reviews.Title: “The ideal small-resort experience!”
Reviews.Author: jimnpa
Reviews.Content: Copamarina offers all the amenities of a mega resort within an intimate, magnificently landscaped, natural setting. Great for couples, friends, and young children. The talented guitar player at the bar in eves is the icing on the cake. I highly recommend this resort as perhaps the best get-away-from-it-all property in PR, beachfront anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Shhh, best kept secret around!”
Reviews.Author: travelinfamily98
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening after dark so we couldn't see the resort until the next day, but we felt the cool tropical breezes the minute we got out of our car! The reservation area is open air and we could already tell we were going to like it! The room was very clean and well decorated, but the mattresses were a bit hard and lumpy. The ocean view from the room was wonderful and I really liked the two door set-up, but there was no key for the door leading to the beach. So, each time we went to the beach we had to walk out the door by the parking lot and walk around through the lobby in order to lock our beach side door. I think it would be really easy for them to key the doors the same so you could lock both doors with one key! However, that's my biggest complaint about the resort! Otherwise, it was absolutely wonderful. The beach is not white sandy beach, but it is nice, clean and we saw all kinds of star fish. There is sea grass, but the water is shallow very far out and you can see where you're walking. It wasn't a big deal. The dock was nice to walk out on and that's how we were able to see lots of star fish. We didn't take the trip to Gilligan's Island - too many people in a small area for us! Instead we took a day trip through the agricultural area to Joyudas for fresh sea food at Mao's (very good and nice, friendly people - locally owned), then headed south on Hwy 301 to Cabo Rojo! There is a light house and a secluded beach that was breathtaking. WE were there in March and it was us and about 25 other people - that was it! We hiked up to the light house for breathtaking views of 12 story cliffs and a beautiful sunset! I would highly recommend doing this. The country side is beautiful and the beach is worth the 30 mile drive. I almost hate to write a great review for the Copamarina because I want it to keep it's quaintness, but it was a wonderful trip for my family - including a 12 and 15 year old! We would return in a heartbeat and hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Copamarina”
Reviews.Author: sberm
Reviews.Content: As always we really enjoyed our stay at the Copamarina. Grounds are very beautifully landscaped and convenient and safe for kids to play and freely go from room to pool and beach. Kiddy pools especially clean and well placed in grassy area with part shade. Many families with friendly kids of all ages. We had good food in restaurants, with enjoyable live guitar music nightly. Service a bit slow. Rooms clean and spacious with good housekeeping. Used wifi and computer regularly. Gym very clean and adequate facility. Great tennis courts, beach volleyball setup and watersports available. Pools and beach great. Especially like the cabanas and shade areas on the sand and in the shallows. No problem getting space daily by pool or beach. Every day weather is fantastic - sunny with hardly a cloud. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Fred0290
Reviews.Content: The location is great, just steps to the beach, but to get there the road at night is not lighted and little far from road 116. The staff is friendly, room was clean. The gardens are nice, you can find shade from the sun if you want to. They can get you to Gilligans Island for a fare of 7.50 p/p and pick you up at the island at your desired time. Food is great, though the food court for the day is located in a open area, which birds are in the area and have to watch your food or the birds are going for it. We decided to order and eat the food at the pool area, we had to wait a little bit longer for the food because only one staff attendind the people in the pool/beach area. The hotel has 2 pools, 2 kids pools and 2 spas. It also has 2 tennis courts in great conditions, a small gym, coin laundry. We liked the food very much and the hotel itself, it is very nice. We did not like that much the Gilligan Island because it was too crowded, long weekend, but it is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Polar opposites - poor hotel service exceptional restaurants”
Reviews.Author: betsyk2201
Reviews.Content: In all of my years of travel I have never seen an operation, seemingly run by the same company, which presented such a stark difference in service and attitude. The staff of the Copamarina Resort were indifferent and rude while the staff of Alexander's Restaurant were exceptionally professional, accommodating and friendly. The Resort was lovely but the rooms reeked of mildew.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place... needs new management and a lesson in guest service.”
Reviews.Author: lift37
Reviews.Content: The place is very nice to look at, but the service was lacking. To start off with the beach was closed due to a bacteria in the water, for the whole week. Second they did not recommend any places that we could go except the island. We did figure it out on our own.... if you go to Puerto Rico stay in Rincon, the people are nice and there is snorkeling, surfing, body boarding, paragliding, and plenty of shops and restaurants. All of their drinks are expensive and unless u sit at the bar they are all in plastic cups, and any one who knows anything knows plastic makes the drink taste different, plus I graduated college 7 yrs ago. Never saw a manager, staff is not friendly, pools for the most part are 3 feet deep, nothing is open in the town til friday or saturday, have to travel a half hour to do anything, food was okay nice presentation, the pic of the fitness center on the site is not real the fitness center has four sets of dumb bells and treadmills and half of them do not work if you want to have a great time go to Rincon

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: tomdunes
Reviews.Content: Copamarina is just a lovely place. Gorgeous,grounds and beach and pools. Buildings and units recently renovated. Kayaking, snorkling, scuba in a protected bay, with fantasy islands an easy kayak trip from the resort. Two very nice resteraunts. One quite upscale and pleasant The other an open air spot with very good food and a very pleasant island atmotphere. Prices reasonable at both for the quality. But most of all, we loved the staff, especially in the outside restaurant. Friendl and playful, who went out of their way to make us and others feel welcome. Many families, having fun. Copamarina is off by itself, with the nearest attractive town with good restaurants, San German, about 45 minutes away. But you probably won't want to leave the resort very often.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Travelpsychedoc
Reviews.Content: Relaxing, low-key but beautiful and well run, with great swimming and snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Truly enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: GreatFalls1
Reviews.Content: After weeks of shoveling snow we needed the 89-degree weather and bathtub sea, and while we had never been to the south coast of Puerto Rico, we wanted to see more of the island. There are not a whole lot of resorts down there, so Copamarina stood out, and we wanted to drive over the mountains, and to see the dry forest, so we booked a week. We did not choose the all-inclusive when we reserved, but when we got there we opted for it, since the nearby town does not have a lot of restaurant options, and we did not want to drive around after a few glasses of wine on unfamiliar roads. We are glad we did, because it let us really relax. No worrying about where to eat, when to leave, what to wear, and the food is very good at Copamarina. We do not usually lie around on vacation for too long, but this time we lounged. Of course we also enjoyed hiking in the dry forest reserve across the road (early, before it got too hot), and one day we drove to Ponce to see the old town. But the all-inclusive rate allowed us use of the 2 Hobie cats and sea kayaks, which was great. The coast is very pretty though the beaches are not endless strands here; there is sea grass and shallow water here, but you can walk to the end of the dock and swim comfortably from there, with the white sand bottom visible. People snorkeled at the reef offshore. There are not really any waves here, and there is a public beach walkable (right next door) with easier swimming. We enjoyed the dining room options. The all-inclusive gave you all you could hope to eat and drink. We ordered a pitcher of Sangria which was not only generous but lovingly crafted, and very strong... Three meals a day are served outdoors in the casual restaurant, and the white-tablecloth restaurant indoors is open for dinner. Rooms are spacious and have a balcony or terrace with table and chairs, and the beds are great. Service to the rooms was fine - very very clean - and the staff was always friendly. There is a nice beach for sunning on, and broad lawns shaded by palms on which you can pull your lounge chair when the sun gets too hot. The property is very handsome, with two pools and lovely landscaping. We plan to return next year. Our friends in the Bahamas are having weather in the 60's right now, but in Puerto Rico it is still upper 80's. We like the thought of contributing to the economy of part of the U.S. - and we like the convenience of getting there.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every minute”
Reviews.Author: Confirmed-Explorer
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every minute of our stay. The hotel personnel could not have been more welcoming or nicer to us. Our room was comfortable and furnished in an attractive Caribbean style. The food was very good, including typical Puerto Rican cuisine, and the hotel offered a nice variety of activities. The hotel garden was the prettiest of any place we stayed during our trip. Congratulations to everyone at Copamarina.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget resort in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: rabble
Reviews.Content: The Copamarina resort is a good budget hotel in Puerto Rico. The resort is on the southwestern coast of Puerto Rico, not an area familiar to most tourists. It is about a 2 hour drive from the airport in San Juan, and with the exception of making sure you find the correct exit to highway 52 out of San Juan, it is an easy drive. The resort has many positives and negatives and I will outline them below. But the important thing to remember about Copamarina, is that you are staying at a tropical resort for budget prices. I will start with the rooms. As best I can tell they range in price from approximately $155 to $285. With the exception of the beachfront rooms all are located in two story buildings, so each room has a balcony or patio. We stayed in a beach front room (which is the most expensive) and I canâ€™t see a big difference between them and the garden view rooms (although some of the less expensive rooms are actually newer). All are just steps to the beach and pools, so itâ€™s not worth the small premium you pay for the upgraded room. The rooms themselves are fairly stark, with white painted walls, tiny bathrooms and old furniture. However, they are clean and given the rate you are paying this is what you would expect. The grounds at Copamarina are truly what distinguishes this hotel. There are two adults pools, two childrenâ€™s pools and two Jacuzzis. They are spread out over a large area which is meticulously maintained with beautiful walkways and gardens. The pictures from their website accurately reflect how beautiful the grounds are. As others have reported, the beach at Copamarina is not a turquoise tropical beach you might expect. The sand has a course brown texture and that gives the water the same brown appearance (similar to what you would see in the northeastern US). The sea grass is prevalent everywhere, you can swim in the water but you do end up swimming through the grass. There is a public beach next door to the hotel and there is no sea grass there. During our stay, I saw very few people sitting by the beach and no one was swimming, most guest preferred, as I did, to sit by the pools. The pools at the resort are beautiful, they are large with an abundance of comfortable chairs, tables and umbrellas. There is pool service and a bar nearby to each pool, so it is a great place to relax, much nicer than the beach. The food and service at Copamarina is solidly mediocre. Not bad, but absolutely nothing special. There are two restaurants at the hotel, the casual Las Palmas and the more expensive Alexandras. Las Palmas serves all meals and as I have said the food is ok but nothing special and the service is horrifically slow. I would strongly recommend a nearby restaurant for dinner, it is on the road right past Copamarina (actually overlooks the resort), they serve dinner outside on picnic tables and the food was really good. All told, I would recommend Copamarina if you are looking for a low cost escape from the winter cold, donâ€™t mind sitting by and swimming in the pool not the ocean and are ok with very simple rooms and mediocre meals. For most visitors from the US, San Juan is a direct flight, so Copamarina can be a quick getaway. Also if you live in the NYC area, you can fly directly into Ponce on Jet Blue, which is only 45 minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: mtb55
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel! We flew into San Juan and stopped at El Yunque before driving the 2 hrs to Copamarina. The drive was easy and traffic was much easier to drive in than Boston. The hotel staff speaks English well and is extremely friendly. The Palmas cafe prices were around $20-$25 per dinner plate, but the view is worth far more. We had a garden view room which was spacious, clean, and felt very safe. We really enjoyed taking a day trip to La Parguera (20 minutes West) where we hired Johnny's Boats to take us on a snorkeling trip. Make sure to stop at the Pineapple/Pina Colada stand 10 minutes Westbound of Guanica. We drove to the end of 333 to Playa Tamarindo on a Friday and had the place to ourselves. Also make sure to go snorkeling at Gilligan's Island.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time - Student tour group”
Reviews.Author: mllelchs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copamarina from Feb 13-16th with about 30 high school teenagers and 12 adults. Check in was fast - our tour guide called ahead and they had our keys waiting for us. Within 5 minutes of arrival, we were in the pool! Breakfast each morning was fabulous! Nice variety. Didn't have lunch or dinner (with the exception of one dinner that was arranged for our group - disappointing. Rice and bean mixture and a salad...) at the resort - we were out on tour most of the time. But, prices are very expensive for meals and for drinks. The adults ended up stopping at a grocery store and bringing some beer back to our rooms. The pools are very nice, clean, warm. There are two kiddie pools and 2 jacuzzi's as well. Beach is very pretty - there is some sea grass, but that didn't stop us from swimming out in it. One of our teens found a starfish, hermit crabs, and a live conch! Went kayaking one afternoon - tried to make it over to Gilligan's Island, but the wind was too strong. Still had a great time kayaking and they only charged us for 1/2 hr. Those in our group that took the ferry over to the island had a good time. Rooms were spacious and bed was comfortable. A couple members of our group had problems with ants in their rooms, but didn't let that bother them - after all, when in a tropical, Carribbean island, bugs happen! All in all, I'd recommend this place. I'm used to all-inclusive resorts, so this was pricier than what I usually do. But, it is very quiet and a totally relaxing atmosphere (you won't find nightclubs and casinos here!). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A place to relax in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: bigbirdDetroit
Reviews.Content: Only stayed two nights but this was the most relaxing place we stayed in Puerto Rico. No real town there. Definitely low key. Staff was attentive and friendly. Service at the outside restaurant was slow but food at both restaurants was good and resonably priced. The breakfast buffet was expensive. Hiked the dry forest-information at the front desk. Went diving on "the wall"-the dive boat will go out with only two people and the reef looked really healthy to me. Diving setup was very good and the divemaster and assistant (both named Roberto) were friendly and great. The beach is OK but the water is not crystal clear and it isn't sandy (in the water-sea grass). Kayak (rent at the resort or at the ferry) - or take the ferry at the nearby dock-to Gilligan's Island. There were quite a few peopleat the island there but that was OK. The water is clearer there and it was a fun place to see. There are also more beaches further down the road with clearer water. There were quite a few smaller children and they do make noise. Rooms are small but comfortable but not luxurious. Plan ahead and have an agenda. Plenty to do for a few days but I'm not sure about a longer trip. We didn't go but a lot of people went to Ponce for sightseeing. You have to drive awhile for other restaurants(I think)-we went to LaMonserrate Seaport Restaurant in Ponce-on the water off highway 2. Great location but food was just OK. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Saint Valentine and 25th aniversary”
Reviews.Author: fernan2010
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing,is the best place to vacations of Puerto Rico. The staff of the resort are excellent. The restaurants are a+. Thanks to Eric (the waitress) your service is out of this world. . Your idea of the weeding ring and the musician was wonderful I expect to return i soon i possible.The aspect of the room is nice.

Reviews.Title: “A GRETA PLACE TO RELAX”
Reviews.Author: Dreamers2Trucking
Reviews.Content: This resort is a wonderful place to stay for relaxation of mind, body, and soul . It is situated ajacent to the dry forest preserve. ( a great place for bird watching) From the moment we arrived we where impressed. At check in we were greeted and upgraded to a ocen view room. the rooms were very nice and comfortale with privite patios with new outdoor furniture. The grounds were kept in perfect order and you could tell the place was well taken care of.You will see staff always keeping things in order. They have 2 full size pools with fountains. A kidie pool. A hot tub.A spa and fitness room. All along the beach front were shade structures as well as padded lounge chairs. Yes, the beach did have seeweed but a short walk (100yds) west brings you to a public beach maintained by the park service with lifeguards and a pertected swimming beach.I loved the beach as I did a lot of walking in the water and finding starfish, which there was many.This is the place to stay if you want peace and quite and still be in a 2 1/2 hour drive of anywhere on the island without the hustle and bustle of San Jaun. In our 5 day stay we visited the rain forest, Camu caves, Rincon ( for a delightful sunset dinner) La Parguera, for snorkeling, and also enjoyed a few hours of back road driving visiting some smaller villages.( WARNING) these roads are not for the faint of heart! The food ( 2 resturants) and bar are a bit pricey but there are many fine resturants with in a 45 minute drive. There are also local stores where you can buy your liquor and mixes, snacks, for a great way to save money. Nearby are also fantastic bakeries and fruit stands with all kinds of fresh fruit. they also have daily activities for the kids and kyacks for rent to go to Gilliigians island. they can also arrange snorkeling and diving trips. We decided to use Paradise Scuba and snorkeling center in La Parguera ( a short 15 minute drive ) All in all this is the place we will always stay while visiting this fantstic island. Plese feel free to contact me for any info or some pics.

Reviews.Title: “The Copamarina Only Gets Better”
Reviews.Author: LesP_Lexington
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Copamarina for over 12 years. We have found the staff to always be friendly and helpful -- they remember us each year and welcome us. On the first day when I went for towels at the gift shop, the woman remembered me and that I liked to snorkel. She mentioned that there was a snorkeling trip scheduled that afternoon if I wanted to join it. I did and had a great time. The rooms are beautifully done to blend in with the incredibly lush landscaping. While we were there a pipe broke and we did not have hot water for part of a day. The front desk called us, told us that the hot water was going off, and assured us that it would be back by 5 pm. The hot water was back at 4:30. In addition, while the water was off the front desk offered to let us shower in vacant rooms. Problems happen at all hotels, especially when they are located in remote locations (one of the Copamarina's great charms). But the Copamarina was quite impressive and extraordinary in their efforts to ensure the comforts of their guests. In a previous review, I mentioned that the food was overpriced and not that good. I am happy to report that the menu has improved considerably. The vegetarian options are both interesting and delicious, and the chief modified a fish dish to meet my dietary requirements. It was delicious. The food is not cheap, but it is now worth the price. Also, the wine list was varied and quite reasonably priced. The Copamarina is not for everyone. It is serene and secluded. We love it for these attributes. Some people might want something more glitzy.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately ruined our vacations”
Reviews.Author: Fred2445
Reviews.Content: We are not used to writing reviews about places we stay, but we thought it would be helpful for other tourists to read this so they can re-consider there bookings with this "hotel more like a hostel." We had a reservation booked at Copamarna for a week after staying 3 nights at the Westin Rio Mar. We had to pack our bags and leave early due to the inefficiency of the resort and staff. This hostel lacks big-time in customer service and has no clue of maintaining a happy customer. Upon check-in we had problems and when we wanted to check-out early they wanted to charge us for the service they never provided. The food was somewhat ok, but extremely over-priced for a piece of bread with ham and cheese. The ambiance seemed ok but apparently the hostel is not doing too good due to the fact that they had probably 4 rooms occupied. The so-called Hotel Manager, just wondered around and if you ever need to talk to her regarding the service, you can find her sitting down at the al-fresco restaurant mingling with her "staff."
