Not too safe either!!!! Overall our stay was depressing and not worth the shot again. Sorry for the review, but need to get your act together!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: oliverpd
Reviews.Content: We booked three rooms for my wife and I plus our children and their significant others based partly on recommendations from folks on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. Located far away from the "madding crowd" of San Juan, the Copamarina is located on the sunny and dry southwest part of Puerto Rico. The rooms were great, the restaurants on the grounds were good and reasonable, the staff were friendly, and the hotel has its own beach and wonderful gardens. If you want to do more than just relax there is scuba operators nearby, tennis courts on the grounds and several nearby towns you can visit including San Germain and Ponce. A lot of families with young children stay at the Copamarina so this may notbe to some people's liking. Also, as other reviewers have mentioned, the water is not very deep and is a bit weedy in spots. But overall, this is a great place to get away from it all and just relax in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “A handsome, well-designed property, in a beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: kittravels
Reviews.Content: Greetings, fellow travelers. Iâ€™ve read through the wide-ranging reviews for this property and thought I would add my perspective. My husband I just returned from a very enjoyable vacation in Puerto Rico, spending one night in Ponce, one night in San Juan, and three nights at the Copamarina at GuÃ¡nica. Our experience at the Copamarina was by far the best and was exactly what we were looking for, so I wanted to offer my insights. Background: We actually stayed at the Copamarina for several nights about 15 years ago, shortly after they opened. On our return visit, we were thrilled to see that the landscaping and grounds have matured nicely, and we felt that the newer buildings blended well with the original ones. We were particularly pleased with aspects of the property that attracted us in the first place: a secluded location, architecture and site orientation that blend well with the surroundings, NO casino or other glitzy tourist hype, and proximity to sites of historic, cultural, and natural interest. Now, some details. Yes, access to this property is via a narrow, winding road. However, in driving around PR over a period of days, we found thatâ€™s pretty much the norm for road design, and the road to the Copamarina was in much better condition than other rural roads we encountered elsewhere on the island. We actually felt more comfortable driving on this road after dark, when the presence of car headlights made it clear when another car was approaching and all drivers had time to â€œmake wayâ€� as needed. Yes, anyone staying at the property for more than a day or so would want to have their own vehicle (preferably something nimble and compact). The hotel is in a rather secluded location, so you would want to be able to drive to other attractions unless youâ€™re really content to sit at one of the pools or the beach most of the time. We drove into GuÃ¡nica for dinner one night (for a very good seafood meal at the Blue Marlin) and also took day trips into the mountains (San German in particular is a charming place, well worth the drive). Yes, the beach at the hotel is small and has some seaweed â€“ thatâ€™s part of the local ecosystem. Iâ€™m not a connoisseur of beaches, but I can easily imagine that larger, more spectacular beaches exist at other comparable property; however, thatâ€™s not what I was expecting, based on the descriptions and photos on the website. We didnâ€™t choose to go to Gilliganâ€™s Island, so I canâ€™t comment on the merits of that excursion. Yes, the hotel requires a $15 deposit on use of beach towels. I assume this is because the towels are pretty nice (large, fluffy, absorbent) and would have a habit of â€œdisappearingâ€� if the hotel didnâ€™t implement some deterrent for them ending us as souvenirs. We never had to wait for clean towels â€“ there were always at least a dozen of them stacked up in the gift shop. In generally, we didnâ€™t feel crowded anywhere at the resort (the pools, the bar/outdoor dining area, etc.). There were usually a lot of cars in the parking lot, but apparently the guests were spread out over a large area. Iâ€™m puzzled by comments from reviewers who were convinced that â€œlocalsâ€� were using amenities at the hotel. If by that you mean that a lot of other guests were from Puerto Rico (versus from the continental US or Europe), yes this property attracts many Puerto Rican citizens. I consider this to reflect very positively on the image and character of the property â€“ itâ€™s not a gringo ghetto. As for townspeople coming onto the property to use the pool or other amenities, we never got that impression; most folks in GuÃ¡nica looked rather downtrodden, whereas the people we saw at the Copamarina were typically dressed in upscale vacation attire. As for food at the resort, yes, prices were higher than what we would pay back in the states. We never ate at the Alexander (because I wouldnâ€™t want to eat indoors in such a lovely setting), but the meals we had at Las Palmas ranged from modest to very good in terms of quality and value. I read in our guidebook that Puerto Rico imports over 90 percent of its food. This is consistent with the fact that we saw very little fresh food on the island other than tropical fruit and seafood, and packaged/processed foods were distressingly prevalent in stores we visited. I think this accounts for the rather high prices and limited menu both at the Copamarina and other restaurants we visited (except in San Juan, which is a whole â€˜nother story â€“ much more cosmopolitan but also very pricy). We were disappointed to see packaged, pre-sliced white bread served at the Copamarina and elsewhere; if fresh whole-loaf bread is not available, I simply wouldnâ€™t bother to serve it at all. I do recommend the wonderful fresh fruit platter on the a la carte breakfast menu at Las Palmas. The breakfast buffet (offered one day during our visit) was heavy on processed cereals, packaged bread, powdered eggs, and so forth â€“ donâ€™t bother. We didnâ€™t have any problems with service or staff at the hotel â€“ not sure what the complaints are about in this category. Yes, you can definitely run up a big tab at the bar if youâ€™re a drinker, but those rum punches are GOOD. The Medalla Light beer served at the hotel was the only local beer we found anywhere on the island, and it is indeed very light; if you want more flavorful/exotic beers, youâ€™ll be limited to San Juan as far as we could tell. Our room was very comfortable and consistent with the website descriptions and photos. The bathroom was clean and spacious and the towels were of good quality. We LOVED the louvered windows and balcony area, which were well-designed for the climate. As a matter of personal preference, we avoid using air conditioning in all but the hottest of climates, so we had a good experience by turning off the AC (which was a bit noisy) and opening the windows at each end of the space, creating a nice cross breeze. There are ceiling fans on each balcony â€“ another one in each bedroom would be nice. Our room had a huge flat-screen TV, with a good selection of premium channels. Satellite reception wasnâ€™t comparable to what we have at home, but I imagine itâ€™s the best available for such a remote location. So, all in all, we had a relaxing, interesting vacation in a tranquil, attractive setting, at a fraction of the cost we might have spent at a high-end, franchise-driven operation elsewhere. We have traveled all over the world, in some cases to countries that were very poor, and we would rate this property very highly for its sensitivity to the local environment and its accessibility to the real character of the surrounding culture, with all of its assets and limitations. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get Away”
Reviews.Author: seashellBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: Wonderful beach in a quiet and secluded area. Extreemly helpful front desk staff. They even helped us arrange transportation to and from the hotel which is incredibly helpful if you find yourself without a car in PR. The food was fantastic too. Can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “22 years first honeymoon and anniversary”
Reviews.Author: ivyIsabela
Reviews.Content: First I want to say thank you to all of the staff for their courtesy and kind attention. We where there for our 22nd anniversary and our first time honeymoon. And it was a nice experience for my husband being that it was a surprise for him by my part. The night of our anniversary we went down for dinner and after we had dinner the restaurant manager came in with a nice fruit desert in a cookie crust with a candle and a violinist playing it was a beautiful surprise. And our last night there we almost had a bad night but thanks to the Alexandra manager that got me a Benadryl saved my life since I am allergic to seafood and its smell. We had to be served out side. My special thanks to her.I recommend this nice resort to anyone that wants a peaceful and clean enviroment to visit with spacious rooms and very clean. Thanks again and God Bless you all.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort - I am a repeat customer”
Reviews.Author: outofcvg
Reviews.Content: I go down to PR on business about twice a year and I have stayed at several large hotels and resorts and I think I have settled on the Copamarina as my future "permanent" location. The place is very pleasantly manicured and quiet. Even when they are busy and there is a lot of activity, the place is sufficiently large to allow escape from the noise (and I was there when Univision was shooting a TV show there!). The best part for a business traveller - wireless internet everywhere! even on the beach... The rooms are nice. Not great, the furniture could use a little upgrading, but nice. The prices seem high but I have found them to actually be on par for similar resorts in PR. The restuarant is very good but pricey and the service is a little slow. Also, bring a sweater, it is cold in there. For a change in pace, try going to Guanica and eating at one of the local places. Local food, cheap, and very good. Only problem is that the village is very dead from Sunday through Wednesday. The hostess and the servers are very nice. No complaints about the service, they have always been very accommodating. The location is a little out of the way, so remember to add 15 mins to any planned trip just to get to PR-2. Also, the road for the last 2 miles is very winding and narrow, so careful driving especially at night. There are no gas stations anywhere nearby (at least not one that I could find). There is a laundry room with a washer and a dryer if you choose to pack light. Bring your own detergent though, the prices at the dive shop are ridiculous. The beach is not very good and the ocean water out there is full of seaweed and not very pleasant for swimming. That is a downside to this place. Two pools, one kiddie pool, and two hot tubs. Seems to be very popular with youngsters. I plan to take my family out there some day, will check out Gilligan's Island then.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Services”
Reviews.Author: doctorphd113
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time ! Massages were great ! Small one with everything you need . Was not crowded and the Solarium Area is great for couples with gives a sense of VIP AREA. Next time will be choosing the Romantic Side by Side. Good manners staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: AOVirginia
Reviews.Content: This ridiculously expensive hotel has beautifully manicured grounds, but the good part ends out there. One wishes the grounds manager would take over the whole operation. The ocean view rooms are large, with a nice view, but poorly maintained, with derelict furniture and non-functional equipment. The beach has murky water, full of seaweed, and is only pleasant if you are a non-discriminating toddler. The swimming pools are also shallow, good for very small kids. Forget about snorkeling, you must hire a boat. The bar charges outrageous prices for forgettable breakfasts, Folgers like- coffee described as expresso, local beer and anything else. The restaurant is better, but not a great value. If you want to visit Guanica's dry forest (which is worth the trip) come, spend a few hours and leave.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort, Quiet and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: 25thStreet
Reviews.Content: Copamarina is situated on a lovely stretch of beach, and during the time we were there, it was quiet and serene. The rooms were serviceable and clean, the grounds are lush and manicured, there are several pools to hang out by, and it was utterly relaxing. The only downsides were 1) there's basically nothing else to do in Guanica or the close surrounding towns, 2) the food generally took a long time to arrive, and was decent but nothing to rave over (apparently they used to have a great chef, but he or she has since departed, and there are no other places to eat in the vicinity). But other than that, it was a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great ocean view, great food, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ellswad
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the remodeled rooms last visit. The remodeled rooms are very nice. The rooms that have not been remodeled are nice and comfortable, but not as nice as renovated rooms. The property manager, Mariel, is a very nice professional woman. The property is well suited for honeymooners, families, or individuals who just want to get away for some peace and quiet. The beach is calm and the grounds are well manicured and easy for anyone to maneuver around. Guilligan's Island is a short but beautiful boat ride away. Pack some sandwiches and drinks, take a raft and snorkeling gear, and have a wonderful day - but go early during high tourist season. Ocean view and sunsets are beautiful! The hotel is about 20 - 30 minutes from some of the most beautiful beaches in Southwest PR. I have stayed at Copamarina several times in both remodeled and not remodeled rooms and have enjoyed every minute. The bar and resturant both have very good food. I've never had a bad meal, breakfast, lunch or dinner. In fact, I take my guests from the U.S. to enjoy lunch and/or dinner because the atmosphere is excellent and the quality of the food is too. Yes, I live in Boqueron, PR. Retired here one year ago. I go to Copamarina to relax and escape my daily routine, and I have a magnificant ocean view from my home. The bottom line is that if you are a party animal, go to San Juan. But if you're looking for quiet, peaceful accommodations where you can escape from stress and relax, this is the place. Recommend that you ask for a renovated room if one is available because there is a difference. The pools are nice and clean and large enough for those who like to swim for exercise. It is a great place to stay and tour the Northwest and Southwest areas of PR. Recommend an SUV for traveling to some beach areas because the paved roads sometimes end and you travel through pot hole ridden dirt roads to park and walk to the beach. For instance, the scenery at the Cabo Rojo lighthouse and the adjacent, absolutely beautiful Playa Sucia (beach) can be difficult to get to in a car. Enjoy your visit to PR!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful escapade”
Reviews.Author: cuchuka87
Reviews.Content: Copamarina Beach Resort Hotel is undoubtedly and undisputedly one of the best hotels in Puerto Rico. I have stayed there on multiple ocassions with my best friends and boyfriend and had a marvelous time. It is a place where you breathe tranquility and peace, having time to just relax, lay back and spend quality time with yourself and your thoughts AND your loved ones... amazing! This is what I call a healthy, true to itself, vacation. -Rooms are cozy, clean, pretty, well-themed... not to mention incredibly spacious. They invite you to be at pleasure with yourself......... -Their restaurant has got a sociable, efficient staff. Excellent food and service. -Multiple romantic, private spots to enjoy with your significant other. -Beach is quite interesting and beautiful. They have curtained beds placed in the sand. -They take you to Gilligan Island which is a must when you visit Guanica. -It is a few steps away from Ballena Beach which has got a magic of its own. -Loved the pool and the jacuzzi!

Reviews.Title: “October 10, 2009 - Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Katny2426
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have been planning this wedding for over a year now. She went to visit and immediately feel in love with the resort. The Resort is absolutely beautiful. The ground are stunning. Rooms huge (and I've traveled a lot), spacious with a stunning view of the ocean. They have 2 good size pools. The beach is 5 ft from the pool. Beautiful, blue, calm ocean. Perfect for little ones. Fly in to either Ponce or Aguadilla Airports. The ride to the hotel is a lot shorter then flying into San Juan. The Event Planner at the Resort was on point. We working via email for months until 2 days I arrived before the wedding (By the way.. I was the wedding planner and sister of the bride). As soon as my husband and I got there Thursday afternoon they welcomed us with open arms. Our rooms were ready. We checked in and we were off to our room. The Event planner immediately heard I was checking in and came to introduce herself. She prepared the rest of the day to show me around the hotel. We had a king size bed, refrigerator, iron, safe, and hair dryer in our room. We even had breakfast table and sofa that sit 3 adults comfortably... with plenty of room to walk around and not trip over your luggage. Yup that's how big the rooms are. Not your typical standard hotel room. The wedding was October 10, 2009. 48 guests flew in from practically every where and arrived in Puerto Rico from different airports. The hotel had directions on their website which we sent all of the guests. Everyone rented their own cars and drove to the hotel. Everyone was so pleased with the directions. Considering the fact that we had some guests which never been to Puerto Rico before... driving can be a little tricky. NO ONE GOT LOST! Sorry I can't comment on the restaurants because I was too busy planning for the wedding. I did hear from the guests that the food was good...but wished it has more of the authentic food served in PR. Prices are reasonable! The day of the wedding. Ceremony was at 5pm (sunset). Cocktail hour and Reception was immediately following the ceremony. Couldn't ask for a better day. Everyone who was assigned to help out for the wedding was great. We changed the details of the reception several times and the staff was there working with us. We set up the room / centerpieces, decorations and it looked amazing. Just check out the pictures. The ceremony was absolutely breath taking. The food at the cocktail hour and reception was really good. (no I'm serious) It was really, really good. My sister picked appetizer / salad and for the main course Filet Mignon and Lobster tail. The best man also surprised the groom with a Cigar Roller. I think I'm saying that right. Well he hired a person which rolls fresh cigars and it was which was a huge hit. The wedding was the event of the year. Everyone had so much fun. Thank you again to the CopaMarina Resort for making it a truly memorable wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing & Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: acr1025
Reviews.Content: Had my wedding at the CopaMarina Beach Resort, and would recommend it to anyone, had friends and family fly in, and everything went without a hitch. Staff amazing and courtesy and helpful all the time. Rooms were big and spacious, clean and bathroom pretty big. Spa was truly amazing. Everything a bride could ask and more.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: TheMckitricks
Reviews.Content: We had a great vacaton here.. The staff was awesome, the pools were bath water warm and open all night!!! The food was my least favorite part and the only thing i did not enjoy! The ocean was beautiful but had tons of seaweed and hard to play in. There were tons of families there and was definitley kid friendly. We really enjoyes going to guiligans island and snorkling. We rented a car and went to the grocery store to pick things up and that was needed as far and snacks and such. Not tons of activities so this is for a relaxtion vacation. If you like swimming and relaxing this is the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: Raul27
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice beach getaway this is the place. Nice place with great ambiance and for couples is great.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous !!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen1954
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this resort .. all the food, the employees, the ground, the pools & the little Island (you take a boat ride to get there). Our room was infront of the grounds near the 1st pool and It was great for my little kids because right next to that pool is a kids pool. This hotel offers everything youâ€™ll ever need and more, I loved that itâ€™s apart from all the noise and itâ€™s so peacefull. The only thing that we (husband & I) didnâ€™t like itâ€™s that you donâ€™t have much to do at night time â€¦ no night life at all. If this resort had a Casino it would be perfect !!. Guilligan Island itâ€™s so beautifull with the clear blue waters and the little gazeboâ€™s for people who go there. I DO recommend this hotel for all type of people .. it was our first time there and believe us when we say it wonâ€™t be the last !!! PS My husband and I had a little concerned, the week we where staying there we went to the little gift shop/beach house (return our towels and take our deposi back) and we saw a flirtiness between (wha I think is) a Supervisor of the resort and a young lady who worked there at the gift shop. I understand and believe that in a work area co-workers NEED to get along and respect one another but you need to trace a profesional line between supervisors and workers.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly more than we expected”
Reviews.Author: mgshn
Reviews.Content: The biggest plus was the staff and the service they provided even by PR standards. For example, we received a coupon to upgrade our room and one came available the second day of our stay. After we moved we noticed there was only a shower, no tub. That meant bathing our baby would be difficult. I mentioned the issue to the manager and said we would prefer not to move again. Within an hour she had a brand new baby tub delivered to our room! The food was great, the beer was cold, and the drinks were well made. Our daughter had a lot of fun playing in the shallow water at the private and a bit gravely beach. What we didn't like so much were the twisty narrow road leading to the property and wasting our time visiting Gilligan's Island. A few more activities there weren't any might have been nice though I didn't seem to miss them. It also would have been nice to have an indoor/air conditioned kid friendly restaurant but again, things worked out very well the way they were. Other pleasant features were the LCD TV, decent wireless internet, and having everything within the hotel a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Where the locals get-a-way...”
Reviews.Author: MisssMolly
Reviews.Content: This is a truely honest review. My boyfriend and I booked this resort for a 3 day 2 night start of our PR tour. We were very excited as we read that it was rated as a very romantic place for couples and that it was surrounded by a natural dry forest. Well to put it simple, if you do not have a rental car you will be completely STUCK in this resot. There is only ONE road into this resort and it is very windy and cuts through the side of a small mountain. So, if you do have a rental car, be brave enough to treck through the road during the day nevertheless at night when you're trying to get some snacks or looking for entertainment....with NO road lights. If you would like anything beside a soda past 8pm, you're out of luck. Of course you can still go to the bar and spend lots of money for one drink or spend lots of money at the only restuaurant with ok food. If you have kids or if you're like me and wanted some chips at around 9:45, you have to be brave enough to drive through that one road to get to town. The beach looks beautiful...and the set up is so calm and relaxing. What you don't see is that the water never really comes up on their beach and even if it were to, the floor is covered with ocean plants so it would feel weird to walk on it. Their solution ....pay $7 and take a small boat ride to Guilligan's Island. This is a must and honestly the only way you're going to get in some decent natural water. In all, there were many many locals there. They simply just came by in the afternoon and would use the facility as there was no true security in the front. The people were friendly but, still annoying. OH, and breakfast buffet was $18 per person!!! Spend the money in San Juan better :)

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Manuel Antonio National Park, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff and food servce - beautiful property.”
Reviews.Author: PRRicardo
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from Copamarina. The property is very well maintained and is absolutely beautiful. I frequent Copamarina when I have guests from Washington, D.C. area on the way to Guilligans Island. We stop there for lunch. My personal experiences now include all three meals. I have to say that the meals that I've eaten have all been exceptional. For some, the price could be considered to be on the high side. But I don't mind paying for quality food and service. Besides, the food is fresh and the recipes are outstanding. The room that I stayed in has not been renovated yet. It was very comfortable and clean. My only recommendation is that the manager consider putting a new mattress that room while waiting for renovation. Either the mattress was aging, or I just like a firmer mattress. My visit was very pleasant, in large part because of the staff. Everyone including reservations, housekeeping and restaurant staff were very pleasant and accommodating. This property, in my opinion, is really geared to clients who enjoy peace and tranquility. There is no casino or wild evening party music. Rather, a guitarist plays beautiful background music at the outdoor restaurant/bar in the evening, which is relaxing and enjoyable. The hotel beach is great for small children, but Guilligans is much better, and only a short boat ride away. Although the hotel provides shuttle service, there is also a private dock just a couple of minutes away that provides service. That service is private owned, and they offer a lunch menu that they will deliver to Guilligans. Although convenient, quality is lacking as far as I'm concerned. You are better off grilling out or taking a packed lunch. I'm taking a friend to the hotel restaurant tonight for a nice evening out. It's about a 40 minute drive from my retirement home in Boqueron. Have been here for one year, and have found the hotel restaurant to be among the best in the Southwest side of the island. It is fine dining without being forced to wear special evening attire. Casual attire for dining, on this side of the island is the norm. So, overall, I give the Copamarina a rating of exceptional for the aforementioned reasons.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a luxury resort- More of a 2-3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwonder
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Copamarina. After a deployment to Iraq my wonderful husband thought it would be relaxing to take me to Puerto Rico. The Copamarina scenery is very beautiful but definitely should not be considered luxury. The staff is nice nice but lacks the customer service skills necessary to work a real "luxury"hotel. The rooms are small and outdated. They should not charge as much as they do. You can stay at a luxury Marriot for less and get way more for your money. The Copamarina does not have luxory amenities nor do you feel that you are in a resort. The service at both restaraunts is extremely slow and the staff could care less that you have been standing at the bar waiting to order a drink. They just simply continue with their conversation or the hard task of slowly making 1 drink at a time at the slowest pace possible. No sense of any type of urgency to utilize any type of bartending skills necessary to work a "resort " bar. We waited over 20 min to get our coffee after we finished our dessert last night. We had ordered our coffee at the same time as our dessert thinking they would come out together. Our waitress though nice was completely oblivious to the fact that we arrived at 7:30pm and left at 10pm due to slow service. Nor did she offer an apology for the long wait for our coffee. You would think that when you see customers falling asleep at the table because they had been waiting sooo long that a staff member would have checked on them but noooo they also were oblivious to us. Maybe because my family has the unique ability to suddenly turn invisible to avoid waiters and waitresses to wait on us. After reading the other reviews and seeing the responses from the "manager" i would have to say that he is completely delusional if he thinks that his "resort" is up to standard or can even be compared to other luxury resorts. He is in complete denial. He needs to open his eyes and really see what is in front of him. He does not seem to really be listening to what the customers are saying instead only hearing what he wants to hear. He needs a reality check and to actually listen to what people are saying about his "resort" and make the necessary adjustments. He seems to actually blame the customers for their bad experiences at HIS "resort". Unbelievable. I have stayed at luxory resorts before and have NEVER and I say NEVER had to leave a deposit for a pool towel. The staff should be more well versed in what service they provide as they all seem to look clueless when asked about "things to do" at their "resort". Also, at a luxury resort there is usually a concierge to help with activity arrangements and a $235.00 room looks like $235.00 room and actually has an iron to iron your clothes. And the "adult" pool that is filled with small probably pool peeing children is extremely small for a "resort". AND yes, I realize that they have 2 pools and 2 kiddie pools. the other pool is only 3-4 ft deep. AND at luxury resort there is ROOM SERVICE! AND furthermore the beach is not really a beach where you can swim. There are no waves and it is full of yucky grass or seaweed which the manager has stated is part of an ecosytem....blah, blah, blah. The small beach down the strip is rather nice and relaxing though. Overall, the scenery is beautiful and relaxing but I would never consider this a LUXURY resort. I hope the manager reads this review and takes heed but it will probably be lost on him as with all the other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “A glorified Motel”
Reviews.Author: sarilamejor
Reviews.Content: Before I went here I thought this was going to be a chic family hotel , boy was I in for a surprise. The hotel had way to may people...to the point that getting in the pool seemed disgusting. And this are not low profile relaxing people this are rowdy, noisy and people with COOLERS full of their own alcohol, I didn't even know this was even allowed at hotels! The hotel does not have a beach, dont be fooled with that one. We argued with people in the hotel but got no where. It has a dock with a shore that is not suitable for adults swiming, you have to walk 10 min to the public beach nearby. We had the same problem as other people writing here about the check in staring at 3 and having to wait for a room and the breakfastscam. There is no breakfast a la carte but a $18 buffet, we only wanted coffee!! After the first day we ended up going to a Burger King near by for coffee. The towel problem they write on other reviews that never happens, its another LIE!! it happened to me to, pool towels are not available most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “What more could one ask?”
Reviews.Author: Jackietfl
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect get-a-way locale. Beautiful setting with many features. Rooms are lovely. Service is flawless. Yet, it is affordable. We highly recommend this great resort. We are experienced travelers who do not put up with inferior places. This should be a 5 star rated resort and given top billing on your lists.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Peaceful, Fun!”
Reviews.Author: patamitchell
Reviews.Content: Copamarina is a great place. It is secluded, the private beach is very nice - kinda grassy water, though. The staff are wonderful! Be sure to go to Gilligan's Island to snorkel the mangroves. My husband sprained his knee trying to catcht the boat to the island, so the lifeguard/worker, took my daughters and I over and later brought my husband when they picked us up. The food was great as were the drinks! I'd definitely come back when traveling to PV.

Reviews.Title: “Business was Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: boztime
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at Copamarina recently and I will return to this resort every time I have business in Puerto Rico. As I came "home" each day the staff would greet with a smile, and I would receive excellent service from the bar staff. The atmosphere was very peaceful. The grounds were large, picturesque, and quiet. There were kids there but it seemed there was enough going on around the resort to keep them from bothering me. The food was exquisite, best in town, I only ate out when I was with clients in Ponce. It was apparent that the chef, (not to mention the bartenders) only used the best ingredients. I am truly enjoying our expansion into Puerto Rico. If a hotel/resort passes the "three day test" I usually remain faithful to it. This meaning that after three days you have met all the pertinent staff, the food is something you look forward to, and you have exposed any hassles (bottlenecks of comfort flow) of your temporary home. There were no hassles and the check-in/check-out process was a breeze. The pool is top notch. I am not a beach guy so there superbly relaxing poolside was highly appreciated. My only complaint is that the water was a little too wet. Just kidding, I loved it, til next time fellow Copamarinans!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Hassle”
Reviews.Author: 2alarm
Reviews.Content: The grounds were beautiful and the setting was very relaxing. As well, the room was as expected (adequate, not well appointed). The television was tiny but the balcony was nice. However, we would not recommend paying extra for an ocean view. It will get you a second floor room that is not any closer to the ocean. As well, we would not recommend the all inclusive package unless you like consume lots of adult beverages. At Alexandria's, our bill was $60.00 (our most expensive meal). We adhere to a health conscious diet (no alcohol, sweets) and would have been much better off to pay per meal. You simply need to add the amount you project spending on food and compare that to the all inclusive rate to determine if it is advantageous for you and your travel party. BEST: Peaceful location (after 1st night) Beautiful landscaping Guanica Dry Forest (short drive away) Kayaking to Guilligan Island (accessible from the resort) WORST: $15.00 deposit for a beach towel Management/Guest Services - The service was unacceptable. Upon arrival, we inquired about booking excursions and were informed the resort did not provide such services and was not aware of any companies that did so. We inquired further regarding a bio bay tour. The guest services clerk stated the bay was a 30 minute drive from the resort and offered no assistance or suggestions when we indicated we did not know the location. After we reviewed the resort's website (evening), we went back (the following morning) and inquired about the companies which are actually linked to the site. We were, then, given a business card to make our own arrangements. However, we were not able to schedule a full day excursion due to the delay in receiving accurate information. In addition, the resort placed a hold on our credit card for over $6,000.00 (5x the amount of our total bill) which was a huge hassle to resolve. Our credit card company contacted us about the charge due to suspicion regarding fraudulent activity. We, then, had to place a temporary block on the card and could not use it until the excessive charge was removed. As well, we were forced to "jump through hoops" to validate all other charges on the card due to the block. The person working in the accounting department was helpful and apologetic as she could not explain the error. The manager, however, never returned our calls (3 attempts). We were, therefore, not offered an apology or any type of a discount from management for the egregious error. As well, the management failed to offer an apology related to a frightening "domestic" altercation that occurred on our first night at the resort which involved an individual being taken away by police officers. Resort staff certainly cannot guarantee appropriate guest behavior. Good management, however, would have taken proactive measures to assist those who had to endure the altercation @ 1:00 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive - Not a hotel, but an expensive "Parador"”
Reviews.Author: Mig27
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location; a hidden paradise near "Bosque Seco". The few employees of the hotel are very kind. The #5 building don't have an ice machine, neither the #4; you have to walk to building #3 for ice. The hotel beach is full of algae; fortunately, you can walk to the beautiful public beach, near the hotel. The balconies don't provide for privacy from adjacent rooms and corridors. The tv set is from the stone age. The corridors of the buildings aren't clean. The bathroom configuration and decoration is poor; one thing is to create an informal environment and other is a lack of attention to detail; balcony doors and windows are defective. Ohh, I almost forget to mention; hotel needs an extermination service. Bottom line: Too expensive for a "Parador" (yes, it is a "Parador" in a privileged site.)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and relaxing... beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: TMacN
Reviews.Content: A small yet well equipped facility, makes it intimate and quiet but still plenty to do, especially watersports and local exploring/hiking. Seemed a bit peculiar in some policies (like $15 deposits on every towel, and $60 deposit on feather pillows) but they settled up the bill with no hassles at checkout. Restaurant was wonderful. Be forwarned that the extra for an ocean view room only gets you a 2nd floor room with balcony, same building. Better privacy, yes, but not any closer to the ocean!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing long weekend - Kayak to Gilligan's Island if you can!”
Reviews.Author: mallarina
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Copamarina for 4 days the weekend after Valentine's Day. Although we're in our 20s, we are a bit of homebodies and don't like to party, so this was perfect for us. We wanted somewhere quiet, off the beaten path, and sunny and warm to cure our Chicago winter blues! The absolute best part of the trip was renting a kayak for a few hours and going out to Gilligan's Island. The beach at the resort isn't good for swimming--there's a lot of seaweed--so going out to Gilligan's was quite a treat. I've never seen such beautiful water! We're quite low-maintenance, so we didn't really talk to anyone at the desk except at check-in and check-out, which went smoothly. The food was fine, not *amazing*, but quite good, and the service at the restaurant was good. Drinks were fantastic, strong but still tasty (no overwhelmingly liquor-y flavor). Location was spectacular--the drive from San Juan was amazing. The grounds are beautiful, although there were some seed pods or something on the grass between our patio and the sidewalk that were a little uncomfortable to walk on barefoot, but were easy to avoid in daylight. The pools and hot tubs were very clean and nearly empty most of the time--actually the whole resort was nearly empty, probably because it was the week after Valentine's day. We'll definitely return again to go to Gilligan's Island, and to go hiking (we didn't get the chance to go this time, but the Dry Forest looked amazing from the road and from the brochure).

Reviews.Title: “Tries for luxury but misses the mark”
Reviews.Author: rrzzll
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I actually have some mixed feelings about this place. The grounds are very well kept. The views are great and the entertainment at the outdoor bar was professional and fun, although I have to admit that my date could make anyplace fun. She wound up singing Spanish folk songs with the guitarist and kept being called back for encores. However, the restaurant/bar is a total rip-off. Stayed there one day and night and wound up spending over $200 on food and drinks for 2 people. Our room was a hike from the front desk (literally). No elevators. We had to drag our luggage up the stairs. Rooms themselves are very plain. The beachfront is not a place you would want to swim. Forget about using a jacuzzi (too crowded) unless you want to get up very early in the morning. They had a huge foozball machine in the gameroom that we really wanted to play but was informed by the front desk that it hadn't been working for months. All in all would not recommend this place. Might want to stop in on a Saturday night though to check out the entertainment if you live nearby. BYOB though (lol..)

Reviews.Title: “Fifth time the charm? Hmmmm.......”
Reviews.Author: dylaud
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Copamarina five times, maybe six at this point since I may have lost track....Here's my yearly internet review...one of the many I post on various sites... :) Here's the good and bad.... We were happy with the new flat screen television in our room...the beds were comfy too unlike what some of the other reviewers wrote....the mattresses felt new as well.....our room, room 105, has a big patch of dirt where the grass had not grown outside our patio area and it made for a very messy patio and room which was a pain...that whole immediate patch of rooms are that way...102, 103, 104, 105, 106.....not good rooms to stay in patio- wise....we had that room assigned to us a few years ago and I had switched the room because of that problem but this time as soon as we checked in I unpacked our luggage and toiletries and had forgotten about that's room patio area so it was too late for me to ask for a change of room since I didn't want to haul all our stuff out of the drawers again, etc......they really need to put grass down there or even make it a cement extension or something because we had Housekeeping very busy with cleaning that patio...lots of extra work for them and a nuisance for us.... Our stay was different than other times because we've gone in years past during non-holiday, non-peak times so in years past, if the resort was crowded, it was crowded with people from the States such as ourselves or Europeans and it always felt peaceful. This time schools on the island were closed early for Holy Week, Good Friday, and the resort got jam packed with locals. The room next to ours was occupied by a couple and their two kids and they were really rowdy and loud...at around 11:45pm one night I was awoken by the sound of the lounge chairs and the table from the patio next to our room being dragged and thrown around...when I got up, opened the patio door and looked next door, the woman who had checked in had a garbage can full of soapy water and was throwing it on the tiles on the patio and moving the furniture around to get the water under the furniture...at first I asked her in English what she was doing and she didn't understand me so I proceeded to ask her in Spanish what she was doing and why the noise and she told me that housekeeping hadn't cleaned her patio so she was cleaning it...at midnight? Of course I didn't believe it and she saw I was upset so she stopped making all the racket and I went back to sleep. The next morning when I opened the patio door to sit outside there was a horrible smell of vomit!! Now I understood why she was cleaning the patio floor!!! Her husband and friends had gotten back to the room drunk and who knows what happened on that patio!!! Anyway, I called housekeeping who came right away and cleaned my patio and sprayed some special stuff to get rid of the horrible odor. (The housekeeping staff was great to us!) The owner of the resort came by and asked me to write a note about what had happened the night before, etc, so he has it on record since who knows if those crazy guests would wind up eventually destroying the room...apparently according to some employees at the resort, the crazy neighbor guests brought an electric stove into the room and were cooking on it which is a fire hazard and illegal!!!! Supposedly they had used bath towels to clean off the grease from the cooking, etc...anyway, I was told the owner of the resort told them to get all that out of the room and they did...That same morning those same crazy guests, hosted about 25 of their closest family and friends, who were not staying at the Copamarina by the way, but who had arrived with about six coolers full of booze and food...they were smoking right next to my room, cussing, speaking about sex, and everything else, right in front of us and my six year old son. My husband went to the front desk to complain and the Manager told him they can't control who comes into the resort since it's Good Friday and the guests invite their friends to come and stay for the day so after my husband complaining and voicing that it was not fair that our day has to be ruined by these people, the Manager, very reluctantly, gave my husband $80 off that night's rate and four free drink coupons...she had offered him two drink coupons at first and when my husband looked at her like "seriously?" she gave him two more.... I would have much rather they get rid of the low lifes that were invading our space and not allowing us to enjoy our room or patio for the entire day rather than getting the discount, but what were we going to do? If Management allows it......We are regulars there and are considered "VIP's"....we didn't feel like it. We left the resort for the day and just drove around the island...a wasted day and money that we could have spent at the resort...but it was really unbearable....we came back to the resort that night and low and behold the nuts were all there in full force boozing and yelling up a storm in the patio next to ours....another problem the resort had, and which I had complained to the front desk asking for the Manager about, but the Manager was too busy to come out and talk to me, was the beach next door to the resort was also packed with locals and on a few instances the locals walked along the beach onto the resort grounds and used the facilities....I was worried about this since some of us leave things along the beach and poolside that are valuable, like cameras, and these locals can come onto the property, swipe the stuff, and just walk back to their beach...anyway, although the Manager was too busy to come out and talk to me, in fairness she (or perhaps the owner?) did put a security guard at the part of the beach that entered the resort grounds as to deter the non-Copamarina guests from crashing the property again...so I didn't see any of that the rest of the stay...that was indeed rectified.... Bottom line, we will never go back to the Copamarina during any kind of holiday because there are alot of undesirable locals that stay there.... another person staying at the resort, a local himself, told us that the reason people that nasty can afford to stay at the resort is that they probably charged every one of their family members that came to spend the day at the resort with them money so they can pay for the nightly fee...so if they had 25 of their friends and family come to enjoy the pool, beach and facilities with them for the day, they charge them $20 each...amazing! Who knows too if the resort charges the locals less money because they live on the island...something like Disney, you know? Live in Florida and get into the parks at a discounted rate?....who knows....another employee told us he had never in the years he's worked there, seen it so full...he said the capacity was 260 and they were at 290....There was not even a parking spot in the lot which we've never seen before and we were told to park in Employee parking which was very inconvenient....also, not a beach or pool lounge chair was available...by the time we got up and out of our room at 8am or so we were out of luck with finding a good spot anywhere to lay and relax... In fairness, except for the last couple of days of our stay where all this happened, the other four days of our stay were nice... it could have been better by the whole stay being as it always was when we've visited in years past though...also, we didn't see alot of the old faces, employees, we've seen in years past which saddened us...it made us feel like family coming back and seeing the same faces year after year....They either quit or were let go....possibly because of the economy? Luis, the chef, was still there and he is fabulous!!! We love him and he's seen our son literally grow up since we've taken our son to the Copamarina every year since he was about two months old.... :) We're hoping to continue going to Copamarina every year as we always have but right now we are a little disappointed so we'll see...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting, good food, friendly people made for a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: PFT3
Reviews.Content: We found this resort to offer a very nice and relaxing experience. Without exception we were treated well and the staff was attentive. We did not have any accidents or other glitches so cannot comment on their response to problems. We found the food and service at the two restaurants to be quite good especially for the rural setting. The rooms were comfortable and clean, not luxurious. The grounds were fantastic. The snorkeling trip was nice and worth the money. The staff for that were knowledgable and friendly. We went hiking in the dry forest which was a nice walk and well worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, and terrific value”
Reviews.Author: GuinnessWashington
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights with another couple. The regular (garden view) room in fact had ocean views. The room was medium sized but quite comfortable. The staff were very friendly and quite helpful. The grounds are lovely. The food is above average for Puerto Rico. Best of all, the value factor (room cost versus what you got) was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Getaway”
Reviews.Author: LLuetje
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week of relaxing fun. Copamarina doesn't pretend to be a lively place. It's quiet, you are left alone but helped if you need it. The other guests were spread out and the beach was nicely arranged with chairs, tables, loungers and cabanas. The water at the beach isn't deep (you can walk out quite a ways and still have it only be to your waist but I loved this. I could sit in the water and just relax. Little kids could play without parents having to worry. The surf is calm as it's in a protected bay so you can pull your chair right into the water if you like. The rooms were comfortable and I definitely felt it was worth it to get the deluxe ocean front room. We had the best location right on the ground level to all the resort had to offer. Other rooms may have an ocean view, but there is a portion of the property enclosed by a fence at the beach--to denote privacy--and we were glad we had an unobstructed view. The fitness room was clean, cool and well equipped. They also have a water bubbler in there which was a nice treat to fill up my water bottle with cold water. The pools were quiet and serene, and I loved dipping in the hot tub at night. We also really liked the location. It was quiet and away from the tourist traps you might find in other sections of the island. Plus, they only get 15 inches of rain per year so even though Ponce might get a sprinkle of rain, Copamarina was sitting in the sun. San German is an easy half hour drive and well worth the trip to a quaint town with great places to eat on the square. Ponce, Lajas and La Paguera were all an easy 20 minute drive. Further down on 333 from the resort is a very large, nice beach with walking trails. We went in the afternoon before sunset and there seemed to be next to no one there--I'd spend the day here before going to the public beach. The only negative things I have to say about the place were that the bedding could use some updating and the restaurants were nothing special. The comforters were a bit haggard, not too bad but certainly not luxury. And, the beds weren't the most comfortable. I still slept fine, but this would be an amazing place if the beds could be upgraded. The restaurants are convenient but in my opinion are over priced for okay food--especially the drinks. I recommend going to the Econo in town to pick up drinks, snacks and breakfast items, eating lunch at the resort (they had more selection and it these meals were delicious) and then getting dressed up to go out of the resort for dinner. There really are several choices either in Guanica, Lajas, Ponce or San German. Look for the Tapas Bar in the square in San German--amazing food and SO cheap! Three people ate and drank for $50! The resort has a dive shop that offers trips and from what I can tell the best thing might be to take out the kayaks and visit Gilligans Island on your own. We took the shuttle boat and realized that we could have easily kayaked ourselves over. Once you're over there, you're stuck until you get picked up and though you can snorkel, , there isn't much to see right near the island. I would have liked the ability to explore a bit more and will do this the next time I visit. Also, I wish I would have known ahead of time but Gilligan's Island actually has a bathroom facility, picnic tables in spots with cookout areas. It would have been nice to come prepared to bbq. Go early to get a secluded spot. We enjoyed sitting at on the beach or by the pool and at night we relaxed while listening to the live mellow music and overall had a wonderful stay. I would definitely go back to Copamarina.

Reviews.Title: “when it's good it's very good, but when it's bad it's horrible...”
Reviews.Author: joandaveyg
Reviews.Content: Vacationed at the Copamarina in January '07 with my daughter. had a lovely time. Landscape is beautiful, food is more than adequate and the beach is both pretty and swimmable. Liked it so much I returned with my husband the following February. Unfortunately, this trip was a total disaster. On our first day, after a swim in one of the pools, we went back to our room and naturally wet the floor with our dripping suits. The floors are marble and when I removed my flip flops I took a flop and broke and dislocated my arm. While this probably could have happened at any resort what ensued could only happen at a place that puts absolutely no emphasis on customer service or safety. It was already dark and we asked the desk person for an ice pack and ace bandage. Sorry, no ace bandages and no ice, yes your heard that right, no ice! Could someone help us get to the nearest hospital or clinic? No they could not. Upon our repeated requests, really more like begging, since the roads are so dark and winding, they found someone who would be passing the clinic on their way home and that we could follow, but would have to find our own way back. Well, we didn't have a better offer so took them up on that one. After a very painful and difficult evening we returned to The Copamarina where my husband, with absolutely no assistance from any hotel staff, spent the evening trying to arrange for a trip home the following morning, which we were able to do, at great expense to us. We paid for our nights lodging and two meals which we had. No one from the resort ever contacted us to find out how I was. After several months, when I was on the mend, I called to express my disappointment with the way in which they handled our situation. The new general manager, explaining that the previous manager was no longer employed and his poor record was part of the reason, apologized profusely and asked that we please consider returning as guests of the resort and to please contact him to make the arrangements. This month we decided to contact the resort and return. Not only was the manager that we had corresponded with not there, but we were given the run around for 2 weeks via email. Finally we were given an offer to return that was just slightly better than what was available on priceline. At no point did the management make us feel that they were anxious to compensate us, but rather that we were just looking for a bargain. In any case we have decided not to return since we were certainly not seeking a bargain, but rather what had been promised and we felt deserved by us. Instead we will be vacationing at Casa Islena and hope that we will be able to recommend it to other Tripadvisor customers.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort”
Reviews.Author: eamg79
Reviews.Content: Husband and I ended a trip through PR here and loved it. The rooms exceeded expectations, the grounds were lovely, the beach was great. Our only small negative was the Las Palmas restaurant. We were hoping for lots of fresh seafood choices and local cooking styles, but were disappointed. They obviously cater to Americans with a menu of red and white Italian, hamburgers and conventionally prepared red meat and chicken. Regardless, we still loved the place and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Our 4th time here”
Reviews.Author: ilive4sun
Reviews.Content: We have spent a week here for the last four years in January. Our favorite thing about the place is the people who work there. The weather is outstanding too....always 85 and sunny during the day and like a warm summer evening every night. We always rent a car and drive over from San Juan. The signs are in Spanish, but the MPH are American, with the distances in metric. It's a 2 hour drive, and easily done by taking the Tedoro Moscoso Bridge (the one with all the flags on it) to Rt. 17. Stay in the right lane and take the Caguas exit to Rt. 52 south. This will take you over the mountains (with a few tolls along the way...less than $5 total). In Ponce, Rt. 52 converts to Rt. 2. On Rt. 2 just past Yauco, take exit #194 to Rt. 116. At the 3rd traffic light, take a left (by the Burger King) onto Rt. 333. Watch your speed in the school zone and beware of stray dogs, then wind your way along the coast (yes, it's a narrow road!) past the beautiful cliffs and scenery. Copamarina is about 3-4 miles on the right, just past the Cana Gorda public beach. It is true that there isn't a whole lot to do, compared to other resorts in big cities. Guanica is a small town, but it sits right in that Dry Forest area, which gives it much less humidity and rain than say San Juan. We love to hike in the Dry Forest. There are trails off of Rt. 334 in the hills where you can see lots of birds, including the adorable Puerto Rican Tody. This curious little hummingbird-sized bird will actually come out to check you out as you walk the trail! On the Meseta Trail at the end of Rt. 333 (turn right out of the hotel and continue a few miles to the end of the road) is gorgeous....you walk right along the coast, where you'll see birds you've never seen before, plus a lot of Kestrels! Get there early however, because it gets HOT! Also, that is a hotspot for male prostitution, but we've never encountered any problems when we hike there every morning. The hotel itself has beautiful grounds. Lots of pretty plants and blooming bushes and trees. A lot of them are labeled. They are constantly raking and trimming. The pools are nice and well cared for. The beach is somewhat small and does have seagrass, but they are good about raking up anything that gets in the sand. Beyond the sand, in the water, is more like silt - where the seagrass grows. It's not a swimming beach! We've never gone to Gilligan's Island, but it's a cheap ferry ride for those interested. The rooms have barely changed in the four years we've gone there. They could use some updating. Our room, 210, did have a brand new BIG flat screen TV which was appreciated! They don't have the major ABC, NBC, etc. networks however. They have ESPN and CNN, plus a few HBO channels and others...maybe about 24 in total? The new dresser under the TV is nice to not only put clothes in, but there's lots of room on top of it for clothes or whatever. There are no elevators to the 2nd floor, but you can get assistance from the bellman to get your bags to your room. We stayed in room 410 our first night before being moved to our favorite room, and the TV had not been updated yet. Also, that bed was a bit saggy in the middle and not comfortable. The bed in 210 was great however. Re: the views, the best views in our opinion, are in the 200 building on the 2nd floor. The bathroom needs better lighting. Also, there are no bathtubs in the 100, 200 or 300 buildings, in case that matters to you. We let them know on earlier visits that they could use more hooks in the bathroom, and lo and behold, they added some! The shower has good water pressure, but once in a while the temp fluctuates, which is typical in the Carribbean. The bath products supplied are good quality, although the mint fragrance is not our favorite. The maids do a good job getting in and making up the rooms while you're out. Sometimes they had already finished by the time we returned from breakfast! We skipped the all-inclusive deal, and figured that we'd have spent an extra $240 or so a day if we had gone that route, so anything we spent that was less than that was saved! This allowed us to not be gluttons! That way too, we could afford to tip the servers well for their excellent service, and still save $$. They recently got a very good new chef for the Alexandra restaurant, Fernando. He and another chef, Eric, plus the ones at Las Palmas do a nice job of cooking local flavors plus good old American type cooking (be careful though if you don't like garlic!). The burger and carrot cake at Las Palmas are SO good! We also love the omelets prepared by Luis, and the banana/walnut pancakes for breakfast. We were surprised to see the iced tea & lemonade glasses have been downsized and the price increased. The prices for beer and drinks are definitely up there. If you venture off the resort, you'll find much more reasonable prices. We love the outdoor dining though and the view of the water, boats, sunsets, etc., and the fact that we don't have to drive....we just walk right back to our rooms. Tito does an excellent job playing the guitar! He knows MANY different genres, so don't be afraid to request something! The bartenders are a lot of fun.....Raul, Carlos, Jaime. The servers can really make your trip a good one. Some of them have become like family to us. Kudos to Ramon, Madi, Valerie, Sullybeth, Jessenia, Wanda, Brandomar, Dalimar, Love, Nelson, and their manager Wilfredo, took very good care of us. Don't be afraid to venture out. We've visited Cabo Rojo, La Paguera, Ponce, and some of the west coast beaches. The signs are in Spanish, but if you just follow the names of the towns you want, you should be okay. Seems like everyone speaks at least a little English. All this being said, we still love Copmarina but it is not cheap to stay here. We might have to move on to another resort next time around to see if we can get more for our money. Then again, when next January rolls around, we might end up right back there.

Reviews.Title: “We owned the place!”
Reviews.Author: laly_swishy_tail
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this resort just before Christmas on a weekday. That's when we went, and that's when hardly anyone else was there. It was like we owned the place. For people who really like a quiet vacation--this is the place! Even the adjacent public beach was TOTALLY empty on Monday and Tuesday. Additionally, the staff is friendly and helpful. Some fun things to do outside of the resort: snorkel around Gilligan's island, eat at Rivera Panaderia in Guanica, (if you're used to city life, this place will look like a dump from the outside, but the SANDWICHES, YUM!!!!), go walk around the dry forest--on the way, look for a handwritten sign on someone's fence that says, "Se vende limber.' Limber is kinda like a Puerto Rican version of sorbetto. It's almost always sold out of someone's house and costs about $1 or less per serving. Just as you're coming into town from the resort, there is a little bar/shack on the left side of the road that sells coco frio--that's coconut milk right out of a coconut drilled right in front of you, (look for the coconuts on top of an ice machine). Other people's reviews are only partially correct when they say that there is nothing to do in Guanica outside of the resort--especially on Mondays and Tuesdays. However, the best thing about Guanica that is available everyday is its people. Try making your Puerto Rican vacation like a Rick Steve's Through the Back Door book and get to know the people and lifestyles of Guanica. One more thing...right off the highway on the way to Copamarina is a trailer where some locals sell pretty decent pizza. Try it! You know you'd never do it in the states because it would be disgusting. In Guanica, it's part of the local culture. Just start talking to people, in any language, and you'll find that everyone is exceptionally hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice McResort”
Reviews.Author: ev94114
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place to stay. Not a lot of character, but the rooms were relatively clean. The floor was somewhat covered in sand, but for the most part, the beach stayed outdoors. The grounds are gorgeous and the Las Palmas cafe was pretty good, not great but good. The service and live guitar player made it a very pleasant dining experience. There's no beach to speak of so you'll be heading down the coast for that.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: sindoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort the week between christmas and New Years. We had mixed feelings about our stay at the resort. On the one hand the resort is away from it all and is a good place to relax and unwind, on the other hand the facilities at the resort especailly the accomodations could use some face lifting. Focusing on the good things, the pools are great, there are enough activities to keep kids busy for a few days. The resort is close to some of the nicer beaches we have seen in Puerto Rico. On the flip side the accomodations are just bad compared to the money being charged. A Super 8 motel would have better accomodations than these guys. If your idea of accomodations is a squeaky iron bed on wheels with a really old uncomfortable matterss then this is the place for you. The TV's are the small RCA TV's from I dont even know when. I also dont see any reason for paying more for ocean view rooms as opposed to garden view...I dont really see the difference since there are only two floors in the buildings. The resort is away from it all so be prepared to pay top dollar for the two on site restaurants. Summing it up we think that the resort is really not worth the money , if you really want to explore the beautiful beaches in this section of puerto rico there might be better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Copamarina Soothed the Cranky Traveler”
Reviews.Author: JackieElla
Reviews.Content: I will start this review by saying that my daughter and I call my husband "The cranky traveler". He pretty much hates the process of travel and it takes him days to get in the groove of the vacation. That was not the case at Copamarina. He instantly fell in love with the casual, peaceful atmosphere and the beautiful grounds and pools. I had to literally drag him out of the jacuzzi when it was time for dinner. We both truly enjoyed the food and the ambience. Our room was clean and comfortable (we had a Deluxe Ocean View room), and management was very responsive with the few requests that we had (extra pillows, etc.) We tend to be pool people, not beach people, so we didn't have an issue with the beach as some people seem to have. However, during our stay, there were people on the beach having a great time. We are avid golfers and took two days to play at the new 18 hole course in Ponce - Costa Caribe. Heaven! We will go back in 09 as this may well be our new favorite escape.

Reviews.Title: “Have been there many times, I love it and will keep going back”
Reviews.Author: NancyAdam
Reviews.Content: I frequent the Copamarina 2-3 times a year and I love it. I love the fact that it is isolated, not many people around and the grounds are beautiful. If you want a quiet, relaxing vacation (who doesn't) then this is the place for you. Can't wait to go back in February!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: olde_tyme_style
Reviews.Content: It has been quite a while since I stayed at the Copamarina, but the memories are so vibrant that it seems like it was just yesterday... If you are looking for a secluded tropical atmosphere, than this is the resort for you. On the southwestern side of the island, you are almost a 3 hour car ride from the hustle and bustle of San Juan. The property grounds are expansive and quiet and the property is on a white sand beachfront that is very clean. What I really loved is that scattered about the property are aviaries with beautiful parrots inside. Some of the aviaries are larger than others. The parrots did not make any noises that would disturb guests. Matter of fact, they were much quieter than the guests. I would have liked to see the parrots have more activities in their cages because some looked bored and some looked like they were in too small of cages and like they existed solely for their beauty and not their comfort. The room I stayed in was nice. It was on the ground floor of a two story building. There was a nice door that opened to the gardens with tropical flowers that I enjoyed. The garden door had a top and a bottom that can be opened in two different pieces for a nice ocean breeze if you choose. The decor was nice too. It was not top of the line, but in good condition, tropical and pretty. The bathroom had a few small rogue ants on the counter that most likely came in through an open window near the ceiling. I really dislike bugs, but the ants did not bother me at all and I was able to quickly get rid of them and I don't remember them coming back after that. There was a fantastic ocean view from the room when the garden door was open. The grounds were well maintained. The housekeeping staff did a nice job at maintaining the room during my stay and the public areas were kept clean too. The cleaning staff mops the terra cotta tile in the common area outside the front of the room early in the morning so be careful, I slipped and fell on the wet floor, but was ok so just laughed it off. I needed to use the laundry machine and I don't recomend it for delicate garments because it ripped an item, but overall no biggie - I didn't have a garmet bag for the wash as I would at home. The beach was amazing and I did many watersports. I took an aqua cycle, kayak and a water scooter and had a great time. I didn't think these were included in the price of my stay since I didn't go all-inclusive, but didn't get charged extra for these when I checked out. There were great lounge chairs sunk partially into the ocean that were so memorable to me. It was such a greta experience to be lounging in the late afternoon sun and have gentle waves washing up on the seat of the lounger to cool me down. The water was so blue and was never rough surf. The restaurant was tasty. Breakfast had a variety of hot and cold items and was included because I booked using the "Puerto Rico Is Fun package". I don't know if the country's tourism department still promotes tourism with this package. I did dinner at least one night and remember having a tender fillet with baked plantain chips garnished with caribbean fruits-yum! If you are looking for a relaxing vacation or a vacation where you can be in touch with nature in the ocean or at the dry forest nearby than this is for you. I am not a surfer, but nearby in Rincon there is great surfing and beaches, although becoming increasingly popular since my stay. If you would like to leave the resort to explore I recomend a car rental since you are in a secluded area of the island. There was also a bioluminescent bay in Llajas where you can take a boatride to see. It was threatened by boat pollution 6 years ago so I don;t know if you can still see it. Llajas is a very small town with friendly people. If you are not comfortable with this type of environment than the boatride might not be for you. I didn't want to leave and tried to extend my stay on the day I checked out, but the resort was booked solid. Locals sometimes come to stay at the resort to enjoy themselves because it is so beautiful and offers many fun amenities.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ManoloJuncosPR
Reviews.Content: been there at least twice a year since 2005 an every time it gets better and better!!!! The people are great in the resort, look for Raul, Maria and Carlos In Las Palmas Bar they know how to treat costumers they always give the extra mile to make you feel great. For the management, "dont let those people go of your property" they are the reason why everything there is more pleasant . If you like a place to stay for complete relaxation this is the place. great grounds food and good people.

Reviews.Title: “Copamarina good value but skip the beach”
Reviews.Author: NatureDude
Reviews.Content: Since this resort has a lot of mixed reviews I thought I'd add our experience. First, the staff was great and upgraded us without asking to a suite at the end of a building so it had views on 3 sides. The room was great with nice if a bit cheap furniture, comfortable bed, sitting area, etc. The resort grounds are very nice with typical tropical resort landscaping and a nice newer pool at one end. The restaurant and bar are also quite nice. The resort is well patronized by Puerto Ricans as we were possibly the only gringos there at the time but we still felt very welcome. Now for the negative part: the beach is not conducive to laying out or swimming. It is a very "biologically-active" beach so we're talking muck that smells like raw sewage making it rather unpleasant to try to lay out within 30 feet of it let alone swim near shore. The owners claim it is a bioreserve and so the intact sea grass beds create this situation. That is fine but it is not a pleasant beach atmosphere. The "swimming" beach a short walk away is a public park beach that we found littered with garbage and excrement and it has an extremely steep profile so waves break right on it making it unsuitable for swimming especially for children. The cove however is really nice and we rented a hobie cat and had a great sail. While we were there a sunken boat was blocking the way to Giligan's Island so we could not get there, perhaps that has been cleared by now. I would still recommend this resort as a good value with nice amenities but I'd drive somewhere else for beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, Idyllic, Serene”
Reviews.Author: Justine77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Copamarina for my birthday - and what a perfect gift it was. The grounds are beautiful, and the whole resort is filled with a peaceful, tranquil ambience. It was the best getaway for our busy lives. We booked the All-inclusive package, and it is really a great value. The spa treatments were heavenly, and we took a day trip to hike in the Dry Forest. Copamarina is the perfect place to be active or to relax, whatever you want to be each day. For the record, we thought the food was awesome (to contradict what some posters have stated). But, to each his/her own I guess. We loved our stay and will be back, soon I hope!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Coqui55
Reviews.Content: Since the Hilton at Ponce was booked we opted to stay at the Copamarina because of the proximity to Ponce and that the resort listed beach front. Although the room rates were "somewhat high" I figured that the hotel/resort would be worth the stay. Was I wrong! The room is old and in need of renovation. The beds are hard and horrible. Not comfortable at all. The A/C unit did not work properly, it was barely 75 degrees in the room. The TV did not have a good reception. I informed the front desk of these problems and none were corrected. I was offered another room, however when I checked the other room the A/C had the same problem, and the room wasn't any better. The beach was horrible! A public beach is a few hundred yards away and the swimming there is awesome, the water is clean. Yet, at the Copamarina the water and sand is disgusting. The resort nickles and dimes you for everything, even a short trip to a nearby island. (The Conquistador in Fajordo has a private island and they don't charge you to take you there). When you go check out the beach towels you are immediatley told that there is a $15.00 dollar fee per towel if you don't return them. If you want to take a kayak there is a fee. There is nothing for free!!! And the resort charges too much to stay there!. The restaurant, The Alexandra, is rated five stars. However, when we ate there the food was horrible. My sister-in-law and my husband ordered the same dish, the shrimps were hard. My sister-in-law's husband ordered a New York Strip and was brought another type of meat that was hard and dry. The food took forever to reach the table. While we made reservations for 8:30pm, ordered crab cakes (which were horrible), it an hour to get our food. And the restuarant was not full. The waitress was less than pleasing. In addition, when I got my credit card bill the Copamarina charged me additonal for unknown reason, which I am disputing. I would not recommed this hotel to anyone. If you can't find somthing in Ponce keep going. Save your money. And I agree with the last entry, the reception desk was less than friendly when I told them the problems that we had experienced. Even thought I had spoken to the same person on the phone about the room's A/C and TV problems he asked me upon check out if I had reported these problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: nut4cars
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. We thought the hotel grounds were beautiful. The rooms were very nice,clean and comfortable. The food at the restraunt was very good. We felt the breakfast buffet was excellent but a little too pricey for breakfast. This was a very kid friendly resort. We had a 3 year old with us and there was plenty to do to keep him occupied. We would very much like to return and stay longer. This time we only stayed 3 nights next time we would like to stay at least 5 nights. We recommend going to Gilligans Island good snorkling and swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant receptionist - and supervisor”
Reviews.Author: ThalassaPR
