Reviews.Content: Arrogant and unaccommodating receptionist and supervisor during check-in (air-conditioner malfunction in room - refused to change room). Other hotel staff were pleasant. Overpriced accommodations (dismal, old-fashioned room decor) and loud music from neighboring bar between 4:00 and 8:00 pm. The beach is attractive but has sea grass everywhere. Redeeming features: access to Gilligan's Island ($7.32 per person), clean pools, exceptional landscaping.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: yctorres
Reviews.Content: I visited Copamarina with my family in April. I needed sometime to just relax, tan and be with my family. I definitely had the experience I was aiming for. I love the employees and the food. Thanks to Omar Figueroa and Congrats to William Mancia. I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View/Needs service updates”
Reviews.Author: UnhappyBayamon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Copamarina for a girlfriends wedding. I have to say I was very disappointed. As soon as I arrived to my room, I discovered there was a roach in the ceiling. I was immidiately moved to another room only to find the bathroom sink leaking. There was no room service which I was expecting considering the amount of money I spent . I had to drive out to McDonald's late in the night just to get a snack. The breakfast was ok. The pools and pool bars were great and the canopy beds were amazing. The food at the wedding was not so great. The bar ran out of the most popular liquor in the middle of the reception. For the ceremony, they put out white plastic chairs for the guests to sit and a table with a vase of flowers which was were the bride and groom stood in front of to exchange their vows. I beleive for the amount of money the resort made on at least 40 guests for this weddig; they could have and should have done alot better for them.

Reviews.Title: “Both good and bad”
Reviews.Author: snorkeltime
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copamarina for spring break along with another family in April of this year. Our kids ranged form ages 9 to 18. When we got back I sat down and wrote a long and negative review and then accidentally erased it. Now that some time has passed my thoughts are less negative. Hopefully this review will be helpful. I'll start with the good: 1)The grounds are emmaculate - reminded me of Hawaii. These grounds are definitely the pride and joy of the owner. 2) Alexanders was wonderful dining. However fast service does not exist - expect your dinner there to last at least 2 hours. 3) The dive shop was very helpful. We went to Gilligan's island on a ferry and we snorkeled on a sand key off shore from the Copamarina. Both fun excursions that we booked through the dive shop. 4) The wait staff and bar tenders were all delightful. very attentive even when busy. Try the Mojita's--the best I've ever had! Now the bad: 1)Housekeeping in the rooms was minimal. The bathroom floor and shower walls had many hairs and other ick on it from previous guests. I finally just wiped the walls down myself. 2)Our toilet overflowed all over one afternoon. I called the front desk and requested engineering followed by housekeeping. We then left and returned to our room in the evening. Engineering had come and fixed the toilet. They also used all of our towels to mop up the floor, leaving them in a heap in the middle of the bathroom. I called the front desk to enquire about housekeeping. I was told housekeeping was told to come and now they were gone for the night so nothing more could be done. I asked for new towels so I could line the dirty floor with clean towels. I was told that only housekeeping had a key to the lilinen room and again they were gone. After much insisting the evening manager finally agreed to get clean towles out of an empty room if I would come pick them up. When I picked up the towels he also gave me a bottle of disinfectant so I could clean the floor myself!! I spoke with the main manager the next day and was given an apology and that was it. 3)Two in our party got food poisoning from the outdoor restaraunt. 4)The beach is pretty at high tide but not very nice to walk or play in. It basically was made of areas of clay and sea grass. Luckily the island is full of many other beautiful beaches. Would I go back to the Copamarina?? Definitely not. Would I go back to Puerto Rico? Most definitely. The countryside was beautiful with lots to do and the local people were very nice. We felt very safe driving around and exploring!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: marypixa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in different hotels and Inns and by far this place is the best. The place has a special vibe that can be only be described as "relax". The place makes you relax, sleep a while or make you just rewind from all the stress you carry. I can gladly say that at last somebody could unplug my kids from any electronic device and made them normal again. They became curious about their natural surroundings and we all got connected as a family. Time moves different in this place, it's like being in another country. We played all day in the pool and the food at the cafeteria was enormous. The hotel wasn't so crowded because we went during the week. We could visit Guilligan island directly from the hotel, no need to go out. The staff is friendly and they gave us all the information we needed. As some portoricans say we got "married" with this place. Just Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Copamarinia”
Reviews.Author: TENN_Beach_Bum
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Copamarina. The grounds are impeccably kept and there are numerous varieties of plants, trees and gorgeous flowers. We had a Garden View room and it was most impressive. The property has several very large pools and several hot tubs. The onsite restaurants are both very good. The beach is beautiful but not really meant for swimming. Itâ€™s very shallow but still the area is scenic. The pools definitely make up for the lack of beach swimming. Weâ€™d stay at Copamarina again and I hope we do.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Setting”
Reviews.Author: Gburger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Copamarina in April of 2008, for our 25th wedding anniversary. We had read all the reviews and it is funny how there are such conflicting opinions. In general we agreed that the resort is a beautiful setting, but the food leaves much to be desired. One of our main complaints was that even though the resort was almost empty, we were assigned to a room right by the noisy ice machines and maid closet, plus we were directly adjacent (with a shared connecting door) to a large group of young people who obvioulsy went out partying each night (not at the resort) until 3:00am and came home very boisterous. The walls are very thin, so it felt like they were in our room. It made no senss to us that we were not 'spread out'. After the 2nd night, we asked to be moved, and we were accommodated immediately, with no questions asked (we should have asked earlier). Back to the food, we don't consider ourselves food snobs by any means, but we rated the resturants as mediocre. Also, the first night at Alexandra's, we mentioned casually to the matre'd that we had not yet been visited by the waiter, after about 10-15 minutes (we just wanted to place a drink order since it was so nice sitting outside by the pool). Th waiter then showed up, obviously perturbed at our impatience, and rudely asked what we wanted to order, since he assumed we were in a hurry. We explained that we were not in a hurry, just wanted a drink. By the end of the evening we were on chummy terms with him, so it turned out OK. The drive from San Juan took longer than expected, but it is very scenic, and that was the only 'sightseeing' that we did, since we generally did not want to leave the resort, since it is so pleasant and restful. We did the Gilligan's Island trip - definetly over-rated, I'm sad to say. It is very small and very few areas to sit on the beach. We found the service at the resort to be very good, with everyone very friendly (we opted for the all-inclusive plan, so we got to know the wait staff well by the end of our stay). Not sure if the all-inclusive is worth it - you have to eat/drink a lot to justify it. Plus, tips are not included, which adds to the overall cost and makes it harder to justify. I definetly disagree with that policy - I think most all-inclusives include tips. But honestly, we did have a good time and would recommend this resort for a relaxing get-away.

Reviews.Title: “the canopy bed!--Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: osa_maravillosa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the copamarina for a few days in november. we really loved the secluded feel of the hotel. we got there very early in the morning and as we drove to the hotel on a windy, kinda scary , kinda adventurous road up the hill towards the beach we caught the most amazing--breathtaking view of the sun rising over the ocean and the sky was a pale blue color....that experience alone brought a total sense of serenity to our entire trip. the hotel is a bit out of the way from the main town, but we actually really enjoyed being away from the main city. the road is scary to drive through at night, but its not impossible, and it think was just recently paved so if anything itll be a really smooth ride :) the beach at the hotel is not great (and we are beach people) its got all types of seaweed all over it and the sand is more of a clay texture, the water is really warm.... the hotel has these amazing canopy beds on the beach!!!! definitely one of my favorite parts of the hotel---taking the daily nap on the canopy bed....a must! they really do a great job of keeping the hotel grounds really clean and well manicured...it felt really good to walk around and look at all the pretty flowers..... the staff at the hotel and the restaurant were extremely helpful and accommodating---the chef at the restaurant (not the expensive one but the one on the outside) really took care of us and made a vegetarian meal for us that was really tasty. ask at the hotel reception area for recommendations on which beaches to go to....theyre really helpful. Renting a car is necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Very RELAXING!”
Reviews.Author: ricknsue1983
Reviews.Content: We loved the tranquillity of this property. I would say that it is definately worth it to get the all inclusive package. We didn't realize how secluded it was and found out that there was really no other place to go out to eat or shop near by. We loved snorkling and being at the beach and pool though, and enjoyed it so much.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting”
Reviews.Author: RNY
Reviews.Content: We rented a car in San Juan and drove to Copamarina. Just before Ponce we detoured to Tibes to see the very interesting native museum and reconstructed village. The guide was very knowledgeable. It's a challenge to find with few road signs but it's worth the effort and a visit. The resort is down a very narrow, twisty, hilly road. Once you finally get to the hotel the grounds are beautiful with manicured lawns and lots of flowers and Palm trees. The parking lot was full but the resort never felt crowded. There was enough room for everyone to spread out and find a quiet spot. The many beautiful pictures people have posted of the grounds are accurate. On the other hand, there are few pictures posted of the rooms which tend to be dark, small and rustic. We had an ocean front room in building three on the second floor with a balcony. Being an old resort the walls are not very thick so it's possible to hear conversations in the rooms on either side of you. There are vent windows over the shower in the bathroom that open onto the walkway and people should know their conversations in the bathroom can be heard by people passing by. Since we were on the second floor we didn't hear anyone walking above us but that might be a problem in the first floor rooms. The bathroom had obviously recently been renovated and was nicer than the one we had in San Juan with a big tiled shower. The room furniture could stand an updating. And as someone previously said the pillows were small, foam and not very comfortable. We used a back cushion from the chair as a pillow and that worked better. The balcony fan didn't work and two requests to have it fixed were ignored. The balcony furniture was stained and the privacy dividers were lattice so they gave little privacy. However, the view from the balcony was lovely. We ate dinner both nights at the Alexandra Restaurant. Usually we'd go off site after the first night but the resort is fairly isolated and the thought of driving the twisty road in the dark to return to the resort after dinner discouraged us. On the other hand, we had excellent meals both nights at the Alexandra. We ate one of the chef's seafood specials each night and each was delicious. They were of equal or better quality to the dinners we had in San Juan and of comparable cost. The buffet breakfast at Las Palmas was good with a cook making omelots and waffles but at $16 per person it was expensive for what each of us was able to eat. The pools were clean and beautiful and it was great that there were two adult pools, two kids pools, two whirlpools, as well as the beach. The water in the pools and at the beach was very warm which I really liked. The beach was very shallow which was fine for me but swimmers walked to the end of the long dock to find deeper water to swim in. We took the ferry to Gilligan's Island Saturday morning. The ferry and the island were very crowded. Even though only 200 people are allowed on the island each day it's a small island and it fills up quickly. It's a favorite daytrip for local extended families and they know the best places to go early to set up their grills, chairs. etc. There are no services on the island so you need to bring everything you'll need. The resort doesn't rent folding chairs but that would be very helpful since many of the areas have roots and stones which are not particularly comfortable for sitting. We snorkeled along some mangrove island roots and saw lots of Yellow Jacks. The current was very strong but we drifted with it so it worked out okay. All in all, the resort was pretty much what we expected as far as the rooms but the views, landscaping, and Alexandra's were better than we expected. Copamarina was a restful, quiet break from the hubbub of San Juan. I'm glad we decided to explore the south side of the island. It's a beautiful and peaceful area.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and off the beaten path...”
Reviews.Author: Beantowntrekker
Reviews.Content: We drove from San Juan to Guanica on our week-long trip to Puerto Rico. (Neither of us had been to PR previously.) We stayed at the El San Juan hotel in San Juan, and this was quite a different experience. The rooms are, shall we say, 'rustic' and not big at all. The hotel grounds are lush and beautiful, the restaurant Alexandra is excellent and the outdoor, more casual restaurant is very good as well. You really do feel very secluded here. The beach itself is not that great. We were looking for a more tropical beach and decided to take the boat trip to Gilligan's island. We did it on a Sunday and it was super-crowded. We realized that it's a locals hangout on a weekend--and that's fine, but get there early if you want a spot. It would be best to do it during the week and also with water shoes so you can walk through the shallow water without hurting your feet on the rocky bottom. The 'adult' pool was very nice--it wasn't crowded, so it was a nice and peaceful place to relax. For a low-key atmosphere and a place to relax without all the glitz of a big city hotel, this should fit your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - Wonderful Villa”
Reviews.Author: BanannaDC
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in one of the villas at Copamarina, and really enjoyed it. The resort is small, but had everything we needed - a sandy beach, plenty of chairs and shady areas, several pools, water sports (kayaks, catamarans, snorkeling equipment, dive trips), and a beautiful setting for relaxing. The kids especially enjoyed the large grassy areas, the playground, and the inter tidal zone where they found many sea creatures. Outside of the resort we enjoyed hikes in the Guanica Dry Forest - the Copamarina offers a good trail guide. The spacious villa was great for us (6 adults & 2 kids). There were 3 bedrooms and we set up 2 cots in one of the bedrooms to accommodate everyone. There was a complete kitchen, dining room, living room, 2 bathrooms, a wrap-around porch with ceiling fans, plus a washer and dryer. Being in the first floor villa, we were able to use the expansive grassy area as our "own" front yard. And to add my opinion to a couple previously addressed issues: 1. Gilligan's Island - It was a nice boat ride and the snorkeling was fun. I would say it's good for first time or infrequent snorkelers, but if you've done nice reef snorkeling then you might find this disappointing. If you do go, be sure to snorkel all the way to where the "river" almost reaches the ocean, as that is where we saw most of the fish hiding among the mangrove roots. And that way you can swim back on the other fork of the "river." 2. Grassy Water - The water directly in front of the resort did have a lot of sea grass in it, but I didn't find that a problem. (It's just grass, right?) If you think you might be uncomfortable stepping in it, a pair of water shoes would be a good idea. The only small problems we had are listed below. They're quite minor, and would not stop us from returning. 1. Ice machine in freezer not working, and no ice trays. We went to the ice machine in another building for ice. 2. Bottom shelf on fridge door was missing, which limited storage space. 3. Oven broiler tray missing, so we couldn't use the broiler. 4. Not enough of some kitchen items (knives, small bowls, coffee cups). A wonderful trip, and we're all ready to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A high price for fun”
Reviews.Author: aswarren
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay at Copamarina to take advantage of their scuba diving. We had never dove the reefs in Puerto Rico, and their website claims that they are a "world-class dive resort" which was completely false. The first night there we went to the Dive Shop to book a dive for the following morning. The girl wrote us on the schedule with no problem, but then twenty minutes later called our room to inform us there wasn't going to be diving the next day because it was the divemaster's day off. At normal world-class dive resorts such as those in the Caymans and Sydney, there isn't a day with no diving available. That was only the beginning. We went to the shop again to sign up for the following day when the instructor was to return, and the same girl took our names. The following morning we woke up at 7am for a 730 dive trip, only to find out when we got to the dock that the diving was canceled again. "The weather was too bad." It wasn't raining. There were no waves. More or less, the divemaster appeared very hungover and not in a the mood to go out. We were furious because already two of the four days we planned to dive had been wasted. Four days at Copamarina for the two of us alone cost $2700, and only $1040 went toward the actual fees for the room. The first meal we had at their on-resort restaurant, "Las Palmas," cost over $50. We had ordered a cheeseburger, a chicken quesadilla, and four beers between us. When the bill arrived, the beers were $6.43 each! We consulted the waiter, in shock that the local Puerto Rican beer, Medalla, would cost that much. He said it didn't matter if we had ordered that or Heineken, that all the beers were $6 flat rate. Medalla at the PR liquor stores were $1 per bottle, so Copamarina definitely got their money off of us. We did not do an all inclusive package because we planned to go away from the resort a few times for meals and entertainment, unaware that Guanica is in such a remote location that we would have had to take at least a forty minute taxi ride to reach a city. After spending so much money already, we wanted to spare the cost of a taxi, so we decided to do the best we could to eat light and not order any alcohol, which completely ruined the stay. It's very sad that a beer has to break your wallet so much that you're unable to enjoy yourself on vacation. We are always willing to spend money on whatever we want, and we understand that vacations are expensive, but at the same time, we're too smart to get ripped off that much just to enjoy a few brews. Also make note that if you are looking for any sort of nightlife, this is NOT the place for you! This resort has two pools, many water activities, like scuba (sometimes), snorkling, sailing, and jet-skis, two hot tubs, a fitness center, and two restaurants, both of which are pricey after you add in the drinks (one can of coke = $3, a bottle of water $3) with no refills, as well as a little store with snacks and sunscreen available. Positives about the resort: The landscaping was beautiful! We could not have asked for a more perfect scenery from our balcony (oceanfront room). There were all varieties of palm trees, orchids, and flowers all around the resort, as well as the greenest grass in all of Guanica. The rooms were very clean and cozy, too. If we had not been there to dive and had we bought the all-inclusive package, we probably would have been more satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: swimmom2mg
Reviews.Content: We're at Copamarina now, and I must admit we're a bit disappointed. For the price, the service is less than what I would expect. In fact, the service (front desk, waiters in the restaurant) is quite impersonal. We arrived late last night, and even though our room is quite a ways from the restaurant, we could still hear the live music blaring in our room past 11. We had gone there for a drink right after arriving and the music was so loud, you could not even have a conversation. When I asked politely when the music would stop for the night, I was told 11pm (even though it was past 11 at the time) and there was nothing they could do. (How about asking them to turn down the volume a tad??!) Our kids are 14 and 12, and while they are finding ways to entertain themselves, there aren't a lot of other kids here their ages. Most of the kids are quite a bit younger. So far, the food (have just had one meal - the breakfast buffet - is just ok. Cost of the buffet was $16/each and they charge our 14 year old as an adult. Again, not worth it for the quality. We're going to eat in and around Guanica the rest of the trip, as much as possible. And while none of us are saying it, we are wishing we were back in Playa del Carmen at Shangri-La Caribe (where we went two years ago...they SO spoiled us!). I hope things turn around for the better, but right now I would not recommend Copamarina to my friends, especially for the price. It is a beautiful place though, just don't expect top notch service or a great beach (we knew about the beach before arriving). I am so hoping things get better. If they do, I will definitely post an update. P.S. Also, if you have any issues with pillows, be sure to bring your own. The ones here are very flat and foam...seem kind of old.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax and Escape Life's Hub bub”
Reviews.Author: LotsaTraveling
Reviews.Content: We wanted to spend a week away and get some sun and relaxation without a lot of cost or multiple plane changes. Coming from NY, Puerto Rico seemed like a good option. So we checked out the Trip Advisor reviews, looked at the hotel prices and decided on the Copamarina Beach Resort. We were not disappointed. We flew from Newark into Aguadilla arriving after midnight and the drive to the resort was straightforward -- though you absolutely need a rental car. From the town of Guanica to the resort, you do have to drive along a narrow, windy road, so drive slowly and carefully especially at night. The resort was quiet, with excellent facilities. The pools and hot tubs were perfect for relaxation. And it was an easy drive to towns such as Ponce. We also spent a day going to El Yunque -- a fascinating spot but not an easy drive at all from Guanica -- I'd suggest saving it for a different trip (e.g., from San Juan or the Eastern shores of Puerto Rico). The hotel's restaurant is excellent, but we wanted to try other places as well. We enjoyed RincÃ³n Argentina in Ponce and Pito's Seafood, on Route 2, East of Ponce -- the service and food was excellent at both. The Blue Marlin in Guanica was fun and provided local color. There are plenty of fast food places around as well if you prefer that. The hotel staff were friendly and polite. The grounds were immaculately kept. They have a computer set up in a lounge for checking email. When it was down on one of the days, they let us use their office computer to print out our boarding passes. Some of the other reviews have commented on the beach. My step-daughter complained about sand flies at the beach but was quite content to sun herself by the pool. I went to Gilligan's Island and enjoyed the water, but didn't find it as impressive as the reviews would suggest. And the snorkeling was also unimpressive (lots of fish, but most were fairly drab). Apparently, they had to dock the boat in a different location because of hurricane damage so this may have accounted for the discrepancy in the reviews. The dry forest was interesting. The hotel distributes an excellent, illustrated brochure for those interested in hiking through it and seeing the botanical and animal life. The rooms were clean, comfortable and in typical Caribbean style. One night there was a family with multiple loud children in the adjoining room but they left the following day. We couldn't tell if the walls were thin or the sound was traveling through the door that connected our room to theirs. Or whether they were just extremely loud children. (But we think it was the latter.) I suspect they were less elegant than the rooms in the hotels on the East Coast; they were definitely less elegant that the rooms in the beach hotels where I've stayed in San Juan such as the Caribe Hilton. But our week's stay cost us about 1/3 of the price that we would have spent at any of those places for 3 travelers/2 rooms. Overall, the Copamarina was just what we wanted: a quiet, friendly, laid-back, relaxing spot to catch some rays and get a flavor for the area. We'd be quite happy to return at any time!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, terrible food”
Reviews.Author: seatofthepants
Reviews.Content: The Copamarina grounds are beautiful, but the food at the cafe, which is the only restaurant within miles that serves breakfast or lunch, was horrific and expensive--especially considering the poor quality. Our main complaints were lack of freshness and low quality, which we found unforgiveable from such a luxurious ($$$) property . While our family of 4 (mom, dad, 22 year old and 12 year old) hails from the S.F. Bay Area and has high standards when it comes to food, we travel frequently and try to eat simple local food because it's the freshest and usually the most tasty. Unfortunately, nothing seemed fresh at the cafe. The warm fruit salad looked like it had been stewing in its own juice for quite a while and the shrimp in the casa dia had a decidedly over-the-hill odor. Even just a basic turkey sandwich was made with gelatinous pressed meat and served on squishy bread--hardly what one would expect at a high-end resort where most guests are at least somewhat health conscious. As much as we loved the property, we left after just two nights although we were scheduled to stay for five. Our stomachs was rumbling and our 12 year old was bouncing off the walls since she was pigging out on the only food she could stand: chips and ice cream from the snack shop. NOTE: We must add that the food at the Alexandra Restaurant, which only serves dinner, is very good. This establishment is formal and not appropriate for small children. It is also quite pricey. Plan on spending at least $200 for a family of 4. One last thing: there is grass growing in this bay and it is very shallow so unless you just want to get your feet wet in the ocean, plan on swimming in the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: John_Ice
Reviews.Content: Honestly I loved my stay in the Copamarina beach resort & spa ... it was beautiful and lovely! ... We loved everything in the resort. Especially the pools, the beach, the food, the rooms, the service. We we're a little sad because we really wanted to go to Guilligans Island, but they said it was under repair and waiting to get the island to it's natural habitat ( that was fine with me ) ... but we did go to "Whale Beach" ( do not remeber the exact name in spanish ) and was really good, not that deep but good .... The staff was more than helpfull especially Lisbeth and Miguel ( from the dive center and water equipment store ) .. they we're reallty great, always laughing .. making us feel like we we're part of the family and made us feel very comfortable, ( My wife loved Miguel, like Lisbeth said "He's a fashion guru" ). They we're always they're if we needed help or assistance. Staff like them made our entire stay very joyfull and fun for the whole family. ( all the staff was great ) .. Also Ruben 'bellman' he was very helpful. We can't wait to go back next year, and to see everybody again !!!!!!!!!!!!! Bradsonwil Family

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in PR”
Reviews.Author: scmommy8
Reviews.Content: Of all the resorts we booked for our stay in Puerto Rico this was our favorite. We booked it to be semi-close to the bioluminescent bay in La Parguera (about 20 min) and were very impressed with the resort. Even though it is a little off the beaten path, I think that is part of what gives it its charm. We had a great room with a private terrace overlooking the water. The beach area was great with plenty of chairs, straw huts, etc. and a waiter circulating regularly for drinks, food, etc. We ate lunch at the outside bar/restaurant and found the food great and reasonably priced. We ate dinner at Alexandra's (the resort restaurant) after reading good reveiws about it. It was definitely good food, but of course higher prices than their outside restaurant/bar b/c it was finer dining - well worth it though! They also have a shop where they set up snorkeling/dive trips. We took a snorkeling trip from the hotel and had a great time! I would definitely recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation at its best”
Reviews.Author: mweez
Reviews.Content: When we viewed the pictures of the CopaMarina on their website it looked very relaxing. The pictures did not disappoint. The property is very well maintained and beautiful. My wife and I stayed at the resort for five nights and four days and enjoyed every minute of it. We did not find one cross or rude employee all of the resort staff was nice and eager to help (especially Raoul at the bar and Kris at the front desk). Raoul, my friend, always had a smile and would go out of his way to help you, also Kris at the front desk was helpful with all of our questions and offered many suggestions. Also the housekeepers did a fantastic job our room was spotless the whole stay. This is not a resort for travelers looking for nightlife and shopping. It is isolated and very relaxing, just what we wanted. The only negative is the isolation (as mentioned before in other reviews), it takes two hours from San Juan and at least 45 mins to get anywhere else. To sum it up, it was worth the 2 hr drive from San Juan. The food is great and the resort is wonderful. If you want a nice resort to relax to the waves, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: IanRB
Reviews.Content: A group of family and friends (11 people in all, with kids ranging in age from three to 13) stayed at the Copamarina in early March 2008. The Summary: The resort is exactly as advertised: a very quiet retreat ideal for family vacations. The staff are superb, the grounds and pools lovely, and the food at Alexandriaâ€™s very good. The beach is pretty but not great for swimming, but the short ferry trip to a nearby sand cay is wonderful. Getting off resort can be challenging â€“ journey times are long â€“ but otherwise this is a great place for a secluded getaway. The Details: If youâ€™re looking for a very quiet, unhurried escape this is the resort. We stayed for nine days on an all-inclusive package with ocean view rooms. The occupancy rate seemed less than 30 percent â€“ most days we had the pools to ourselves, and we could always eat on the beautiful outside terrace of Alexandriaâ€™s Restaurant at the time we liked. The staff here are excellent. We used the baby-sitting services for our 3 year-old, who loved being pampered and was soon on first name terms with the registration desk. The rooms are fine â€“ certainly not a four-star experience, but bright, clean and with great views. The pools are small but great for the kids â€“ we spent little time on the beach (see later comments), but spent a lot of time near the main pool. The entire time we stayed at the hotel the beach was officially â€œclosedâ€� due to pollution. It wasnâ€™t clear why, and immediately offshore the water was fine. We snorkeled about a Â¼ mile offshore at a small reef, where the water was crystal clear and the fish plentiful. Gilliganâ€™s Island is still closed (the dock was destroyed in a recent hurricane), but the small sand cay we visited on the local ferry was gorgeous and great fun. The beach here is pristine, and we could float down the beach in the current into a shallow pool. Good beachcombing, too. Alexandriaâ€™s is a good restaurant that catered well to adults and kids. The menu was long, the seafood especially good, but after nine days I was ready for something new. As others had mentioned, the prices are high so the all-inclusive option seemed like a good deal. Going Places: The Copamarina is on the far southern coast of the island, and situated down a long and windy cliff road that gives a lovely sense of isolation but makes for tough travels. Our GPS system (TomTom) failed miserably to get us places, and all but the main highways seemed crowded with cars, trucks, chickens, lizards and the laziest dogs in the world. Ponce is about an hour away, and even nearby La Parguera is over 45 minutes. A few comments (see other entries too): - Paradise Scuba/La Parguera. The town of La Parguera feels like a one horse town, but Luis at Paradise Scuba is worth the trip. We did the afternoon snorkeling and bioluminescent bay trip at $50 a head, and had a great time. If youâ€™re experienced swimmers and snorkelers let them know and try and avoid the first â€œshallowâ€� snorkel location, because the deeper reefs are excellent. We had low expectations for the bioluminescent bay based on comments online, but it was amazing (we had a moonless night, which helped). - Ponce. The old town was prettier than Iâ€™d thought and worth an hour. We actually made the trip to see the Ponce Art Museum (Museo de Arte de Ponce) and got there just in time: curators were literally taking paintings off the walls. The museum will be closed very soon, so donâ€™t make the trip to see the fantastic Pre-Raphaelites, etc. (We got lucky, and an art restorer gave us a personal tour and showed us the paintings being removed from frames and cleaned). - Rio Camuy Caves. DO NOT GO! The caves are closed due to an accident. - Arecibo. Assume a three hour trip each way. May not be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: TravelHungry
Reviews.Content: Copamarina Resort is an amazingly beautiful, well-run resort in Southern Puerto Rico. It's in a protected sub-tropical desert. the rooms are lovely, the food is excellent. There are lots of activities on-site (scuba, kayaking, volleyball, badminton...), and the folks there are incredibly nice and helpful in facilitating anything you'd like to do in Puerto Rico. Everything was perfect. The Sat. night guitarist in the outside restaurant was a memorable night.

Reviews.Title: “Scuba Divers Read This About Copamarina In Guanica”
Reviews.Author: zendar
Reviews.Content: Normally I don't make a habit of writing negative reviews. I simply felt obligated to put something on the internet to discourage other more experienced divers from making the same mistake that I unfortunately did. I do wreck diving in the deep and cold waters of New England year round and have gone diving all over the world. After reading about the amazing wall diving in Puerto Rico I decided to go there with my family on vacation. After 3 or 4 phone calls I booked a week long series of dives at Copamarina. I even called there the day before our trip to check if things were still OK. On the morning of our arrival I called the dive shop to see if the boat was going out that afternoon as planned. I was then told that the dive boat was "broken" and that there would be no diving all week. Suffice to say, I was devastated. I asked if they could help me to find another boat. They were extremely unhelpful and hung up the phone on me even though I was not being rude or impolite about the situation ( I would prefer to think that we were disconnected by accident, but I am not sure that was true). I explained that I had spent a lot of money to come to Copamarina and that I had made all my vacation plans on the assumption that they were a world class diving resort with regularly scheduled boat trips. I was then told that the real reason the boat was "broken" was that they didn't have a minimum of 3 people to go, and that this was true for the entire week.. Base on other people's similar accounts on this web site, it seems like the boat is "broken" with astonishing regularity. Is there some reason why they couldn't be honest and tell me this ahead of time so I could have made plans to go elsewhere in Puerto Rico?? Instead I found myself trapped in a less than optimal situation. I called the manager 3 times and spoke to people who said that he/she would call me right back, but no one ever did. Funny how the management seem so fastidious about replying to negative feedback on the internet, but they don't want to deal with customers who are genuinely upset. Ultimately I went to Parguera 20 miles away and dove with Paradise Dive Shop and West Divers both of whom were excellent. The wall diving was extremely impressive and worth the trip. Just for the record, Parguera divers is no longer operating even though they are still listed on the internet as a dive charter in the same area. The real problem is that the management of the Copamarina should stop falsely advertising that they are a world class dive resort comparable to other such resorts. Its simply not true. It is sad that no one in the hotel administration seems to have any sense of vision. They are sitting on one of the best places to dive in the Carribean, but they do not seem to support the dive shop adequately enough to truly make it a world class diving destination like the Caymans or Aruba. They easily could attract many more divers if they simply got their act together As far as the Copamarina resort itself , I have no complaints. The grounds were beautiful, the service was excellent and the food was well prepared. The local economy would greatly benefit if they really tried to develop their natural diving resources. This would also have a trickle down effect on the amount of business in the other dive shops in the area. Maybe they should talk to each other and get better organized. It would be a win/ win situation for all. SO BEWARE. UNTIL THEY GET THEIR ACT TOGETHER I WOULD GO ELSEWHERE TO DIVE OR BE PREPARED FOR A GREAT DISAPPOINTMENT.

Reviews.Title: “too quiet for our taste”
Reviews.Author: zeul
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, the room was nice, etc. Our only problem with the resort itself was that the beach was actually really gross & overgrown with seaweed. But, you can just walk down a few hundred yards to the public beach and it's fine. The only other problem was that the staff at the casual dining restaurant was slow. The main issue for us was really the location. There is NOTHING else close by except for one restaurant with average food, and it closes at 6pm except on the weekends, and it isn't exactly cheap either. The best thing about the location is that you can take a $6 boat ride out to Guilligan's Island or Gallega and go snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “A True Paradise”
Reviews.Author: VancouverIslanders41
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many resorts and can honestly say that this was the most enjoyable. Waking to the sound of Palm trees swishing in the breeze, this resort was perfect. The food was priced reasonably but the quality could use some improvement. A trip to the Blue Marlin in Guanica is well worth it (cheap too). If you want a totally relaxing experience, Copamarina Beach Resort is for you. We actually left to go to San Juan, turned around the next day and came back. It could be a little boring for older children as there are not too many activities other than swimming, snorkeling, scuba diving and relaxing. We WILL return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: coach_vegas
Reviews.Content: I researched all of Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands and we were looking for an all-inclusive on the beach. Well, we found Copamarina and could not have been happier. My wife and I were there 6 days and 5 nights on our Honeymoon. We are looking forward to another trip to Copamarina soon! Upon arrival to the Puerto Rico airport we had not arranged transportation to the Hotel (90 miles or so, about a 2 hour drive). We called the Copamarina and assisted with setting up a car service to pick us up. We were gonna have to wait a couple of hours so we decided to go to Old San juan and have them pick us up there. Great idea, We were taken by cab to the El Convento Hotel, a sister property of Copamarina and left our bags there. We spent that day walking Old San Juan, had a great lunch, had Ben and Jerry Ice Cream. Great Day. The car service picked us up on time as scheduled around 7pm. We arrived to Copamarina at night so we did not have scenic drive but it was very comfortable in the Lincoln Towne Car. Upon arrival to the REsort the front desk was very polite , helpful. We awere able to still have a late dinner at Alexandra's Restaurant. The meal was fantastic. I had Lobsters and Filet Migon. Cooked perfect. The next day when opening the door to look out side it was beautiful. The pool and hot tub was kept very clean each day. The grounds were mowed and picked up everyday. The girls that took care of the beach area were very nice and helpful. We met lot's of familes, couples from the US, Puerto Rico as well as people from Germany and Canada. The Food and drink being All-Inclusive made the trip care free. Every single meal was fantastic. We tried various meals and appetizers for lunch but I had the Filet Migon and Lobster 4 out of the 5 nights there. The deserts were fexcellent. We had drink service on the beach. Great Mudslides! The Room-We had seen the pictures on here and were skeptical but we were not expecting the Ritz Carlton. Everything worked as it should. Room was very clean.Maids did a great job daily. Bed was big and very very comfortable. Tv worked great. Ac was great. The Bathroom and showere area was small but clean and water pressure was perfect. It exceeding our expectations. The Beach-The Beach was nice and clean-had sevaral activites you could join in, volleyball and some water activities. The worse thin about Copamarina is the water. It is in an area that has lots of moss and is not very clear. You can walk down to the Public Beach and it is very deep and clean. The chairs and the beach "beds" were nice as well as the straw shade hut in the water. Like I said the property was very well taken care of and the staff from front desk, maids, wait staff, beach attendants, bartenders and management were wonderful. They were always pleasant and were readily available if you needed anything. We were expecting a three star resort, And in all honesty that is what it is. We stayed in a Two Star Hotel in Hawai.i once and compared to that Two Star Hotel, Copamarina is a FOUR. It's clean. It's maintained nicely. the grounds are very well manicured. The pool area and beach area is more than adequate. We did not have transportation so we did not venture off too much. We did the Bioluminiscent Bay thing and it was "ok". Our driver took us on a little toor of Gaunica which was neat. Did not go to Gilligans Island. Some people that went said it was nice, others said it was so so. On our trip back to San Juan we had our driver pick us up early and we spent the last afternoon in the Isla Verda area and visited several hotels and the beach area there. The beach and water was very nice but very very windy. This area had way too much going on, it was somewhat hectic like being in a big city. We preferred the peace and quiet of Copamarina. If I could make two suggestions to Copamarina they would be: #1 Work on the water around the pier and beach area and make it somehow more inviting and attractive. #2 Keep the Bar open later and have more late night entertainemnt. The music and singer in the bar area was nice but maybe have an additonal area that had a stage performances. The Food, drinks and the Resort staff makes Copamarina a Four ranking to us. We will go back for sure! It was a very relaxing and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Your Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rodrir0
Reviews.Content: Guanica is a quiet city aside from las pargueras (an area with restaurants and vendors and local boat trips...bioluminescent bay is overrated but a very cheap boat trip ). The drive to the resort offers amazing views of the coast. As for the hotel, not much going on. The hotel is clean and very quiet. Property is small and pretty and good for relaxation. The prices for food and drinks are a bit unreasonable...maybe all inclusive is a better way to go. The beach isn't so great...water is dirty..seems like there is still some oil residue below the sand in the water. They do offer a boat trip to ballena beach which was pretty nice..very clear blue water. Gilligans island was closed unfortunately. Very pretty sunset from the hotel beach. I'm in my 30's and have no children. I prefer a hotel and location with more options. This might be a good resort for those with children looking for some relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Copamarina just okay”
Reviews.Author: janbsn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in an ocean view room for $285/nt. The room wasn't anything special, and the lighting is terrible, but it was clean. I agree with a previous review where they stated this is a 3-star trying to be a 5-star. I would definitely not take their all-inclusive (we didn't) as the food is not that good and there are places you can drive to, if you like to search out local restaurants. Most everyone in the area speaks some English - and with our very limited Spanish we never had a problem in this part of PR. We found a breakfast place (panderia) down the hill from here (on the main st in Guanica village area - which is behind McDonald's off Rte 116) and had either fried eggs or an omelet with coffee and toast for about $7 for the two of us, compared to the Copamarina's breakfast buffet for about $40 and their $42 lunch for a sandwich/soft drink each. If you're squeamish about driving windy, hilly roads, don't go to the Copamarina - it's a very steep, narrow, curvy road for about 3 miles. The beach is full of sea grass - you can wade out to about mid-calf, and then you're in that slimy grass. We did go off the end of the boat pier where there is a ladder into the water, but it's only sandy just at the bottom of the ladder - the sea grass and muck is out there too. We weren't able to go over to Gilligan's Island because of previous storm damage, but they did take us out to another beach around a point via boat for $6 each. The people who went on the diving boat had to be towed back 6-7 mi, so I get the feeling that everything is not taken care of as it should be. I would look for another place before returning to the Copamarina.

Reviews.Title: “A green resort”
Reviews.Author: doramia
Reviews.Content: It should be noted that this property is working hard to become a full-fledged eco-friendly resort. I noticed the compact fluorescent light bulbs in the rooms and the signs asking to conserve water by holding on to the same towels and sheets for more than one day. I asked around and, sure enough, they also have an extensive recycling program for their waste. This type of commitment matters to many travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort, could do with better service”
Reviews.Author: AksNYC
Reviews.Content: We were at this resort Jan 11 - 14. It was our anniversary break. This is a long review, so I'll try breaking it up into sections. Check-in: This was most disappointing and frustrating. NY -> San Juan takes about 4 hrs. From there, we drove 2.5 hours to get to the resort. We had made our booking through Travelocity, when we arrived, the resort didn't have a record of our booking. Ok, so that's probably Travelocity's fault. From this point on, things went downhill rapidly. They first asked me for my reservation number. I didn't have a printout and it took me some time to look it up on my pda+laptop. In the meantime they were on the phone with some travelocity agent. The receptionist said something like - "this is why you should bring a paper record of your reservation". Whatever. After 10 mins I found my travelocity email and gave her the numbers. I also forwarded the email to them since travelocity hadn't sent them anything yet. So now I have a record, and now she says "thats a record you're giving us, not something we got from travelocity. this is why you should always book directly with us". That is unacceptable. And that, to me, is the difference between a well known brand/chain and a one-off hotel. I'd bet any amount that a Hilton or Marriott would've given us a room immediately. Incidentally, travelocity had a lower rate than their website, which is why I booked there. At this point, she should have assigned us a room. What's the worst that could happen ? We would have bluffed and they'd have one more room to clean ? We were offered welcome drinks instead. We'd woken up at 5am and we were standing in that lobby at 6pm and all we wanted to do was get refreshed and take a break. It took 1.5 hours for the whole matter to be sorted out, we'd missed the sunset, and were extremely upset on the eve of our anniversary. The room: Average The room wasn't carpeted. You could argue that since its a beach resort etc, they avoid carpeting. But our beach resorts in Hawaii last month had carpeted rooms. There weren't bathroom slippers either. Not a big deal, but it just gets uncomfortable when you're back from the beach, wash up, and have to walk around bare feet since your beach slippers are dirty/wet. Bed was ok, our room was on the first floor, so the veranda opened into their gardens. The facilities : Excellent We weren't looking for a lot of activity on this weekend away. We were just looking to chill in the pools, jacuzzis, beaches etc. This was perfect. They have two jacuzzis/spas and 2/3 pools. This time of the year, they were empty most of the time. Hardly any children too. It was just the perfect secluded place we wanted. The pools and jacuzzi were open 24 hours and we loved it. You could replace towels till late in the evening which was nice. The restaurants were ok, the staff were friendly. Houskeeping was very neat. One more complaint : The phone stopped working the next morning. We informed the reception desk twice but it wasn't fixed during our stay. The beach : This beach was a bit disappointing. It does indeed have plenty of grass in the water. Even if you walk further west to the public beach area there's grass. The water is calm but doesn't appear as clear as it ought to because of this. However, you can take the ferry (6.5 roundtrip) to Gilligan island, a small isolated island about a mile off the resort. That has a very nice beach and i'd definitely recommend it. Eating out : This resort isn't in a touristy area at all. So your eating options are very limited. You could go to Ponce where you may find some small restaurants, but its a 40-min drive. There are other small towns in the vicinity, learning a bit of Spanish is certainly advisable. Other beaches : I'd definitely recommend Santa Playa and Boqueron. Lovely beaches for sunset, calm waters, active towns. We did jetskiing at Santa Playa, quite cheap at $48 for 2 people for 30 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: RBandJB
Reviews.Content: Copamarina Beach Resort December 25, 2007-January 1, 2008 Trip Advisor member from NE Colorado This is a very quiet place for families and those wanting a relaxing vacation. The food was very good and the staff very professional and helpful. Rooms were clean and maid service was excellent. We did rent a car, so we left the resort and went to some nearby beaches and sites. These were spots the people from Puerto Rico enjoyed and all were clean and quiet. Everything was closed down around sundown in the fenced parks. We enjoyed the local eateries and the local towns. The people in the towns were friendly and helpful. We attended a softball game and looked forward to seeing the young boys of the towns ride their horses in the evenings. Our trips to the nearby lighthouses, salt flats, and surfing areas were interesting also. Our journeys into the mountains were on winding and narrow roads, but a good picture of the lifestyle of the citizens of the island. I would recommend this resort to anyone. It was a good vacation and even though we do not speak Spanish, we could understand the road signs and take care of the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Richard2Phila
Reviews.Content: Recent stay with two teenage boys at CopaMarina was a pleasure. Beautiful view from all hotel rooms. Gilligans Island for snorkeling was closed due to dock being out from recent storm--so went to alternate site--just 10 minute boat ride. Previous Trip Advisor reviews discussed the fact that CopaMarina's on site dive shop was not well run--but our experience was very good -- the divemaster appeared to be in his late 30's and he has been there for two years. Alternate dive shops are located in Paraquera-about 30 minutes away. They include Paradise Scuba [--], Parquera Divers and Boqueron Dive shop. In order to avoid any "cabin fever" we did use our car to drive to Parquera for excellent meal at La Casita--highly recommend it. Very popular with those that know the area. Also drove 30 minutes back towards Ponce to eat on the ocean at Pitos reataurant--right on Rt 712. Very scenic setting but some noise from highway.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: BORIRN
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful getaway at Copamarina. It was an opportunity to recharge our batteries and we took full advantage of the peace and quiet! It was lovely to be in a part of the Island that has not been highly commercialized. The staff was wonderful, the food excellent, and the scenery breathtaking. We plan to return next year and take our grand daughter.

Reviews.Title: “The highlight of our Puerto Rico vacation”
Reviews.Author: AZkim
Reviews.Content: I typically only write reviews when something happens on a vacation that left me feeling extremely dissatisfied. This time, I am writing a review for the exact OPPOSITE reason. I have never had a MORE satisfying experience. First of all, I would like to thank the staff of the Copamarina Resort for making sure my family and I had an incredble stay. Immediately, upon check in, I could tell this resort was there to please it's customers. We arrived a few hours before check in and I was feeling car sick. I was feeling quite cranky and unhappy......for about 30 seconds after arriving at the Copamarina. The staff could tell I was not feeling well and allowed us to check in early. They even allowed us to "preview" our suite and pick out which one suited us. We chose to upgrade to a very nice two room suite so my husband and I could enjoy some privacy. After being there a day, we realized that it would have been a better financial move for us if we would have purchased the "all inclusive" package. After having a casual conversation with one of the staff members about types of drinks she suggested, I jokingly mentioned to her about drinking away my kids' college fund. She suggested that we go all inclusive and promptly returned with the manager. He reviewed our charges and said that it would be to our benefit if we converted......even allowed it to be retroactive....which saved us a substantial amount of money. It cost our family of four 150.00 per day for the all inclusive plan. That's typically what we would spend on just dinner and drinks. I was so impressed that they allowed us to do that!! That they would consider our wallet before their own. The grounds were beautiful. The pools were very clean with a spectacular carribean view. The food was great.....and the drinks were even better!! I tried everything they suggested....the bartenders were superb! We stayed at 3 resorts all over the island. We had a good experience at all the resorts we stayed at, but Copamarina was the best. The reason being because of the incredibly attentive staff seeing to it that we had a GREAT stay. We are planning on returning next year.....this time, all 10 days will be spent at this resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Reclaimed”
Reviews.Author: DreamEagle
Reviews.Content: We were blessed to find this resort after a rather unpleasant stay the night before at the Fusion. It was off season and so the Copamarina was not crowded. The staff was so welcoming and caring. They really took care of all of our needs. The grounds are clean and well maintained. The pools and hot tub were phenomenal. We had fun on the beach, enjoyed Gilligans island and drove to the end of the road to hike out to even more secluded beaches. We spent 5 nights and 6 days relaxing and enjoying our vacation. My husband worked out in their club every morning (we're in our 50's) and the food at the restaurant was fantastic. They even had a special vegetarian menu for someone like me!!! I was ecstatic. We had only intended on staying 2 nights, but then we realized it had everything we wanted and needed, so why look elsewhere. Thank you, Copamarina for making our vacation the best.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at the Copamarina”
Reviews.Author: Robert90
Reviews.Content: My wife, teenage son & I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Copamarina and were very please with our experience. The resort is very well maintained and staffed by pleasant and helpful people. We arrived well before check in time due to our flight and were given a room to relax in until our scheduled room was ready. I recommend this location to people who wish a more quiet and peaceful vacation in a great location. There are plenty of things to do such as diving, fishing & boating to a local mangrove island with a small beach. The resort is located next to the dry forest reserve and there are great walking trails along the ocean with hidden beaches and great views. In addition, this part of Puerto Rico receives little rain annually, so you can count on excellent weather. Swimming is not great as the water is shallow at the resort beach, but this is not a problem as there are many opportunities for good swimming and snorkeling nearby. This is not the spot for fans of loud mega resorts and casinos. If you go ask Ruben to take you in the boat to snorkeling spots. He works hard to make sure you have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: edepoix
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our honeymoon in Puerto Rico. We stayed 3 nights at the Copamarina, and 3 nights in Old San Juan. We absolutely LOVED the Copamarina. There were a few downsides, but I think the reason we loved it was because those downsides weren't particularly disturbing to us. Our first impression was the open-air lobby, which is very pretty, with orchids planted in the palm trees. The staff at the front desk was very nice, professional, and helpful. They upgraded our room when they heard we were on our honeymoon. Our room was very nice...large and clean. It wasn't overly luxurious, but definitely nice. The first night, we spent several hours enjoying the open-air bar/cafe (there are two restaurants: the cafe/bar, which is a casual menu, and Alexandra, which is fancier. ) The bartender was awesome (all the bartenders who served us during our stay were super attentive and friendly.) The drinks were great. We ordered some food off the cafe menu, and it was mediocre. We were so happy to be relaxing with drinks with a view of the Caribbean Sea, that we didn't care too much. Breakfast was great - the menu is pretty good: eggs benedict, etc. We took a sea kayak to Gilligan's Island, which is absolutely gorgeous (the highlight of the entire trip). I guess October is right in the middle of the off season, so there was no one there (very few people at the resort in general, which was great). Anyway, we kayaked around a cluster of islands, and swam on another deserted beach called Bellena Beach. Dinner at Alexandra that night was great. It wasn't the best thing I'd ever eaten in my life, but definitely better than the cafe. I liked the food. I thought the filet mignon was good. My husband got the Mofongo, which he liked. The second day we hiked in the Dry Forest, which is slightly overrated, but still interesting and a good little workout. Each night we relaxed in the hot tub, which was nice. We also enjoyed the pool nearest our room, and a few hours on the beach in recliners. As I mentioned in the beginning, there were a few possible downsides: - other posters are right - as far as night time entertainment. It's basically a guy playing guitar at the bar. We loved it. We weren't there to go clubbing, we were there to have some drinks, and enjoy each other's company. - Cafe food isn't great. But we liked the other restaurant. - other posters are right, the beach isn't good. We didn't care, though, because we live near the beach in the States, so we didn't feel disappointed. If you're looking for a really "beachy" time, you shouldn't go there. Their beach is short, and the bottom is mucky and there are lots of underwater plants. Gilligans Island is great though. That's all the bad parts. What we loved: the beautifully maintained grounds, deserted pools and hot tubs, Gilligan's Island, GREAT service without exception, awesome outside bar, nice room. We hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: MaishChicago
Reviews.Content: We took our family for a week for our first time in Puerto Rico. The resort is clean and well-equipped, the rooms comfortable although not luxurious, and the staff genuine and friendly. The pools areas and grounds are especially nice. We really enjoyed Irving's (the activities coordinator) Cave Hike. We recommend it for anyone reasonably fit - wear tennis/hiking shoes and consider taking a bandanna or damp rag as it can get a little messy inside the cave. Look for the GIANT Toad! The bar and live music was far above average - the Pina Coladas the Best! The food in the cafe/bar is alright, though much better in the restaurant Alexanders. Buffet Breakfast was more than generous - buy it with your package if possible. Be prepared to need a little patience on excursions - the public ferry may not be on time, as it fills up and may need to come back for you on another trip. The snorkeling was worth the money - good reef and helpful guides. Overall, it was a good value for your money, especially so in off season(summer months).

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: theasmo
Reviews.Content: Like many others here I first read many of these reviews prior to booking my vacation. The quantity of positive reviews here was actually pretty amazing, I almost wondered if this was too good to be true. Perhaps lots of relatives of employees were posting away! Well, I am happy to report that every positive review here is dead on. This resort is wonderful to stay at and is staffed with individuals of the highest caliber. I was amazed by the common concern that all staff members shared for the comfort of their guests. The maintenance and gardening crew, front desk, waiters and bartenders, cooks, pool and beach crew, store staff, etc... Everyone was so polite and helpful, and when needed were always willing to go above and beyond to ensure your visit was perfect. The resort was very clean and the grounds crew was out every day ensuring it stayed that way. The pool was cleaned every morning, I woke up early enough every day to see them doing so. The rooms were spacious, clean, and most certainly set the mood for relaxation. I booked a 4 night all inclusive. This was well worth the cost for me as I am a bit of a drinker and I love to eat! We were here for the first week of August, just after the local children were back in school. So the resort was very quiet, although it was still fully staffed! This time is considered part of their off season, however it was still a wonderful experience. The food was good at the outside cafe and very good for the inside fine dining. I was so conerned about the bar closing around 11:30pm and thought I would be left wanting a drink after, however I was so busy during the day that I never made it past 10:30pm any given night! This is good as there is no local night life. So if you're looking to have a busy day, a few drinks by the pool, and a good dinner and some relaxing music, then this is a place for you. If you're looking to go clubbing at night, then you need to look elsewhere. My only disappointment with the resort, and this is just personal preference, would be the beach. I enjoy a rough surf and diving into waves. The sea here is like a bathtub, very little movement and pretty warm. Obviously this will appeal to many, but may not for those used to a little action in the water. I am already planning my next trip back, and so I recommend this resort to anyone looking to get away for relaxation. From others I have met there I understand that it is much busier and less quiet during their regular season, so I plan on doing another offseason trip. I want to end by thanking the Copamarina staff for ensuring our vacation was wonderful, they really are great people there!!

Reviews.Title: “We Had a Nice Stay....BUT, Not for Divers!”
Reviews.Author: LightSpeedMatt
Reviews.Content: Over all we enjoyed our stay at the Copamarina. I want to be very objective and fair here; so let me start with: the good: Very clean room....very clean, tiled bathroom; both surpirsed us! Nice balcony (room 210) opening to the sea and the grounds. We had an excellent dinner at Alexandra. Infact we ate a couple of times at Las Palmas Cafe too; with both we experienced prompet service and good food. At Alexandra we enjoyed a nice bottle of wine; Johnathan was our waiter and our glasses were never half full. The only negative will be below and has nothing to do with the food or service. Great job. We'll kept grounds, parking close to room, and a fair value. now....the bad: I'm a diver. The Copamarina does a disservice in billing itself as having a dive shop. There is no dive shop. The "dive shop" is the towel exchange building between the pools. It sells ice cream, candy, and bathing suits. There is simply no diving gear here...but it's worse....as a diver in a new area you want to talk to your dive master, meet him, talk about what dives you'll be doing, i.e; depth, decompression steps...their experience and such....basicly you want to see with whom you will share your risk with. The Copamarina dive shop was staffed by...two teenagers. All they could tell me was....you'll be diving the wall...be here at 7:30sharp. The complete lack of suba gear and inablity of staff to answer the most basic of questions was the real dissapointment of our stay. It would be more honest if they simply said they offered "diving services" not a dive shop/marina. The silver lining: I found Parguera Divers and it's excellent owner/dive master Angel. Angel returned my calls promptly...offered me his cell phone....but mostly....displayed complete competence and confidence....answering all my questions patiently...he ran an orgainzed boat with a good balance of profesionalism and humor and is fully bi-lingual. Great job. [--]; Angel. The only other negative of the stay was a loud group of african american youth...I think college athletes from what I gathered....who were completly indifferent to the existance of anyone else....worse...when we ate at Alexandras....a fine dining resturant...they were served in tank tops and less....while others dined in appropritate attire and such....why not either offer these kids jackets or insist on a dress code...this was poor form. They also held an impromtu rap music party on the beach late at nite. Never mind anyone else...the world is yours..... Otherwise not a bad stay....card room keys died halfway through stay...they told me it was my cell phone.....I did not have both keys by my phone....another guest had same problem....minor..... A nice hotel, nice grounds, great food, not a dive shop, that was misleading....suggest a code of dress in the nice resturant, I know the kids where just kids...would stay again but I know where to dive now.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: MrGelhs204
Reviews.Content: Copamarina was exactly what our family was looking for: a relaxed, well maintained, comfortable, out of the way resort with outstanding service. We booked the package with breakfast buffet included - it was outstanding. We went out for lunch and dinner at various local places in the area and I recommend you do the same. We did not use the resort restaurants for lunch/dinner, but generally heard positive comments. It seemed some of the service issues that folks have mentioned here had been corrected. Rooms are spacious, clean, and well appointed. There is live music every night at the bar, but don't go there expecting any kind of nightlife. This is a place to rest and relax. Don't miss the trip to Gilligan's Island. You are picked up right at Copamarina's dock - very short ride to Gilligans. We swam in the mangrove all the way to the ocean - safe - no point is more than 5 feet deep. Copamarina offers dive tours but we did not take advantage of it. Car is a must if you want to see other great beaches in the area - the one at copamarina is not exactly the best. All of the pools at Copa, the gym, and tennis courts are quality. The staff is attentive and nice in a natural way. Lots of families, excellent service (sometimes a tough find in PR),

Reviews.Title: “TRANQUILITY / CHARMING”
Reviews.Author: corsmitch
Reviews.Content: First off rent a car from the airport (we chose Alamo). It is a 2 hour drive to the resort, and do study your maps before venturing to the resort. The drivers are not bad at all living in DC and Chicago, they are better there than in the mainland. This resort was absolutely amazing and our 18 and 12 year old daughters thought the same. The rooms were very clean and convenient to the restaurants. The staff was so professional and helpful it felt like royalty. The waters were so iridescent blue/green in color and the landscaping was immaculate. The food and mixed drinks under the all inclusive plan were delightful and would rate 4 out of 5 for service and quality. The ocean is at a perfect height to put a lounge chair to sunbathe most of the day. If you would like to snorkel in deeper waters it is about 50 yards to swim out beyond the shallow waters. We have travel to places from Kona, Hawaii (stayed at the Fairmont Orchid) to the Westin in the Bahamas, and I honestly have to say this resort won hands down of all of them in between. It is not too crowded and the locals who vacation here are some very, very nice people. You do need to get the all inclusive which was exquisitely wonderful. You definitely need to go to Gilligan's Island. You take a 15 minute boat ride form the pier over to the island. It consists of an uninhabited island with rivers of mangroves that will lead you out to the main ocean. The snorkeling was pretty good and sights were very beautiful. Overall experience you don't need to go to any other resort in Puerto Rico except here. We could have stayed 7 more days. Hands down to the management and staff of Copamariana Resort, WELL DONE!!! BOOK FOR THIS YEAR OR NEXT YEAR!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Amelia7386
Reviews.Content: I don't have enough words to say how beautiful Copamarina is> We stood there for a week, and my kids didn't even want to leave. They had so much fun at the pools, beach, game rooms, gym, etc. The activities at the resort are excellent. Irving is a great teacher and knows how to plan the activities for all ages. The spa is excellent, thank you Jennifer and Ana for treating me like your family, love to both. Omar, Raul, Juanito and Edgardo thank you for your attentions at the Palmas Cafe. Katherine, Maria and the other girls, magnificent human beings, God bless you all. Eric and Jose (chef) thank you for your delicious meals, extraordinary taste, and Eric wonderful person. If you want to relax with your family and kids, visit Copamarina you won't regret every penny. I also recomend to take the package of all-inclusive it's worth it. To the whole staff of Copamarina our sincerely appreciations and hope to see you again next year. Olivieri-Colon Family Barranquitas, Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “Liked the place ...but Alexandra's service was BAD and beach is no good”
Reviews.Author: Cpuhog
Reviews.Content: I am from PR but have lived in the states for 10+ years. This summer we decided to visit my island and stay in a local resort. CopaMarina looked great ... loved the room and the overall presence of care takers. The pools were clean and in great great shape. The beach is not good for anything but to walk and walk. It is toooooo shallow and coverd with marine plants almost in its entirety. So, the highlights are the pool and the room. There is no room service and the food in the Palma's Cafe is not that great with the exception of the breakfast buffet. However, their service at the Cafe is great...too bad the food is not as described in the menu (e.g. teriyaki wings with little to NO teriyaki sauce, fish fillets that actually fish sticks, the Parcha sauce with little to NO Parcha (passion fruit) flavor) ... Now in our last night we decided to eat dinner at Alexandra's (their "good" restaurant). We understand that service has ups and downs but we were lucky enough to receive the WORST service ever during our dinner. We made reservations for 8pm as requested by their staff. We arrived and were taken to our table then we were told that Jonathan was our waiter ... no no it is Lorenzo ... but Lorenzo did NOT stopped at our table ever during the night. Around 20 minutes passed and the head-waiter noticed our long faces (I know we could have said something but for some time we were engaged in conversation) .. he stopped asking for our order...but we had not even been asked for our drinks ... ok, he took our drinks (no alcohol that night) and our dinner order...... waited ... waited.... people came in .. got to their tables ..ordered ..got their food.... 45minutes later we got ours. I noticed Lorenzo dancing around the tables serving others but never stopped by. Other waiters topped water glasses around ... not in our table ...my son ran out of soda .. nobody asked to get a new one until we stopped one of them ... nobody stopped and checked on our experience ... The food was bland in flavor (little seasoning on the fillet mignon) and in the case of my mofondo-de-camarones (mashed plantains with shrimp inside) the shrimps were not removed entirely from their shell which made eating the mix a stop-n-go affair. We had to stop them and ask for the check ... we left ... NO TIP. I love my island .. but one thing that is true is the spottiness (is that a word?) of the customer service. I hope you have a better experience than I did at CopaMarina. The grounds are beautiful ... the rooms are big and clean ... the pools are very very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Copamarina”
Reviews.Author: acee53
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Copamarina was excellent. The place is very neat, beautiful, well kept and very well managed. Food was above my expectations. Rooms are big, very clean. Employees cater to you every whim, well informed, very courteous. You will not get bored, there is a lot to do, even if you do not want to do a thing, it is peaceful and quiet if you just want to read. Beautiful scenery. The all inclusive is a better deal, and it is worth every penny. I will definitely go back any day if I could. We were a family of five adults and stayed an extra day because we loved it !!!! The non motorized water equipment was excellent and we enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Well above average”
Reviews.Author: JQ_Citizen
Reviews.Content: Private beach which was surprisingly uncrowded considering the number of rooms at this resort. Staff unfailingly courteous with, at a minimum, a working knowledge of English. Rooms clean, modern, comfortable, with a small patio. Guanica is a very dry area but the resort grounds had plenty of greenery and large palm trees. Wireless internet access extended to rooms. 2 pools, 2 hot tubs, Hobie, kayak, and other water rentals available. Breakfast at Las Palmas Cafe is buffet style and excellent, with made-to-order egg ishes and a wide selection of food. Lunch and dinner menu limited and nothing special; all meals at the cafe are reasonably priced. The onsite dinner restaurant was very good with a good wine selection, and a bit expensive. Not a whole lot to do in this section of the country, but PR is a small island so it's easy to drive to Ponce or other towns for some history & culture. If you intend to stay resort-bound, you'll be very happy with the Copamarina. Overall, good value for the money and very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “March 2007 Visit”
Reviews.Author: chester
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Copamarina for 3 days in March 2007. The sole purpose of my hotel stay was to do a few scuba dives. The hotel itself is nice... 2 different pools and two different bars. Very nice grounds - nicely manicured. The room was fine - nothing fancy. Very small tv and I could hear the people in the room next door but other than those two things, room was fine. The beach in front of the resort was very nice - very uncrowded. But don't expect blinding white sand and a nice surf... it's more of a lagoon. But it was relaxing.. and the canopy beds on the beach were very cool (even thought I never laid on one). Anyway, I arrived Friday afternoon and had dinner at the resort bar - food was fine (service a little slow). Saturday morning went diving with the on-site dive shop... decent dives (two morning dives) but the surf was a little rough during the hour boat ride back to the resort from the dive spot.
