During the return boat trip, three people got sick, including my friend that I was diving with. So we didn't go back out for the single afternoon dive (I don't think the boat went back out either). That afternoon at 4:30 PM, I got a message (on my hotel room phone) from the dive shop that all the Sunday dives were cancelled. So I went to the shop to try and make other arrangements (again, this is the only reason I was even there). They seemed indifferent and weren't helpful.. I asked if there were other shops in the area (I had read about one that was about 30 minutes away). They gave me the name and number but by then, the shop was closed. Later (after going back to the dive shop a couple of times), they gave me the phone number of the other captain. I gave him a call at around 7:00 pm and he said they that did they did have room. So I went to the front desk to see if I could get a late (1:00 pm) checkout (since I wouldn't get back to the resort until noon). I was told I would have to wait and ask them in the morning... well, that wouldn't work since I had to confirm with the other shop that night. Not big issues but on a 3-day dive trip, losing an entire day of diving is a pretty big inconvenience. And the resort did not handle it properly (to say the least). I was pretty frustrated with their indifference. If I were to return to this area of PR, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: BigDog67
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a week at the Copamarina. This is the first time I am writing a review on trip advisor, largely because I chose the property based on trip advisor reviews. I hope this is helpful. Also, I travel a lot for business and have stayed at many outstanding resorts, so I think I'm a pretty good judge of things. The Copamarina was a great choice for us -- my wife, 10 year-old son, and 6 year-old daughter. It is a beautiful property with grounds that are immaculately maintained and located in a visually stunning part of Puerto Rico. We have stayed on more "exotic" islands and this area in SW PR rivaled many of those places. We are an active family. My kids are outstanding swimmers and athletes, and we were active the entire time with great activities. Obviously, with young children, their enjoyment largely dictates the quality of the vacation. They never wanted to leave the resort! We did not do the all-inclusive, though next time we will. The area around the hotel, after the beautiful forest ends, is largely poor and there are not many good restaurants. The food at the property restaurants was good, and sometimes very good, but not great. But certainly much better than anything else around. How good? One night, the former Governor of PR sat at the table next to us. I assume that means its OK! Part of what makes this place great are the people that work there. The staff( Wilmer, Irving, JJ, Lisbeth, Rosa, etc.) are amazing and made us and our kids feel totally at home. Meet these people and befreind them -- they added so much to our experience! The activities are something off of the Discovery Channel. The pools are beautiful and inviting. Also, of major importance to us, the beach stays very shallow for like 50 yards out, which is a total stress releiver when traveling with a 6 year old. A lot of how much you like a vacation is about expectations. So to level set yours about the Copamarina -- it is not a super luxury hotel in any sense of the word. It's funny -- I almost don't want to say too much and make this place too popular! But I want to be honest, because trip advisor helped us out. If you're looking for a Four Seasons experience, you will be disappointed. There was a couple there who were bemoaning that it wasn't nearly as nice as Fiji or Hawaii. Duh, it's Puerto Rico! But if you are an easy going family looking for a fun week in a beautiful caribean resort, you'll dig this place.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LauraPh
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and i just returned from our annual spring break trip. We Stayed 7 days at the Copamarina and loved every minute of it. It is wonderfully relaxing and we felt safe the entire time. We rented a car in San Juan and drove to the resort. There were no troubles at all. It was easy to get there and we used the car to go to hiking excursions in the Guanica Rain Forest and to the town of Yuaco. The staff was really good. After the second day we felt like they knew us and remembered what we liked. They actually seemed happy to see us. The attendants on the beach were wonderful - when we went to the pool we would see them brushing the sand off our chairs and adjusting our towels. The bartenders were great... they knew how to make all kinds of drinks and made them really well. Food was fantastic. We tried something different each night and were never disappointed. The breakfast and lunch menus were really good, too. The whole resort was very clean - there were constantly people picking up things and just tending to the grounds. I cannot say enough good things!!!

Reviews.Title: “hidden paradise”
Reviews.Author: know_how_travel
Reviews.Content: Not knowing where we were going we were a bit hesitant, but once we arrived it was just paradise. The beach is perfectly situated in the middle of the resort, with child friendly shallow waters filled with marine life for exploration. The pools are clean and there are four of them. The resort is very well maintained, the cleaning crews are out all the time cleaning and picking up leaves, the pools are cleaned every morning and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. There are many activities offered by the hotel and you can explore on your own if you have a car. The roads are great, and if you arrive in San Juan it is about one and a half hours of driving to the resort, from Ponce it is about 40 minutes. This hotel was just wonderful and we enjoyed it very much. If you are traveling with children, this is a place you want to be. If you want a romantic getaway this hotel will also offer you the right accommodations. The restaurants are great with entertainment and reasonably priced. Rooms have fridges so you can also stack up on snacks. Every room has a balcony or if you are on the ground floor, you also have a lounge area outside to relax with your morning coffee or a night cap. It is definitely a place I will go back to again. Once your arrive there you forget all your stresses of everyday life.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, relaxing vacation!”
Reviews.Author: tumbao2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a quiet, yet somewhat elegant and completely relaxing place to spend 5 days during spring break. The Copamarina was perfect! Our room was simple, but included everything we wanted. The grounds were beautifully maintained. The restaurants gave us the option of casual, yet deliciously prepared meals in an outside atmosphere, or inside, in an elegant, slightly more formal, setting where the menu was varied and all marvelously prepared. Most important, the people who work there were utterly friendly and went out of their way to make sure that we enjoyed ourselves. If you are looking to party all night, this is not for you. If you are looking to gamble in casinos, this is not for you. If you are looking to enjoy a relaxing vacation in a beautiful part of the world, this is for you! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Copamarina”
Reviews.Author: AidanSineadsMom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay in Puerto Rico that included the Copamarina. We found it beautiful and relaxing. I had read the earlier reviews and was not put off by most of the comments about the remoteness or lack of "nightlife". We did not use the all-inclusive plan as we just couldn't contemplate eating that much food or using that many water toys. We had the junior suite, which included a refrigerator and microwage, so we usually ate one meal a day in the hotel restaurant and the others in the suite from groceries purchased in nearby Guanica. Staff is friendly and helpful. We took the boat to Gilligan's island and had fun snorkeling there. The hotel's beach is very shallow and calm, more like a wading experience. However, many of the kids were jumping off the pier, where it was deeper. A better swimming experience can be found at Cana Gorda, the public beach which is literally right next door to the hotel property and was almost deserted every day we were there. The pools are nice, with the pool furthest from the lobby tending to be more quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: akersmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel recently. At about midnight we received a phone call. I answered the phone and a man said that it was the front desk, that there was a problem with my husband's credit card. The man said that my husband needed to go to the front desk right then. (The front desk is about a 15 min. walk from the room we were in). Fortuntately, my husband was suspicious and did not go. He called the front desk and they said they had not called us. Earlier that day when I was showering there were men outside our window talking explicitly about women. I think it was the same men who called that night, expecting that my husband would leave me alone in the room. When we reported this to the hotel management, they just shrugged their shoulders and said there was nothing they could do. They didn't offer to call the police, look for the people or anything. This hotel is in a very remote location and there is no concern for safety whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but remote”
Reviews.Author: YankeeMike
Reviews.Content: I found Copamarina on the internet, and selected it in part due to previous Tripadvisor reviews. We flew into San Juan, and rented a car. It took about 2 hours to get to Guanica (after a couple minor wrong turns) Unfortunately there were no signs for the resort, and we hadn't thought to get detailed directions. I asked a local cop, and we got a flashing lights escort to the resort! Very nice, even though they spoke no English. Check-in was efficient and friendly. All the staff was very friendly throughout the stay. The grounds were beautiful and constantly being groomed. The rooms were large and comfortable, with a partial view of the Caribbean. There was frequently a nasty low-tide/cesspool smell outside the front door, but it never came into the room. The pools were clean and the perfect temperature, rarely crowded. Some days they had organized pool activities that our kids (12 year-old twins) enjoyed thoroughly. The beach was nice, but there was a lot of seaweed in the shallow water, not great for swimming. We did the all-inclusive, which I would recommend for the meals alone, but it also included use of kayaks and Hobie cat. Lots of good sailing inside the barrier reef with steady breezes. There are 2 restaurants, Las Palmas (outside) and Alexandra (inside) The waitstaff was very friendly, but often it seemed as though they didn't really know how to wait tables. The service at Las Palmas was often intolerably slow. Breakfast buffet was very good. The food at Alexandra was usually very good as well. Guanica is a small town in the middle of nowhere, and there is not much to do outside the resort, We went to the Guanica Dry Forest reserve one day; a unique habitat that was interesting, but that is about it. If you are looking for a comfortable, warm place to enjoy the sun and warm weather, this is it. Overall cost was pretty reasonable, at least for the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “A very special place:”
Reviews.Author: Annes'sspringbreak
Reviews.Content: My college daughter and I vacationed at the Copamarina in early March 2007. It was a very last minute decision to go and we were so fortunate that we made some great decisions. Traveling without my husband was a first, we felt extremely safe. The resort is so inviting and the staff was engaging and pleasant. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. We loved the cozy outside bar, guitar player and the informal atmosphere. We weren't looking for a disco at night so this atmospere worked well for us. We did all inclusive-for us was probably a good idea. I am a wine drinker but their wine selection was limited. Thankfully, I really did enjoy the wine, not a disappointment. Food was above average, most nights outstanding! The people that work at the resort are very special. Not in your face, but attentive. They really seemed happy to see you each day. Very nice perk! If I had to communicate a down side it would be the beach itself . The seaweed really wasn't a big deal, but you really couldn't take a walk beside the water, even if you left the resort. We decided to get our exercise in the pool . If you want a tranquil vacation, choose the Copamarina. I hope to return with my husband to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. Thanks Guys, Pam & Anne, Indiana, PA.

Reviews.Title: “So Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: NestorMitrea
Reviews.Content: Our family just got back from a week long stay at the Copamarina. It is a lovely place. The service is incredible, mostly because everyone is just so nice. The staff is friendly but not over friendly. They are always willing to help out - even with requests that are out of the norm. Wilmer who manages the front desk is incredibly sweet and went out of his way to help us when my 8 year old daughter got sick. Raul is an amazing bartender, an artist. My husband will remember his mojitos for a long time. Maria and Robert in the restaurant are great waiters. The rooms are kept clean and they are comfortable. It looked to us like virtually all of them have some view of the ocean. Next time we will choose our room based on location versus ocean view, etc. The walk from the far rooms is more like a hike and with the kids constantly forgetting something in the room, my husband and I felt like ping pong balls. Those rooms are secluded, private and very quiet though. The closer rooms are probably louder but the convenience, for us would be a huge plus. We preferred the rooms on the ground floor as they have access directly to the beach and main grounds but the view from the second floor was better. The food was good and plentiful. We all put on a bit of weight. Alexandra served a paella one night the was out of this world. The only criticism we would offer of the fine restaurant was that it was inconsistent. The food was always good but the same dish didn't taste the same each time. I ordered flan every night and it was different each time. The lobster risotto was to die for two nights in a row. One night it was filled to overflowing with lobster and light on the saffron and the next night it was light on the lobster and had so much saffron that I couldn't' believe it. It was delicious both times just a bit of a surprise. The trip to Gulligan's Island was fun but it wasn't what we expected. The picture in the brochure and dive shop shows a clear white beach... that just wasn't there. We did run into a few other guests wandering around the island looking for "the beach." That piece was disappointing. However, It was a great first snorkeling experience for our kids. There wasn't any great coral but lots of fish and it was very manageable and affordable. You can go over there for just an hour which is nice too. Do take the cave hike. It's unique and Irving is a hoot. We did do the all-inclusive and feel that we got more than our money's worth. The bartenders made slushies for the kids all day and we all ate and drank more than our share. The grounds are beautiful and immaculate. One last thing, It was the most mixed crowd we've ever seen on our travels. There were couples of all ages from the very young to the elderly, there were families with young children and families with older teens, there were Americans, Puerto Ricans, Europeans, even a few college kids on their spring break, just everyone. It seems to be a nice, quiet, fun place with a little something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Copamarina”
Reviews.Author: AshNazg
Reviews.Content: I can't say that those who wrote negative reviews didn't genuinely have an awful time here -- but my wife and I definitely had a wonderful stay at the Copamarina. The staff doesn't deserve any of the comments claiming that they were slow and unfriendly. Quite the opposite, I felt that the entire staff was pleasant and everyone we encountered went above and beyond to make sure we were happy. The maintenance staff was especially responsive to a few problems we had, and management offered to upgrade our room even after the trouble had been taken care of. With only a few days of our stay left, we didn't take them up on it -- we were very happy with our original room (Superior Garden View) which was quite large and comfortable. We did not choose the all-inclusive package, which turned out to be the right choice for us. We didn't feel that the food and drinks were sub-par or overpriced, as other reviewers had claimed. We had a great time by the pools, which we almost had to ourselves at times, and also had a lot of fun snorkeling and swimming at 'Gilligan's Island'. It's nicer than the CaÃ±a Gorda public beach next to the Copamarina, which we thought was pretty trashy and uninviting. That's hardly the Copamarina's fault, and their own grounds are lovely and well-maintained. The road to the Copamarina isn't 'treacherous' but it is narrow. The edge lines are painted and there is enough room for two vehicles to pass each other, but take your time. In the end, our only real disappointment was that weather changed our plans and cut our stay short by a day. We'd like to close by thanking all the fantastic people who work at the Copamarina for making our visit one of the most relaxing vacations we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “A romantic getaway? I don't think so.”
Reviews.Author: Ktjengs
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this place is recommended as a great honeymoon or a romantic getaway for couples. Children took over the place from about 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. I don't know how anyone can call listening to 12 hours of Marco Polo being played relaxing. Children aside - the resort was beautiful, service was great, and I found the food at Alexandra to be superb. If I had kids, I might go back one day since I know I could just let them run amok and scream their heads off while I soak up some sun by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite family vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: SAKANAYA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Copamarina for 5 nights after staying 1 night in San Juan (2/20-2/26). We will skip San Juan next time and go to Copamarina straight from the airport as it takes only 2-hour drive. We brought 7 years old and 3 years old, both loved the pool, kiddie pool and play ground. We did not choose All Inclusive package and that was the right choice for us as we saved $1000 over food and activities that we did not do. My husband did scuba diving twice (2 x $90), and I did Bodyderm spa massage ($80), and still saved that much money. We were disappointed that Alexandra restaurant was horrible. I ordered Oriental shrimp and the sauce was totally disgusting - believe me, any Chinese restaurant in your home town can do better. My husband ordered some Italian-like dish with pasta, and we agreed that nothing was fancy. Alexandra was supposed to be fancy with lots of $$$, but food is not worth the money at all. We drove to neighboring town and had much better dinner there. We stayed in Garden View room, but it was a bit small for our family. We looked at the Superior Garden View room and it had more space and looked nicer. Our Garden View room did not have a bath tub (just shower), but we were told that we just needed to ask for it as some rooms have bath tub. The resoft is relaxed and laid back, and stuff were friendly to make us feel comfortable. Overall, we liked this resort and want to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: mbrebnor
Reviews.Content: Copamarina is a nice resort in Guanica, Puerto Rico. Very friendly staff make for an enjoyable stay. The rooms were very nice for the carribean. They are a decent size. We had a nice balcony overlooking the beach and pool area. The food at the restaurants was ok, but the service was great. Especially if you do the all-inclusive, which I highly recommend if you don't rent a car to go elsewhere. I went to Gilligans Island, which was nice. I would advise wearing beach shoes. There is a lot of sea shells. The beach at the resort has a lot of sea grass. If you walk down the beach to the right past the fence, it gets better. Rent a car if you are looking for entertainment because Copamarina is a resort for relaxing. The guitar player was nice at night after dinner. I think the only thing that I didn't like was the picture Id necklaces for the all-inclusive guests. Arm bands would have worked for me. Even though we wore the Id's, the staff still asked for the room number everytime we went to the restaurant or to the bar. We had an overall nice stay at Copamarina.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, the best resort in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: attorneyinmichigan
Reviews.Content: First let me see that the food, service and accomodations were WAY above par. Everything was perfect, except for the beach at that specific location. If you like bats, beautiful cactus, limestone caves and lots of interesting birds, the dessert to the north is beyond words - I could go back just for that aspect. Prior to staying here, I did some research on Tripadvisor. Most people were concerned with the beach, which has its problems, but when you compare the best locations in PR, it's at the top of the list. Take El Conquistador for example - this is a great resort with all of the amenities but you have to take a ferry to go to the beach, and there is no snorkeling location nearby. Or, if you were to compare it to Culebra accomidations, you can find a location on Flamenco beach but you have to buy your own groceries. I could go on and on, but the only drawback to this place is the beach, and it is a short ferry ride away to Gilligan's Island, a mangrove outcropping just southeast of the location. So lets talk about the most castigated aspect of this location - the beach. Copa is at the edge of a bay, approximately three quarters of a mile north of the edge of the reef line. As a result, there is little wave action, and LOTS of sea grass. It's just a normal part of that location. It does not feel good on the feet, and I do not recommend going into it - but that's not Copa's fault. Why do I say that? Well, it's very difficult (and for good reason) to get permits to build resorts on or next to reefs because of the damage they tend to inflict in terms of runoff and traffic. So if you want your reef at your doorstep, you may want to go somewhere else where you don't have everything else Copa offers. That said, getting to reef - well, the FISH, in particular, is not difficult. There are four ways to go - a $6.42 ferry to Gilligan's Island, a $45 two hour snorkeling trip, by kayak or by swimming (only skilled triathalets should attempt this). GILLIGANS ISLAND A lot of folks here have critisized Gilligan's Island. Not worth the time, they say - too trashy - no fish, and no reef. Well here is the low down. I went through the island, around the island and on one of the trails. I went everywhere that one could go by foot or by swimming. There are five sections for exploration. The first is by foot. The foot trail on the northern tier is difficult, often slippery, and you WILL find trash nearby. That is because the college kids from Ponce and Mayaguez use Gilligans as a recreational location and are too drunk to clean up after themselves. You will find some of this trash - mostly pop cans - on the northern side of the island, along with sea grass. Although teeming with minows, its a waste of time for snorkelers. Your best bet is outside on the southern, ocean-facing side and the two rivers that stream down from east to west. On the southern, outer edge of the island you will find some of the most beautiful and numerous fish colonies in the Carribean for snorkling (I should know as I've done most). They are under the mangroves and number in the hundreds. If you swim south towards the breaking water (which is about a half mile out) you will find about 20% reef and occasional fish. Be forewarned, however - the current is VERY strong. You should only attempt to swim out to the reef if you have the stamina and endurance to withstand the flow of water. I recommend going along the outside of the northern edge of the island, using the hanging mangroves to steady you against the current, until you get to the far east end of the island. Once you hit the eastern edge you can stand and walk to the river mouth, and then drift snorkle down back to the west end where you first arrived on the boat. There are two rivers that merge into one - the north and south river. I did both several times and the southern one is the best for fish viewing. The trick here is NOT to look down as you won't see anything - the fish are all under the rocks and mangroves, under the shadows. You should wait until noon as there will be less shadow. Here you will find approximately 20 different species of fish, mostly babies, but some very large adults (who are feeding) hiding under the rock. Brace yourself under a mangrove and watch them peer out to see you. Once you get back to near the dock, where most of the people and children are, you might think there are no fish - but alas! There are hundreds. Minows, baby Sergant majors and in the little alcoves, crabs and shrimp. I also saw two VERY LARGE baricuda cruising through for a quick meal. THE SNORKELING TRIP One thing you should know is that warm weather and hurricanes have done damage to the Carribean reef system, with some reports showing that almost 90% of reefs are dead or dying. This is true, so don't be surprised if you dont see something from the cover of national geographic. That said, there are reef colonies and fish nearby. The snorkeling trip, which is a bit steep, is good to see coral, but not so much for fish. You are basically ferried straight out ot near the breakwater where the reef begins. I saw more fish in one spot at Gilligans than in the entire reef trip. I did see beautiful brain coral, finger coral and other coral colonies on the trip. If you MUST take it, however, you may be able to convince a local in the town nearby to take you there for less. If fish are you thing, stick to the island. It takes some daring, strength and patience, but you will see amazing biodiversity.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation, location, great diving.”
Reviews.Author: Zwithapggb
Reviews.Content: We didn't actually stay here, but we will next time. We found this when we were trying to get a day of diving on the south wall, and all the boats out of Paraguera were full. The location can't be beat, the property is pristine, the dive op outstanding (and the wall is amazing), and there is plenty to do, or lots of deck chairs to do nothing if you so desire. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the facility is top notch. If you contact the hotel directly you can get much better deals than we found on-line. If we had been quoted the price we got when we went there for a day of diving, we would DEFINITELY have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: gunner27
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at the Copamarina. It was nice but we found the front desk staff to have no personality at all. The hotel was clean and the view is beautiful. but after checking in to our room the connecting room wasn't locked and when we opened the door there was another family in the next room - changing no doubt! Had to wait awhile for this to be fixed since the door had nails keeping the lock from locking?? The safe needed a key that you had to pick up from the front desk (what's the point if the front desk has a key). Dinner at Alexandra was okay but when we asked to sit outside we were told that request couldn't be accomodated. When the couple next to us complained after being seated in the restaurant that they wanted to sit outside and they were told "no" they wouldn't take "no" for an answer and got seated outside. When we asked why they were granted outside seating after being seated inside, the staff told us they had reservations. When clearly they did not. They were out of pool towels and when they finally came in after the pool towel truck ran out of gas we were charged a 30.00 deposit for two towels (you do get this back after returning the towels, but let's get real) the towels aren't really that nice. On the whole it's not a bad hotel, it just didn't make us feel welcomed and we usually stay at Ramada's etc. So, we expected to be "welcomed" when we arrived, paying close to 300.00 a night. There's no vanity in the bathroom only a pedistal sink. The view is beautiful and if you're going to Puerto Rico to read a book then this is the place for you. If you want a friendly atomosphere then I'd go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place management could improve”
Reviews.Author: buckosorenson
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a twoday two night stay at Copamarina. It is very beautiful and clean, restaurants are great. I was disappointed in the treatment I received upon arrival and with the Spa. Our reservation said Check-in at 3:00, one room was ready by 3 but after we had already waited 45" they said the second room could be another 1-1.5 hrs "they have until 5:00 to get it ready, they never know when the room is going to be available "(but check out is 12:00?). I pointed out politely that all the internet sites and my confirmation said at 3:00. The Manager kept arguiing that anywhere in the world you can expect to wait a couple of hours. The only other problem with this is that it is set in a desert env. and there are no towns around to explore. We noticed several rooms were empty in our bldg. that night. I also followed the directions of cancelling a manicure 6hrs ahead when we didn't know if the Snorkel trip was going out (water was cloudy these days) the spa wasn't open and the phone never connected to the voice mail. I called again during Bkft and the Spa Personnel was actually rude "that I hadn't cancelled 6hrs before". I was also told I'd be given a blanket or bed for my 3rd son (slept on the hard floor) but it never came. I hope no one else has to go through this. We had a very enjoyable stay on the ocean up in Rincon. susanand family from Madison,WI

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for...”
Reviews.Author: mrsblake
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Copamarina Beach Resort from Dec. 1 - 4. This was NOT long enough. The resort is gorgeous and the staff is very hospitable. We had booked a Gardenview Room; however, we were upgraded to a Superior Oceanview upon arrival. We truly felt like were the only ones at the resort. The resort filled up a little more on the weekend, but we still never had to search for privacy or beach chairs. Definitely do the All-inclusive plan - otherwise, you will pay way too much for food/drinks. We spent our days relaxing in a cabana right on the beach and has the most amazing food on the island. We took the boat ride to Gilligan's Island. It was enjoyable, but not what we expected. I probably would not do it again next time. We flew into San Juan and rented a car to drive the 1.5 hour trip - this was a great idea. HOWEVER - due to flight delays - we didn't land in San Juan until 5 PM. This is rush hour and it took us over 4 hours to reach the resort.... we lost out on a whole evening of fun. The traffic was ridiculous and the drivers are insane. Be prepared if you have to travel at this time. Our return trip was phenomenal though and a very easy drive - consisting of all interstate. Unlucky for me - I got a stomach virus the day before our trip to Copamarina. While there, I had to find a local hospital. The staff was very helpful and the local medical center fixed me right up. The hospital is about 10 min. from the resort - and the drive was breath-taking. Guanica is gorgeous. Note that very few people speak English outside the resort. I cannot say enough about how romantic and beautiful this resort is. There is not much nightlife/entertainment - but we didn't want any. This is a perfect place for newlyweds or couples of any age. The resort has two kiddie pools; however, I am not sure I would take my children there since there isn't much to do except for lounge, eat and drink. (Which was enough for us!!)

Reviews.Title: “Only visited, but a great experience”
Reviews.Author: rhormaza73
Reviews.Content: We went into Copamarina just for a couple of drinks but i left later that afternoon with the desire of booking a weekend soon after. it had great view, very quiet, great people.. best place to go and relax. it is also near Guanica's "dry forest" which is a nice hike too.

Reviews.Title: “for refugees of the island life”
Reviews.Author: futurefile
Reviews.Content: If you liked Secret Harbour Beach Resort in St. Thomas, you'll love this, too. This is secluded and safe. The grounds are gorgeous. Palm trees, pools, and outdoor bar. No riff raff. No loud people. Grab a book, your laptop if you prefer to surf web from beach chair. The day side restaurant is okay and the nightside one is pretty good. There is nothing you can walk to outside the property, but who cares? Rent a car and visit Parguera or the Parador's restaurant there, for more local fare. This resort is in Guanica, it is not in Ponce, which Trip Advisor has it listed as such. Ponce is 30 minutes away to the east. If you drive north on Rt. 121 you'll be in the mountains of the central part of the island, you'll find spots for scenic views. The rooms are nothing special, but adequate. There is a backdoor which leads to pool or ocean side, convenient on first floor.We were in the main building where open air lobby is. Robin and I loved this place. Our baby had a great time in pool. You get left alone unless you ask for something, or get it yourself at bar restaurant. If you like snorkeling and scuba there is an onsite scuba rental and tour shop. I hear the ferry to Gilligan's Island is good for a day picnic. We were fine where we were. If you want a quiet getaway this is for you. I love feeling safe and secluded. The shade of a palm, a drink, a book, food, and thou, works with me. If you want casino's and nightlife stay somewhere else. This place is for peace, some fun in pool or diving, and meeting some funny people at the bar from Pittsburgh, or Atlanta.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: jp_xyx
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Copa and I must say we had a fantastic time. We flew into Ponce and drove 35 minutes to the Copa. As mentioned in a previous post, the road was winding but manageable. The moment we arrived the atmosphere was one of peacefulness. We did not select the all inclusive but did have breakfast at the resort during our stay. If you are adventuresome you can select one of many great restaurants serving local cuisine a short drive from the resort (anywhere from 25-35 minutes). For lunch we strolled down the beach to the public beach (Cana Gorda) where we had $1.25 beers and a variety of empanadas (chicken, crab or shrimp) from the concession stand, which is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. The dive shop was great. Tony and the rest of the gang (Rosa, Love, Rueben, etc) were very attentive to our needs. I was able to obtain my scuba certification during my stay. All in all the Copa is a great place for some R&R. B&K

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: NMM1027
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Copamarina in late October and I had to comment on what a fabulous time we had. We rented a car in San Juan and it took us about 2 hours to drive to the resort in some awful weather. The directions were good and the roads were well kept...try to bring some quarters and singles for the tolls. The drive up 333 to the resort starts in a poor area which was sad to see, but it gets beautiful as you get closer to the resort. Stop to take some pictures of the cliffs if you can. The resort itself is very pretty and well maintained and the staff is friendly and helpful. The pools were numerous and all were kept clean and were virtually empty while we were there. The beach was nice as well with clear, calm and warm shallow water. Throughout our stay we felt as if we had the resort to ourselves, even on the weekends when there were many Puerto Rican families there. That was great for us because we went away to relax in peace and quiet and that's exactly what we got. It's a great place to reconnect with your loved one. We had the all inclusive option and highly recommend it since the food is pricey as it is all over the Caribbean. Both restaurants serve some native dishes which were fun to try. The food is not gourmet, but it is mostly good although the dinner options got a little boring by the last night of our stay. The service and food was off one night, but great the other 3. One thing I would recommend against was Gilligan's Island...don't waste your time. It was nothing more then a dirty picnic area with lots of ants. We snorkeled in the mangroves and didn't see too much activity and we caught the very first ferry back. All in all, if you are looking to really get away from it all to relax with your loved one this place can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, but beware”
Reviews.Author: PittIndian
Reviews.Content: Copamarina is a great resort, with its own lovely beach, and chairs just in the water so that you can just lie there under the hay shade forever, without looking at anything you don't want to. The resort is large and very well maintained and they have these cool trips to GIlligan's island nearby. If you are lucky, you might catch the kayak trip to the island...takes about 25 mins and some good exercise to get there. The island is very nice with its mangrove forests and zero population and streams going through it. Beware the outdoor restaurant. They have ridiculously loong waiting times, even if you are the only customer! We waited for an HOUR for just a sandwich! Otherwise, the resort is awesome, and the price of < $200 is also great.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice overall...”
Reviews.Author: peggya111
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very nice overall. Here are some thoughts for your consideration: 1.) We are scuba divers and came here specifically to dive. The operation is run by Sea Ventures and they were great. Tony and Pedro took excellent care of us. 2.) The restaurants are not good. The open air daytime cafe is fair, but pricey. It is also dreadfully slow. The man restaurant (reservations only) is VERY EXPENSIVE with terrible service. The food is only fair and NOT worth $80 or more for two people (with no alcohol and the less expensive entrees.) Skip the all inclusive meal plan and spend your money in nearby Yauco for lunches and take one evening and go to Charlie's in Parguera (also known as The Wall or La Pareda). It is EXCELLENT. 3.) Overall the room was very nice. We were here in the off season and did have to contend with some construction noise, but otherwise, we had a very pleasant stay. In conclusion we give Copamarina and the associated dive operation a big thumbs up, but the restaurants a big thumbs down. We do recommend it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Copa Marina - - More Than We Expected!”
Reviews.Author: TLO211
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon at Copa Marina and had to write about our experience! As we walked to the open air lobby to check in we were immediately greeted with warm smiles and friendliness. The staff at the Copa Marina go out of their way to make sure everything is to your liking and are a great resource if you want to go outside of the resort to other points of interest. The room (partial garden view) was absolutely immaculate and had a fabulous view of the garden and pool as well as the sea. If you go, we recommend sailing with Irving and scuba diving with Tony; both were amazing at making sure we had a good time! Our only complaint was that the food was on the expensive side. We had dinner at Alexandra's our first night and both had authentic Puerto Rican food. For the two of us, dinner was over $50 but worth it. If you're going to stay at the resort and don't plan on exploring what's outside of it, go all-inclusive. We are planning on going back next year and so are our friends and family. Thank you Copa Marina!

Reviews.Title: “I heart Copamarina Mojiotos!”
Reviews.Author: Annajuliette
Reviews.Content: All I can say is amazing! We booked the all inclusive package for 7 days and 6 nights and it was worth every penny. Not only is every meal drink and activity included in your purchase price, even tips are included. (Though our last day there we chose to tip our favorite servers, for making our trip so great.) Because of the time we went (late September) the resort was completely empty. There are pluses and minuses to this. On the good side, service was exceptional, our room was upgraded to an ocean view, and never having to wait for anything was amazing. On the bad side, there was a convention of local priests from all over Puerto Rico that were there that took over the bar every night with the druken anctics. (It was a little odd to see the Padres go wild.) I would highly reccomend this place to anyone that is looking to relax, catch up on reading, good conversation and wonderful mojitos! Do not expect crazy nightlife, though the classical guitar playing out on the patio every night is wonderful! I am planning to go back and hope that others will check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: MLCTC
Reviews.Content: The Copamarina is a solid 3* resort. It offers plenty of space for enjoying a quiet, relaxing time or active amenities such as tennis, swimming, diving, snorkeling and a boat trip to "Gilligan" Island, a uninhabited picnic and snorkeling island. There is one upscale restaurant "Alexandrias" which is very good but not exceptional. The other restaurant offers "beachside" dining and on the weekends an all-inclusive program serving buffet style for breakfast and lunch. They will pack a picnic lunch for you if you are taking a day trip. Service is good, staff is very friendly and helpful. We had a problem opening our in-room safe and the maid took care of it immediately. The room was kept clean and cool. The resort has 2 pools, a hot tub and a wading pool for small children. This is a family resort with limited children's activities. There is a nice game room for the older children and teens and peddle boats and ski-doos for an extra charge. There is a $15.00 per person beach towel fee which is refunded when you return the towels. The spa was clean and offered typical spa services of massages, facials, and various therapies. There is also a small exercise room with flat screen T.V., weight machine, bikes, eliptical, etc. They have conference rooms and a 3 bedroom private villa. The beach at the resort is kept clean and raked and there are huts, umbrellas and canopied day beds. They also have an on-site dive shop and mini-general store. All rooms have either balconies or patios, cable T.V., 3 phones, in-room safe and unstocked mini-fridge. We were there in late September for 4 days and it was very quiet, with the majority of guests being local Puerto Ricans. I would highly recommend the sunset snorkel trip from La Parquera with the Paradise Scuba and Snorkeling Center to the remote islands, dinner with the owner and an evening snorkel in the Phosphorescent Bay with the "dinoflagelites", or a day trip to the Guanica Dry Forest which gets less than 15 inches of rain a year.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: priyankakedia
Reviews.Content: We visted there for Labor day weekend. Amazing property, great service. Loved everything there. Don't miss going to Giligans island....very good island and very different ..from any other beach islands I have been. Do visit this island.... Booth restaurants have good food, and great service. Would love to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: mocha123
Reviews.Content: The minute we stepped into the open air lobby, we felt relaxed. We were traveling with a teenage son. We all loved it. The drive from San Juan Airport was not as bad as I thought from other comments. We didn't want to be driving on unfamiliar roads for 3 hours, so we arranged a vacation package with transfers included. Our driver knew the roads well and it took us only 2 hours. The roads were wonderful - large grassy dividers and the most spectacular mountain scenery. The hotel grounds were lush with palm trees, flowers, cacti and succulents. The pictures on the website do not do it justice. My compliments to the landscapers. Our room was not large, but bright and cheerful. Our patio had a ceiling fan with high hedges on each side for a little privacy. Overall, our room was clean, but some attention needs to be given to the baseboards in the bathroom. The bathroom was a nice size with a long counter, but needed brighter lights. These are the only negatives for my entire stay. The shower was wonderful and there was always plenty of hot water. When everything else was so beautiful, I could live with the lighting in the bath. The rooms also had neat shutters which had glass behind them, so you could open the shutters, but not worry about bugs coming in. We did the all inclusive. We were expecting a mediocre restaurant after reading some other reviews, but we loved the food. The breakfasts and lunches were great. Eating these meals outside was pleasant. The "made to order" omelets were delicious. The chef also made Belgian waffles on request. We looked forward to the dinners. We dressed up a bit and opted for the air-conditioned dining room each night, as we had already been outside all day and we loved the dining room. The staff in the dining room were top notch. They could not have been nicer. Maybe they corrected the problem other reviewers had with dried out food. We ordered our steaks and lamp chops medium rare and they were perfect. The white asparagus with Spanish cheese and ham as an appetizer was delicious. They flavored their little pats of butters with a fruit, I believe it was guava. They were yummy. We had asparagus as a side dish several nights and it was never canned. It was cooked to perfection, with a slight crunch. Don't leave without trying the mango sorbet -- it is to die for! The chocolate sin was also fabulous. We thought this was a fine restaurant. If there was ever a problem, the staff would bend over backwards to remedy it. One waitress even brought out the bag of the type of coffee they used, as I had inquired. I still miss the after dinner Puerto Rican coffees. I enjoyed the house wines, but I don't pretend to be a wine expert. We stayed elsewhere in Puerto Rico after the Copamarina, and I have to say that the Copa's pina coladas were the absolute best. They also made a specialty drink with coconut milk, chocolate and cinnamon that is very good. The beach was great for relaxing. You could pull chaise lounges into the ocean. We wanted to rent a motor boat, but just ran out of time, as we had one day of rain. Gilligan's Island was a lot of fun. We took the ferry. The dive shop employee told us it would take us 20 minutes to kayak there with a group he was taking out. I had seen a woman on the food network (or travel channel) who kayaked to the island and she looked really winded. You are rowing against the current in one direction, so unless you've had some experience, or are in top physical condition, take the ferry. It is further than you think. Gilligan's Island is a mangrove island which has a natural lazy river running through it. I recommend renting fins at the hotel's dive shop to help you swim against the current. You swim all the way to the end, which can take 25 minutes, and then the current carries you back in about 2 minutes. This is the best lazy river you can find. You can also see small colorful fish and tiny crabs on and below the mangrove roots, so take masks. It is not, however, a major snorkeling type area. Security was excellent at the hotel. There were always guards about and they seemed to take their work seriously. The staff was terrific. Everyone was friendly. We had one small glitch where we believe the hotel received incorrect information from the tour company about our transfers. We didn't find out until the night before we were leaving. They had us leaving really early, thinking we had a flight and we did not . We were merely leaving for the Hotel El Convento in Old San Juan and didn't want to leave the Copamarina that early. We did not think they could remedy this situation this late at night, but they did! So we had the entire next morning to enjoy our last breakfast outdoors and take a few more pictures. I want to tell the manager that this is one of the nicest hotels I've stayed at and I hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ivanuyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Copamarina in July for three days. Rooms are nice and clean. Pools are nice and opened 24 hours. I enjoyed most the gardens around the hotel with tropical fruits, the exotic palms and the food at the restaurant (make sure you try the whole red snapper) It is a great place to relax and forget. Special thanks to Jose Gomez and Carlos (Palmas Cafe) for their service and wonderful rum mojitos. We will return. Ivan Martinez.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service .”
Reviews.Author: monicacaguas
Reviews.Content: The resort is located far from the crowds. Is beautifully beachfront located. You can take a ride to a near Island in where all the beauty of nature is exposed. The resort is not a choice for nightlife,no discotheque,no noise. It is quiet ,is peace is , a stress buster. But most important the service is so good that I rated it EXCELLENT. The food and drinks are simply excellent. Is a good choice for romantic couples or for families with small children. I want to visit it again and again.I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Odin1965
Reviews.Content: Hello My family and I spen the 4 of July weekend here and beign a local I felt the need to recognize a gem. Copamarina is located about 1 hour drive from Ponce the grounds are well kept, the room was good an very clean , and the ammenities were excelent, but what sets this resort apart from the rest (Conquistador, etc) is the staff. Everyboby treted us like guest-friends, and they did this with all guests, I did not choose the all inclusive but I think is a very good deal if your dont have a car and plan to stay on the hotel grounds , because there is nothing close to the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great, low-key All-inclusive secret gem!”
Reviews.Author: Tampa_traveler63
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our third trip to PR since October 2005. We had driven by and walked around Copamarina on our first trip, and decided to return this June, for a two-night, three-day, all-inclusive stay. I have to say that the all-inclusive package is the way to go if you're going to stay here. Otherwise the price of the rooms, and especially the food, will seem very expensive. If you use the facilities (particularly one of the two HobieCats on site) and eat and drink to your hearts' content, you will *more* than get your money's worth. The best thing about the resort is the service. Everyone is attentive, attractive, and speaks English well enough so there are no communications problems (although lemon and lime are apparently the same word in Spanish!). The next best thing is the location and the grounds -- on the undiscovered south coast of PR, the resort is wonderfully secluded (so if you're looking for a party, stay up north in San Juan), and the grounds are absolutely beautiful. The resort has been there for about 30 years (but you wouldn't know it to look at the buildings' interiors or exteriors), so the trees and grounds are mature and lush. It was great to have two pools and the Caribbean Sea to choose from for lounging around. People have complained about the sea grass under the water at the beach -- yeah - it's not the best beach I've ever seen. There is a boat trip (or you can take a kayak or a Hobie) to another beach that's even more secluded, or you can walk over to the public beach next door to the resort -- just be sure to bring your Copamarina ID with you to get back on the grounds! Security is excellent, so there aren't any interlopers using the facilities or beach. The food was good, not spectacular. However the wine served with dinner (a French brand called Fortant) was very nice, particularly since it was the house wine included with the all-inclusive package. Advice for the diner -- ask the server to ask the chef not to overcook your meat/fish/whatever. They seem to think the drier the better (they may just be worried about American phobias about undercooked food). Try the "tomato surprise" for lunch. Not really a surprise, but a great, healthy alternative to fried plaintains and "assorted fried Puerto Rican Fritters." I would recommend Copamarina for families and couples who are looking for a low-key, relaxing getaway. Don't go there if you want nightlife, several restaurants or a big party. It's not a "name brand" American resort, so don't expect it to be one. I don't know what route one reviewer took to get to the resort -- but the highway from San Juan to Ponce is the best road on the island, and the road from Ponce to the resort is a close second. The San Juan - Ponce road goes through beautiful mountainous terrain, and the other road is boring, but very driveable. All in all, I loved this resort, and would recommend it and go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Dansladen
Reviews.Content: Spent 3-days with the family at the Copa Marina hotel and I have to say that overall it is a very good place to stay. Beware that this is not a cheap hotel. We paid over $50.00 for breakfast for two adults and twwo children. This is a great place for families with kids. There are lots of activities and the area is very quiet. This is not a hotel for people looking for night life. Overall, I would go back but there are a lot more hotels in PR that we want to try before coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from 5 days at the Copamarina. We are a couple from Atlanta and DC in our mid-thirties. We were pleasantly surprised that many of the favorable reviews were indeed accurate (i.e., nice rooms and amenities, good service and romantic seclusion). We flew into Ponce and would highly recommend that option versus the 2+ hour drive to/from San Juan airport. Both JetBlue and Continental offer reasonable flights from the Northeast $200-300 r/t. We took a cab from Ponce to Guanica the first night and found the price high -- about $50. We ended up renting a car our last day and driving back for about $70. The roads weren't that bad and we did it with ease and did a one-way dropoff at Ponce Airport on our way out allowing for a little sightseeing in Ponce. THE GOOD: Copa's 24 hr jacuzzis and pools for quick dips at 3 in the morning. The all-inclusive breakfast (omelettes, toast and pancakes are best best). The Pina-Coladas and Daquiris were great (ask for 151 proof rum for the same price and more KICK). The room was nice/spacious with a fridge & large marble tiled shower (for 2), nice patio and semi-ocean view from a 'gardenview" room. The canopied "futons" on the smallish beach were great. The beach didn't feel crowded for most of our stay. Tennis courts, dive shop and complementary fitness center were a plus. The service was generally good and the front desk staff accomodating for the most part. The in-room fridge came in handy because we went to the local supermercado to load up on snacks, drinks and basics. Free wireless Internet access was good although a little slow with limited connectivity the last two days. NY TV stations,and multiple HBO and Cinemax channels were good for mindless entertainment. The lunch menu had good eats for relatively cheap and once we had the HORRIBLE dinner fare (see below) -- we opted to order takeout lunch food from Las Palmas cafe around 6pm and enjoyed that in our room each nite (Palmas closes for lunch @6pm). THE BAD: The dinner menu and waiter service. The service was painfully slow and the Mahi Mahi was undercooked. When we asked them to reheat it, they simply took it in the back and slathered more lukewarm cream sauce on top of it. It bordered on disgusting and no we're not stuck-up 5-star wannabes. I forced myself to eat it because of the high price. My girlfriend's lobster and shrimp stew tasted quite 'fishy' (as did many of the seafood dishes). The humidity at nite and in the bathroom was pretty extreme. The bathroom ceilings "sweated' like a sauna and we had a leaky faucet that was supposedly fixed the 2nd day but continued to leak. THE UGLY: Gilligan's Island...Don't believe the hype and brochures. It's a bit dirty with very small patches of usable beach. The warm/clear water attempts to make up for it, but was not enough. In general we had a great time and would consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Unwind”
Reviews.Author: shawnh100
Reviews.Content: We spent the first week of March at the Copamarina. After dragging 4 kids (10-17) from Vermont to Boston, spending the night in Boston, flying from Boston to San Juan, picking up the rental van, and driving a couple more hours in an unfamiliar place, the Copamarina was quite a sight for sore eyes! Driving into the resort and checking in at the beautiful outdoor lobby, I knew I had made a great choice. We stayed at the Copamarina through our vacation club, so I didn't have to foot the bill for our rooms. Trying to be economical, I had decided not to do the all-inclusive. But after the short, but winding drive to the resort, I changed my mind at the check-in, and bought the all-inclusive for all six of us on the spot. If you have a family, do yourself a favor and splurge on the all-inclusive. It was so nice not to worry about food or drinks...and the kids love getting all those frozen virgin cocktails any time they please. We really enjoyed the daytime staff, especially Ramon (if you see him, ask him for his special drink, it was delicious). If it was busy, they were on over-drive, but when they weren't too busy, they were happy to answer any questions you might have about the area. Many visitors to Puerto Rico never make it out of San Juan, which is really a shame, as the area surrounding the Copa is absolutely beautiful. All the local Puerto Ricans we encountered at the Airport smiled knowingly and told us how beautiful the area would be, and they were right! There are plenty of activities to keep you busy without ever going to town: tennis, kayaking, hiking the Dry Reserve and exploring the cave, visiting other beaches, and going to Gilligan's Island. There was a really nice public beach next to the resort with fabulous facilities, including basketball courts. If you get the all-inclusive, you can check out tennis equipment, the kayaks, beach towels, all sorts of good stuff. Due to the special climate of the Dry Reserve, it rarely rains at the Copa, even when it's raining all over the rest of the island. My family really enjoyed the evening meal together; it was fun to get a little dressed up and take our time enjoying the food. We especially liked sitting out on the patio. The food and service were usually excellent, however, we did notice that when the resort got busier, the quality of both took a little bit of a nose-dive. On the weekends, the resort gets quite busy, as many Puerto Ricans like to come with their families and enjoy the resort. I've found that when locals like to stay at the resort, it means that you're really getting your money's worth, as they are the experts! While you can get "all-inclusive" at the resort, it doesn't have that impersonal, cookie-cutter feel to it. By the end of the week, it seemed the entire staff knew my family's preferences and routines. While families are certainly welcome there, rude children don't over-run the place; there were couples and singles of all ages that seemed to love it there.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Know yourself before you choose to stay here. If you're bored easily by quiet places, or if you require impeccable grounds, four-star dining, and at-your-feet service, go somewhere else! (and don't complain on this site!) The Copamarina is laid-back, but an absolute joy. My boyfriend and I spent four days at the Copamarina, and it was heaven. We are young, but not terribly interested in nightlife -- we're happier to enjoy each other's company in a quiet place. This is the perfect spot for it. We flew in to San Juan from Boston, rented a car and drove to Guanica. The drive was not difficult, but we did run into bad traffic both ways, causing the trip to be around 3 hours -- so be wary of their claim that it's 90 minutes to SJ. It was wonderful to see the PR countryside. After we got there, we only used the car to drive to the entrance of the Guanica Dry Forest. I think the hotel was at or near capacity when we were there, but it never once felt crowded. I was amazed. I grew up in NC and had never been anywhere remotely Carribbean, so when people said the beach was bad I was expecting some kind of dirty black mud. Hardly! It's white sand and clear water. Not much to see in the water, but who cares? Certainly nothing worth complaining about. We had a 2nd-floor gardenview room, which had a nice balcony with a view out over the second (curvier) pool -- nice to sit and read there in the afternoon. It was lovely. I felt no desire to upgrade to an oceanview. We were hardly ever in our room anyway! We did the all-inclusive package based on other reviews on this site, and were happy we did. We enjoyed not having to worry about paying for drinks or finding lunch and dinner. A-i includes all drinks except bottles of wine, for those who are interested -- not to sound like a lush, but hey, these things matter! The restaurant is overpriced and less than stellar. I started to get tired of it after a couple of days. I had one meal that was nearly inedible (rubbery scallops -- a bad choice, in hindsight), but I also had the lamb chops which were really good. The house wine is not so good. I certainly wouldn't be pleased if I were paying full-price for my dinners. Try to get a reservation for a table outside -- it's much more pleasant than sitting inside. My favorite part of the trip was eating breakfast in the open-air cafe every morning. It was sunny and warm and beautiful, and the food was good. It was just the best possible way to start your day. The bacon was perfectly-cooked and plentiful :). The cafe is just a bar at night (no apps available, which would have been nice). It was usually nearly deserted. Sometimes they have live music, which is nice -- but sit far away from it as they turn the speakers up pretty loud so the diners on the restaurant's patio can hear it too. If you have any interest in nature whatsoever, do go to the Guanica Dry forest. There are lots of interesting birds to see early in the morning, and lizards as well. You can get a trail map from the hotel. Be sure to bring water and something to snack on, as it's quite hot when the sun comes up, and the ranger station has no food or drink for sale. Also, if you get the all-inclusive it includes the use of their Hobie Cats, which is a lot of fun. They also have kayaks. We didn't get to go on a snorkeling trip, but I would have liked to. If anyone has questions I would be happy to answer as best I can. I tried emailing the hotel with questions before I went, and I got no response. We will definitely be returning!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Place”
Reviews.Author: mayla
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Copamarina and can highly recommend it. It is a great family-oriented resort. There is no night life, gambling or shopping. It is located in a very undeveloped section of southwestern Puerto Rico and is peacefully quiet and tranquil. We were told the hotel was full throughout our stay, but it never felt crowded. There are two large pools and two baby pools. The beach is less than ideal because the water is shallow and grassy, but there is a better swimming beach adjacent to the property at a public beach park called Cana Gorda. The restaurant choices are severely limited, but we had a rental car so didn't mind venturing out to explore the nearby towns to find dinner. The room was spacious, pretty and clean. We availed ourselves of the kayaks, hobie cats and paddle boats. We also asked the water sports manager to arrange a jet ski rental one day. That was very fun because there is almost zero boat traffic and very smooth water, making it perfect jet ski conditions. Copamarina is a great destination is you're looking to relax and unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Secret!”
Reviews.Author: sarahlg33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel during our honeymoon in January and loved it. When we were there it seemed that only 1/3 of the hotel was full - we had great access to beach chairs and the wonderful raised beds with shades on the beach! I will caution that the "excellent" onsite dinner restaurant is not worth it. It was expensive and we had other meals elsewhere that were much better and half the price. The poolside lunch restaurant is also over priced, but was decent. I will also caution that they do not accept travelers checks. We went up the road to another little town where the grocery store gladly cashed them, but... Our room was great, we paid for a "garden view", yet could still completely see the ocean from our room with a balcony. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and wheelchair accessible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Copamarina and it was a relaxing and beautiful resort with friendly staff. I recommend the breakfast package unless you want to eat at McDonalds or Burger King every day. We ate dinner at various locations within 30 minutes of resort and felt like we saved money and were freer to travel around. For wheelchair users, our room had a roll in shower but the space between the bed and dresser was narrow maybe 32 inches at best. You might want to ask for a measurement if you have a wide chair. Everything else was accessible and paved. The trip to Gilliganâ€™s Island was worth the trip. The boat people lifted my chair into the boat and at the island it was only about 4 or 5 yards to the water. With some assistance, you can enjoy the shallow waters and snorkel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: HDA
Reviews.Content: Agree with most of the reviews. A very relaxing resort. Beautiful area, good restaurants, nice, helpful staff. Not glitzy but if you want to relax, snorkel, enjoy, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Copamarina”
Reviews.Author: frunypie
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Copamarina where I stayed for nine days with my husband and two year old child. To echo previous reviews, the beach at the resort is grassy and yes it's shallow, but it was perfect for my daughter and I didn't have to worry about waves or currents. For those who like to swim, the resort has two pools that were great and very clean. The place was not crowded and is well laid out; even on nights when they were completely booked, it didn't seem crowded. The resort is very low key; the grounds are beautiful. It's true- if you're looking for nightlife, this is not the place for you. It's remote and quiet. The rooms were clean and comfortable; not luxe but spacious and well decorated. I only ate breakfast at the restaurant- which was great- but can't comment on dinners. In general, if you are looking for a five-star dining experience, I don't think this part of the island is for you; you will be better off in San Juan. Overall, it was a great place for a vacation and I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Copamarina - A Special Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Jeez, I've been reading some reviews and I'm not sure what some people want out of a vacation - peace, relaxation, beauty? - because they seem to miss the point. This place is great. It is literally across the street from a stunning Dry Forest Biosphere Reserve. Yes, there is not much nightlife going on here, and yes, there aren't many restaurants. But to those people who hated the Copamarina, I ask, did you go out to see the fantastic coral reef just off the shore from the hotel? Did you drive your car five minutes to walk down the paths around the Guanica forest? (for free) Did you drive a half hour to Ponce, a wonderful, charming colonial city? Yes, you will need a rental car here, and for some people, that could be a minus, and yes, the Copamarina is down a winding, hair-pin turn road. But its seculsion is part of its charm. My boyfriend and I did all these things and more when we were there and we loved it. We live in Chicago and I know I can say in a vacation we look for peace. This place has it, plus the staff were very friendly and the rooms were nice. Yes, the beach had seaweed in it but it really wasn't a big deal; if you drive a half mile down the road and hike down a path for 10 minutes you'll find a stunning turqouise-sea beach jutted against orange-rock cliffs. I would love to go back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Mid tier resort aspires to improve”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Copamarina over ten years ago and was apprehensive about visiting again. My fears were allayed, as the resort has improved tremendously. If you are looking for a low-key resort with minimal distractions, Copamarina is a promising choice. The hotel restaurant Alexandra was above average, but in particular we had a waiter named Jonathan who was excellent - very attentive and professional. There are still glimpses of sub-par service (the insolent dinner hostess, the less than perfect cleanliness of the bathroom, the lethargic reception desk staff), but overall my husband and I were pleased with Copamarina. That being said, we do not plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort Ever!”
Reviews.Author: mexicanmulatto
Reviews.Content: Wonderful resort. Has an ambience of tranquility that is unmatched. Very nice rooms and friendly helpful staff. The General Manager, Mr. Jose Padin, will do everything to make your stay a great experience. I plan to return at least twice a year.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyandMike
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Copamarina! We landed in San Juan and drove to the resort that evening. It is a longer drive fron San Juan than you think it will be because of all the traffic getting out of San Juan, so plan accordingly. Once at the resort, though, we couldn't have been happier. The staff was very accommodating. One morning we had a flat tire, and a young man offered to put the spare on for us, then directed us to a shop just down the road to get it fixed. What could have turned into a big problem somewhere else was just a minor inconvenience for us. We never swam at the Copamarina's beach; it looked a little grassy. But we took the boat to Gilligan's island and had a wonderful time. You have to do this! Definitely bring snorkel gear. The grounds are perfectly maintained, the food and service is great, the rooms are not fancy but are perfectly nice and very clean. We would return! (Incidentally, the second half of our stay we spent at the Villa Montana in Isabela. It was HORRIBLE!!! Don't stay at the Villa Montana--stay at the Copamarina!!!)

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our second stay as much as first”
Reviews.Author: Rata
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our second trip to Copamarina. It's one of the most relaxing places we've ever been to. The grounds are lovely-beautiful palm trees along the ocean. I love the fact the you could see the water from practically everywhere.Never feels crowded.It's very low key and g friendly. Always plenty of places to sit along the beach-either sun or shade. STretch out on a lounge under the covering in the water. The weather was perfect-perfect temperature and very dry, a nice breeze. It looked like a great place to come with young children. My husband was very happy with the dive staff and experience and enjoyed taking the small sail boat out every day-included in the all inclusive. I had a great massage in the spa. We enjoy good food and were very happy with the restuarant-loved sitting outside every evening having a leisurely meal on the patio with the guitarist playing. We always found plenty of selection, especially with the 2 specials every night. The staff in the restaurants were very friendly & worked very hard. Service is slow and relaxing-we enjoy not hurrying thru a meal-we do enough of that iin our everyday life. The all inclusive is definately the way to go. This is absolutely NOT the place to come if you want ritz and glitz, lots of nonstop activity, fancy shopping, poolside service. The last place we went to on one of the other islands was supposed to be one of the top-lots of fancy landscaping, lots going on-very impersonal, had walk to the beach and water-you weren't sure it was there, indifferent buffet dining that made me feel like we were a bunch of cattle. We were very happy to find the Copamarina. Also enjoy exploring the area-liked Ponce, the Tibes Indian Center, and other sites. Though we found that we almost hated to leave the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Quiet Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days at this resort earlier this month.Having read the Feb. 17 review by the New Yorkers, I have to wonder if we were at the same resort. For starters, we did not find any of the conditions listed as "really bad points" or "bad points" in their review, except that there was no bell hop and no beach side service. BFD!! Our room faced west so we saw a beautiful sunset from our balcony every day. The room had shutters so it was dark-WITH THE SHUTTERS CLOSED- but was light and airy when they were open. The beds (and pillows) were comfortable, and the bathroom was very clean. I belong to two swim clubs and know a clean pool from a dirty pool. I found the pool decks clean and the water gin clear.We ate at the restaurants for five days, and thought the food was excellent, but got a little bored because the printed dinner menu did not change for the five days. We would not recommend this resort for divers as the morning two tank dive left at 7:30am and the afternoon dive only goes down to 20 feet. Also we were told that there wasn't much to see on the reef. So we spent most of our time lounging by the pools, walking the beaches, sailing the Hobies, and ... well, you know. The staff was uniformly friendly and helpful, and fun to get to know. Long story short... we love the Copamarina and would go back again if we wanted a restful, quiet vacation on a secluded part of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Barefoot Elegance”
Reviews.Author: beach_love79
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW My husband and I spent 8 nights at the Copamarina at the end of January through the beginning of February 2006. Overall, we had a wonderful stay and reading all the previous Trip Advisor reviews were extremely helpful (love the web site). I would use the term to describe the resort as â€œbarefoot eleganceâ€�. Just to give you some background, we were originally planning on going to Hawaii since our ideal island vacation includes not only great weather and beaches, but beautiful scenery and enchanting local sights. After waiting too long to book our vacation and the airfares skyrocketed, we reset our sights on the Caribbean. Puerto Rico seemed to fit our needs as being similar in those regards to Hawaii. I knew that staying in San Juan was not our idea of a relaxation, so I began looking elsewhere on the island. The fact that the Copamarina is on the southern side of the island was enticing since we were more apt to have a rain free vacation (because when you are paying the big bucks to get away, who wants their â€œbeach vacationâ€� ruined by rain). I booked the Copamarina through Expedia, which was featuring an every fourth night free special. We have never done an all-inclusive package before, but knowing that the hotel is not in the city, food options outside the hotel would be limited, and the fact that the all-inclusive seemed relatively reasonable, we decided to go with it. Overall, we were very happy that we decided to do the all-inclusive which not only included all food, drink (alcohol, wine, beer, soda etc.), tips, resort fee, and use of 1 hour of the water equipment daily. The best part of the all-inclusive was that there is no bill to sign or wait for after you order anything. GETTING THERE I had read some varying degree of concern about finding the hotel and driving in PR in general, but we had no trouble at all. We rented a car from the airport which was relatively hassle free and used the directions I had faxed from the hotel prior to departure. A car is highly recommended if you plan on leaving the hotel at all and we found one very reasonable at $200 for 8 days. The drive took exactly 2 Â½ hours on fairly major highway which was easy enough to navigate. Someoneâ€™s earlier suggestion to bring a roll of quarters for the tolls was extremely helpful. The road off the highway to the hotel is curvy but not as scary as some previous reviewers made it seem. It reminded us of Hawaii in that respect. People do drive a little differently in PR with a lot of passing on the right, but we felt pretty comfortable wherever we drove. Checking in was not a problem and we had our choice of either a first or second floor room. They give you a badge for the all inclusive with your picture on it which also doubles as your room key. There is no one to help you with your bags, but that was fine with us. HOTEL GROUNDS AND ROOMS We found the hotel lovely and the rooms adequate. Every room has a patio or balcony depending on which floor you are on. Ours was very clean and spacious and we really had no complaints. Dirty hotels completely gross me out, so thatâ€™s a requirement for me. There is no turn down service in the evening in case that is a deal breaker for you. We had requested a garden view room but had a very clear view of one of the pools and ocean. Iâ€™m not sure if that was considered and upgrade or not. I had heard previous reviews complain about the noise through the connecting doors between rooms, but the room adjoining ours was only occupied the last night so it wasnâ€™t a problem for us. The grounds were wonderful and there are 2 adult pools and 2 baby pools which were very clean. It was easy to find a chair at all times at both the beach and pool. The pool water was a little chilly, but refreshing. There are also 2 hot tubs which were very hot. The beach has been adequately described by previous reviewers with the sea grass, and being a â€œbeach loverâ€� I was a little nervous.
