It is true that the beach is not a swimming beach, but you can easily walk a short distance toward the public beach which was sea grass free. There are plenty of chairs on the beach, both with and without shade, and the cabanas were beautiful and comfortable if you can snag one. There werenâ€™t too many children at the hotel and I wouldnâ€™t suggest bringing them if they need to be constantly entertained. I would say the hotel is definitely more geared for adults. FOOD We found the food in general to be very good. I managed to gain 5 pounds in the week if that means anything. Breakfast at Las Palmas was mostly a buffet, but a few days during the week when there werenâ€™t as many guests at the hotel you ordered off the menu. We preferred the buffet since we liked not having to wait for our food to be prepared when hungry for breakfast. They pretty much have all normal breakfast type food available. Lunch you could either sit at Las Palmas and eat, or have them pack it â€œto goâ€� for a road trip or even to eat on the beach. We found the all of the lunch items very good and even got a lunch to take with us to the airport when we checked out which turned out to be a GODSEND. Dinner was good, although I do have to say the menu got a little sparse being there eight nights. With the all-inclusive you get a choice of appetizer, main course, and dessert. My husband was in his glory with the lobster half the week. The prices are steep if you are paying out of pocket, but I would say typical of hotel restaurants. We ate on the late side each night since there is not much else to do in the evening, and the three courses averaged 1 hour and 45 minutes to get through. The service, although a little slow, (but like I said, we werenâ€™t in a hurry) was very good. I did wish their wine selection was more extensive. The other suggestion I have for the hotel was that there are a few tables outside which were difficult to obtain a reservation for, and the best thing about them was the guitarist who plays in the evening. Most people however have to eat indoors where you unfortunately canâ€™t hear him play. It is too bad the windows in the restaurant arenâ€™t able to be opened to enjoy the tropical breezes since it was beautiful out in the evening. There is no room service as others have mentioned, but that did not bother us since we never bother with it anywhere we stay. You can also have dinner â€œto goâ€� if you donâ€™t want to eat in the restaurant. STAFF AND SERVICE We found the restaurant staff and recreation staff to be wonderful. A special thank you goes out to Irving, who is the activities/waterfront director, for telling us about special local spots to check out and things to do and see. He was unbelievably helpful and knows a lot about the area. Some of the staff occasionally comes around to the beach and pool closest to Las Palmas asking if you want anything to drink. It would be nice if they came around more often, but since we didnâ€™t do much moving on the days we just hung by the beach and pool, getting up to get a drink was actually a good thing. One of the few complaints we had is that everyone at the front desk we encountered during the week was by far the LEAST helpful of all the employees at the hotel. They often seemed annoyed if you asked a question, and when we went to check out, they informed us we had used the phone to make a long distance call and wanted to charge us 50 cents for it. It obviously wasnâ€™t the money that I was concerned about, but when I told the woman that we did not make any calls from the room since we had our cell phones (which worked quite well I might add) she started speaking in Spanish to her coworker about me, and gave me a snotty reply that she would have to speak to her manager about removing the charge. Thankfully, I did not get charged in the end. ACTIVITIES We found it hard to leave the resort but did see some nice sights in PR. One day we drove past Ponce to the Banos de Coamo (which I discovered in our PR book and not even many PR natives seem to know about). They are naturally heated 110 degree freshwater pools. They were fantastic! We were a little hesitant at first when we got there since we were the only tourists, but after a few minutes many of the locals asked us where we were from, and engaged us in conversation. We also ventured up North to the Arecibo Observatory to see the radio telescope which was fun, although it took a while to get there. It was nice to see more of the island though. We also tried to see the Camuy Caves but unfortunately they closed just as we got there due to rain. We tried to call ahead but no one answered the phone. We took 2 walks/hikes in the Guanica Dry Forest which we loved. Be sure to get a guide/map at the front desk. Our favorite was definitely the Meseta trail along the water which has many beautiful cactus and plants. We also hiked a longer one up to the visitor center and back to the ocean. The forest is beautiful, and I wish we had more time to explore it. It is just down the end of Rt. 333 on which the Copamarina is located. We took the boat to Gilliganâ€™s Island which was enjoyable. We went on a Sunday when there were lots of locals there, so if you want it more to yourself, go during the week. We swam up one of the â€œriversâ€� through the mangroves against the strong current and had it float us back down which was fun. It is like a natural lazy river. There isnâ€™t much else to do out there but there are little secluded beaches around the island if you are looking for more privacy, but you have to be a little creative to find them. SUMMARY There is still so much of the island we didnâ€™t see, so a return trip will definitely be in order in our future. Overall, we loved the Copamarina and Puerto Rico. It was exactly what we were hoping for, and expected based on previous reviews. If you demand high class service, lavish amenities, and endless entertainment, this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a quiet jewel of a resort, with pretty much guaranteed good weather, reasonable prices, helpful and pleasant staff, and clean and adequate rooms and facilities, than search no further! Enjoy yourself! We hope to return someday soon.

Reviews.Title: “So Bad We Left!”
Reviews.Author: Jimibell
Reviews.Content: Let me qualify the "terrible" with "if you are used to luxury hotels you will NOT like it". Really Bad Points: NO BELLHOP PRACTICALLY INEDIBLE FOOD HARD BED WITH LUMPY PILLOWS AND CHINTZY BLANKETS NO ROOM SERVICE ODOR IN AND OUTSIDE ROOMS, EITHER SEWER OR SULPHUR WATER UGLY DOORS IN ROOMS (they look like a door to a janitor closet, not exactly conducive to feeling like your on vacation) SMELL AND FEEL OF MILDEW IN ROOMS Bad Points: leaky shower old, ugly bathrooms with flourescent lights unprofessional staff No poolside or beachside service grounds are kind of sloppy service is slow dark, kind of depressing rooms our room was very far from lobby and forget about anyone actually offering to bring something to your room, you have to ask yourself, and let me tell you, they will make you WAIT for whatever it is (no such thing as "right away, miss" here! pools are old and not that clean, stains and spills are everywhere seaweed in beach water Good Points: beauiful view of ocean warm water casual, friendly atmoshphere usually friendly staff a few notes: we arrived at around 9PM for check-in.....nobody was there to greet our car, we waited 30 minutes for them to check us in (while I was holding the baby in my arms) and then we actually had to request "help" with our bags! the food----I think I could have put up with everything else because it was very serene there, but I was afraid I would end up 10 pounds heavier, with greasy pimples and constipated if we stayed....we're talking major greasola here, their idea of a salad is literally--iceberg lettuce with unripe tomatoes and a few raw onions (dressing on the side of course)....and you're thinking right about now, oh, but the fruit, at least the fruit must have been good.....think again....sour pineapple, whitish watermelon, wilted papaya, scrawny grapes one lonely strawberry that was half-white! no such thing as organic greens or anything that even pretends to be healthy here. and the dirty floors in the outdoor restaurant really take away the apetite too. we left early, they penalized us with one night! never would I go there again and if you have any sort of high standards for cleanliness and fine cuisine you will be wasting your time and money on this place!! too bad because it's a beautiful spot with lots of potential.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly!”
Reviews.Author: NikiC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are still here and this is our last day of four. I will start by saying I would have rated it 31/2 if that was an option. Here it goes: The Good: People could not be nicer, more helpful or harder working. So management...compliments to your staff. Good size rooms, clean with pleasant view and good housekeeping. Grounds are pleasant and clean. Restaurants are limited but the service is great. Breakfast and lunch is certainly all you could you want. Dinner in the Alexandra Restaurant is relaxing with nice back round music from a live guitarist. The pools are refreshing, clean and never crowded. The beach is certainly not one of the best but again you can swim out or use their water sports if you choose. The BEST Margaritas! Very quiet and comfortable no one intrudes on your space. You can be very casual no matter where you go on the property. The Bad: Very tired and in need of updating. The rooms are good size but very dark because of the shutters no light gets in. The shower takes for ever to drain, bathroom is small,the amenities are average (that is all related to price). Grounds could be exceptional if they added some color and maintained it better. If you are only going to have one restaurant open for dinner, change the menu. Food is average. Staff not trained right....no reason to wait for drinks from your server while three other's are standing around. The Ugly: There is none. If you are looking for a happening spot with exciting night life, great restaurants and non stop activities...this is not the place for you. Go to San Juan. TIP: The All-Inclusive option is very good. It includes taxes, resort fees, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing, Great Place”
Reviews.Author: iron_monkey_fist666
Reviews.Content: The good: lots of activities: tennis courts, beach stuff, (we rented kayaks to go to Gilligan's island-- a nearby deserted mangrove place) pools, hot tubs. the room was quiet, and relatively clean. The bed was ok, but not super comfortable. the room was very spacious. food-- great, and abundant. drinks-- awesome, and flowing non stop. service-- great, the bartenders and waiters are super nice, friendly, really great. someone working at the desk screwed up our bill for the all-inclusive package, but the hotel's manager, Jose, was extremely helpful in resolving the situation. It is great for families or couples who want a quiet, relaxing place to chill and do some activities if you want, or chill by the pool or beach all day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: marketom
Reviews.Content: Copamarina was a nice resort but not perfect. What we liked: It is located in a secluded dry tropical forest area on a beautiful area of the coast. The grounds were pretty and child-friendly with a wading pool and a playground. It is a nice low-key resort (which is what we were looking for). And we really enjoyed our visits to the village of Guanica, which in our experience was full of friendly people. What could have been better: most of the staff was unusually unfriendly. When we arrived, we were "greeted" by a very crabby girl at the front desk who looked very annoyed that we had arrived. For our three days there, we did not have one friendly experience at the front desk, even when just asking a simple question. Most of the bartenders were equally unpleasant. During our stay, the only friendly staff was one waitress and housekeeping. The highly acclaimed restaurant, while good, seemed less professional than we would expect for the prices. For one of the "finest" restaurants in Puerto Rico, we were surprised to find what appeared to be canned asparagus (certainly not fresh) in our food. We had a waitress who was nice but was unable to give us a single recommendation from the wine list to pair with our meal. The restaurant was pretty good, but in light of the prices and acclaim we thought it would be a more refined experience. But overall I have to say that we had a nice time at Copamarina and enjoyed our stay at the resort and in the area -- and it certainly was a nice break from the bustle and noise of San Juan. Tom S. Chicago, IL

Reviews.Title: “Bette Places in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: allmotorchick
Reviews.Content: Over priced. Things I liked Great large clean rooms. Pool is large but only 3 feet deep all around, which is great for kids. Gilligan's Island is a boat ride away. Water rentals on beach Food is excellent. Guanica is beatuiful. Things I disliked Far drive from San Juan about 2 1/2 hours. The service was just ok. The beach shouldn't even be called a beach. It's full of seaweed and you can't swim in it, very shallow. The public beach next to it is nice, they charge $2. There are also many nice beaches in the Guanica Dry Forest but the waves are dangerous. Parking was tight. Not too much to do in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know where these other reviewers stayed”
Reviews.Author: dbosullivan
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from Copamarina- what a letdown. On previous trips to PR we stayed at the Rincon Beach Resort in Anasco, but we thought that we should try something different. So much for variety being the spice of life. The hotel is isolated, with absolutely nothing nearby. We were given a room literally a quarter mile from the front desk (and the only open bar). They had serious issues with their leach field/septic tank, and the odor was very offensive 24/7. The housekeeping service was the only staff that we were happy to deal with. Otherwise, poor service was the norm. If you stay here, expect nothing nearby in terms of amenities, deposits for beach towels, and a disappointing shoreline. If you're planning to go somewhere in Puerto Rico, make it Vieques or Rincon- don't bother with this place.

Reviews.Title: “lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: mamakpk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 2 days and nights at the Copamarina and we had a wonderful time. We did not take the all inclusive but instead booked the "romance package" which included 1-hour massages for each of us, 1 dinner at the Alexandra, 2 breakfasts, champagne and fruit. It was a great deal because the breakfasts were so huge we never needed lunch and one dinner at the Alexandra was plenty. We dined out in Guanica on the second night. Our room was great. We loved our ocean view balcony and comfortable living space. The staff was attentive, the food was excellent and the pools were very nice also. My only complaint was that the beach was really nothing special. It was small, the sand was not very soft and the water was really no good for swimming. We did take the trip to Gilligan's Island and had a wonderful time. Be sure to bring snorkel equipment and don't be afraid to venture around the reef to the ocean side. We saw some spectacular marine life. Overall we were very pleased with the quiet classiness of the Copamarina and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Trapped”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I strongly disagree with other's review on trip advisor about a hotel. We found the Copamarina was not worth the money we paid. (about $850 for 3 nights) In spite of this and the fact that our room was prepaid we left the hotel a day early. I felt trapped on this property and was so relieved when we finally decided to leave in spite of losing money on the room we had paid for. Yes the property was pretty but there was only one restaurant that served lunch and one that served dinner. The prices were very high. So if you have already decided to go to this property I would take the meal plan. One Restaurant was opened at a time, that is your only food option... unless you have a rental car and wanted to drive up the mountain on a winding road about 15 minutes to the Guanica waterfront where you'll find a place to eat and a couple of local bars. The road is narrow and the curves are sharp. The hotel has one bar, the same outside location where lunch and dinner is served. There's no room service. The dive shop that hands out the beach towels opens at 9am. (yet the young lady in the dive shop was extremely nice!!) Our television had horrible reception. Our room was not ready when we arrived at 3:45pm. The property and the rooms were clean. The Beach was nice. Personally I did not think the hotel was worth the price. It is so isolated I could have been on a beach in Florida. It depends on what you are looking for, but I wish I had this advice before I made my reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Just terrific !”
Reviews.Author: jwsmd3
Reviews.Content: My 5 night stay must have coincided with the traveller from Boston; their very comprehensive review says it all! I would agree completely and would add.... The service in the Alexandra restaurant warrants huge praise. Someone has Ritz-Carlton training and has brought it to Guanica. Politeness, attentiveness and an unintrusive well-paced and leisurely efficiency were on tap nightly no matter how busy. The prices are steep but the all-inclusive (especially from Expedia) was a remarkable bargain (and includes room tax and resort fee to boot). The breakfast and lunch staff were also terrific. The front desk staff was also cooly professional and responsive to every request. A noisey A/C was replaced within an hour with a new and quiet unit !!! A deep tissue massage at the spa was satisfying. The small facility looks carefully planned but I was surprised there was no spontaneous invitation to partake of the steam room and outdoor shower, which I was offered once I inquired. The small gym is nicely equiped and has a 42" Panasonic plasma TV (though I don't think anything was transmitted in HDTV). Having been unimpressed by tepid "hot" tubs elsewhere the high temperature of the two on the grounds of this facility was wonderfully relaxing. While satellite trouble prevented the use the first night, the free WiFi was pretty fast once up and running. My only minor quibble....the door to the adjoinging room is not much of a sound barrier. It was easy to hear conversation, snorring and their TV. A couple of small towels stuffed the door under helped a bit, and the A/C drowned out the rest. And being an avid TripAdvisor user I must point out that few establishments seem to read and respond to comments. Copamarina apparently does. They care and it shows. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Do-Nothing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: luvzsun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I like â€œdo nothingâ€� vacations â€“ we donâ€™t want adventure or excitement, just a beach, some shade, plenty of tropical drinks, nearby bathrooms, and time to plow through a stack of paperback novels. Above all, we donâ€™t want to think or make lots of decisions on vacation (we get enough of that at work). In January 2006 we had a wonderful 8-night stay at Copamarina, and plan to go back next year. We had the all-inclusive package, and felt it was a great value. We did rent a car in San Juan and drove down to Guanica, through once we got there we never left the resort. The drive from San Juan was pretty straightforward and about 2.5 hours in duration (with traffic). There are several toll roads so bring a roll of quarters (the exact change lines are far shorter than the cashier lines). The roads are standard U.S interstate type roads, and the only narrow, twisty part is the last 5 miles from Guanica to the resort (but still well-paved). Our Garden View room was very nice â€“ the usual amenities and air conditioning. All the room balconies/patios face the ocean, so the difference is really how many palm trees and pools you want between you and the Caribbean. We didnâ€™t feel like the Ocean View option was a major plus over the Garden View rooms (given how close the beach is). The palm trees and flowers and the entire grounds are well-maintained and beautiful. We were also very pleased with the friendliness of the staff, from the wait staff in restaurants and bar to the water sports staff and the grounds crew. Almost everyone speaks English. All our requests were met promptly and with a smile. Copamarina serves a breakfast buffet from 8-11am, which never varied but was pretty good for resort faire. They had an omelet station, plus scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, fried potatoes, fruit, pancakes, and French toast. We never got tired of it in eight days. Lunch is from 11am-6pm, and the menu is a mix of sandwiches, burgers, salads, and dinner-type entrees like steak, fish, and chicken, all served in their outdoor bar/cafÃ©. Overall, we were quite happy with the variety and quality of the food and the service â€“ just enough variety for about a week. Many people got their food â€œto goâ€� to either eat on the beach or their room or take it with them on a trip somewhere. Dinner was from 6-10:30pm or so, and was a white-table-cloth affair, though not necessarily that formal â€“ people were in everything from dresses to t-shirts and shorts. They had a nice selection of appetizers and about 12 entrÃ©e items, plus a daily fish or meat special. We tried just about everything on the menu, and the variety was also just about right for a weekâ€™s stay. You had the choice of eating inside or outside, and outside they had an acoustic guitar player providing music nightly. We spent most of our time sitting in beach chairs reading books, and overall were very happy with the general layout. Southern-facing beaches often have little shade, but the Copamarina had enough palm trees, umbrellas, and thatched canopies so that we had no trouble staying out of the sun. They probably have about 40 beach chairs, and we only saw about 1/3 of them in use at any time. As others have written, the only downside to the beach is the water. The beach itself is quite nice (good clean, white sand) but from the edge of the water to about 100 feet offshore the water is only about 1 foot deep and there is quite a bit of silt on the bottom. If you walk more than about 20 feet into the water your feet sink several inches into the silt, so the immediate shoreline is too shallow and mucky for much recreation. However, the resort has a 100 foot dock, and off the dock the water is deep enough for swimming. The resort is in a protected cove, and in January (with prevailing winds from the east) there are only about 1 foot waves at most, so no chance for boogie boarding or playing in the waves. There were a few scattered patches of grass in the shallow water, but since we didnâ€™t spend any time there (and they werenâ€™t visible from the beach) the grass didnâ€™t detract from the view. The shallow water and silt was definitely a detraction, but the rest of the resort made up for it. As far as watersports, Copamarina has two Hobie Cats, a bunch of kayaks, and some pedal-type watercraft. Given we had the all-inclusive package, we went out several times in the Hobie Cat and kayaks. No complaints there â€“ all the equipment was in great shape and the water staff were quite helpful. They also offer dive instruction and dive tours, but we didnâ€™t do any of that. The resort has two swimming pool areas, each with a separate hot tub and kiddie pool. Instead of cooling off in the ocean, we took a dip in the pool or hot tub every few hours. The hot tub was quite nice in the early evening. You canâ€™t beat the proximity from hotel room to beach (and thus a nearby bathroom and air conditioning) plus clean beach towels every day. We loved the all inclusive package, and felt it was a great value. We lost count of how many drinks we ordered from the bar and brought to the beach (during the afternoons the staff would make an occasional trip down the beach to take orders too), and we liked not having to look at prices and calculate tips. Since we didnâ€™t have to wait for a bill or sign anything, meals and drinks were also more efficient. Our usual vacation strategy has been to eat one or two meals a day in restaurants, and then buy our own breakfast/sandwich stuff and drinks at a local grocery store and eat the rest of our meals on the beach or in our room. Based on our calculations the all inclusive package was pretty much equal to what weâ€™ve paid in the past for hotel, meals, and drinks on other trips, and this time we didnâ€™t have to hunt for provisions or throw away excess stuff when we returned home. Overall, the all inclusive package just made our lives easier. Again, we never left the resort once in eight days. The southwest part of the island is pretty sparse compared to the northern side, but we heard there were interesting museums and shopping areas in nearby Ponce. Other vacationers reported they did some hiking in the rain forest. There is also a ferry that runs from the Copamarina dock to a nearby island with a better beach and snorkeling opportunities (we didnâ€™t do that either). Overall, we loved our stay at Copamarina. Though we wish the water at the beach was deeper and the ocean floor was less mucky, the rest of the resortâ€™s amenities, layout, service, and overall value more than made up for it. For those out there like us who just want to read books and vegetate for a week, Copamarina is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Friend....its the Best kept secret in Puerto Rico!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you have a family or its you and the love of your life. Go here! I probably don't have enough room to write how much I enjoyed the hotel, the staff, the food, the guitar player, the gift shop, the service, the breakfast, the dinner, the restaurants, the drive, the pools, the location, etc.etc.etc.... but I'll try to squeeze it in. My wife (pregnant at the time), myself, my 2 year old and my 9 year old arrived in San Juan in the morning and took the 3 hour drive through the heart of Puerto Rico through Ponce and on into Guanica. Loved it. If you call the hotel the operator will give you precise directions if you care to drive like we did. Precise! Now you know those winding roads that are on the side of mountains in the movies....well once you leave the highway and turn onto the main road leading to the resort that's exactly what you're going to be on....so slow down...and no drinking and driving...because the car coming around the corner head-on is driving in the same lane as you are. That's 98% of the bad stuff I have to report. Beautiful! Gorgeous! Just overwhelmingly nice and pleasant. Our luggage was late by a day...airline's fault. But the staff not only showed empathy but kept me posted with hourly updates on their communication with the airline and the courier. We had an excellent room. Excellent house keepers. Excellent cooks...especially Louis during breakfast hours. The only warning I have...and the resort warns you as well......Do Not Feed The Birds! These creatures are the only birds I have ever seen with pupils and they will swarm you if you offer one of their kindred a morsel...its like they hang out in the trees above and wait for some poor sucker to let down his/her guard....then POW!...they're on you and its too late. They remember to. They will be back...for breakfast, lunch, and dinner...at your door...no one else's....Your Door. Because of the mountain range the area gets very little rain...it literally rained 30 seconds while we were there...and it was more like the sky spitting on you if you can call that rain. This is relaxation at its finest...if you are a city guy or gal and are looking for night life....you're 3 hours away from that. Sorry. But if you want QUIET...Beauty...fresh air...Copamarina is the place. We're going back....and we're bringing others.

Reviews.Title: “It was just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel and grounds are beautiful. Several very nice swimming pools. We checked out the other reviews and they are on the mark. It IS remote so the all-inclusive plan is by far the best way to go. Alexander's Restaurant has excellent (excellent!) food for dinner. The service was pretty good. La Palma restaurant for breakfast (very ample and varied buffet) and lunch is open air and very nice. The service staff is particularly warm and attentive. The beach is as others have said - somewhat muddy, somewhat with sea grass - but little wave action so it's good for children. 300 yards walk down the beach to the west is a very nice public beach with no grass (but still a little cloudy). We found beaches about 2 or 3 miles drive past the hotel (on 333) to the east. These beaches have more wave action and are clear of turbidity and grass. The road to the resort is nicely paved, with ample guardrails, and very curvy. Just go slow and stay on your side and there's no problem. All-inclusive includes kayaks (one and two man), 2 catarmerans, pedal boats and were readily available. We had a miscommunication with the hotel that could have turned out to be unpleasant but the hotel corrected everything and was most accomodating. Clearly the hotel is well run. Things go very smoothly. Gilligans Island trip was hardly worth it. Just a small shallow, sandy lagoon surrouded by mangroves. The locals seem to gather here. We left on the first boat back. Note: Beware of radar traps throughout Puerto Rico. We got a speeding ticket (65 in a 55 zone) just as the limit went from 65 to 55. Saw many, many police cars and drivers getting tickets during our 5 day stay. It seems to be an income stream for the island. If you rent a car (which most will do), strictly obey the limit.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to get away - really away”
Reviews.Author: MercerChow
Reviews.Content: Our family of six spent a week at the Copamarina and had a fine time. I will not repeat what others have said about the facility itself, swimming, etc.; there were no surprises. If you like hiking or birdwatching the adjacent dry forest is terrific, many trails and easily accessible. The Copamarina is also a good base for exploring the entire SW coast of PR, from Ponce around to Mayaguez - each about an hour east or west, respectively. There are several other good PR and US natural reserves within that span, especially Cabo Rojo, Boqueron, and Laguna Cartagena. Because we took many day trips we did not stay on the all-inclusive and therefore the Alexandra restaurant was too pricey for a la carte every night. There are few dining options in Guanica proper but several good ones in Parguera, about 20-25 minutes west. The informal Las Palmas was a better value for breakfast and lunch. As far as day trips go, one word of warning. The Arecibo Observatory and Rio Camuy Caverns are not as accessible from Guanica as they might appear on a map. There are no good roads across the Cordillera, and Route 10 does not go straight through, despite what it says on several maps. Be prepared to spend some considerable time on narrow, winding mountain roads. (They make the 333 road into the Copamarina a piece of cake by comparison.) If you do go to Parguera do not bother with the trip to the Bahia Fosforescente. The lights are gradually going out and I feel sorry for the boat operators who are still trying to squeeze a living from this dwindling resource. But it's underwhelming, believe me. For a bit of culture, the art museum in Ponce is an absolute gem - a world-class collection in a beautiful but modest and manageable space (designed by the same architect who did the MOMA in NYC). Would we go back to the Copamarina? Tomorrow, if we could!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but far away”
Reviews.Author: lauramh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2005 to go scuba diving. I had done a lot of research and was glad I purchased the all-inclusive option. Otherwise, there's very few restaurants in the area and the on-site restaurants can be expensive if you pay as you go. My only complaint about the room was that the A/C unit is one of those large noisy units that sits in the corner. I had a hard time falling asleep with it running. But the weather was too hot to turn it off. The food was excellent, sometimes the service was slow but it wasn't a problem. The on-site dive operator was great, they have a very nice boat and the divemaster was really professional. The dive sites are nice and the reefs are healthy. Believe what others tell you about the Copamarina beach. Pretty muddy and some sea grass. The road to get to the Copamarina (route 333) is very treacherous to drive. Very narrow and you hope that cars coming the opposite direction are paying attention. The resort is on the southwest corner of the island, a good 2-3 hours from San Juan by car. This is a resort that is best enjoyed if you either come and stay without leaving, or keep your daytrips to points close by. A trip to El Yunque, for example, is approximately 3 hours by car each way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort and great food and facilities”
Reviews.Author: carlo45
Reviews.Content: We chose Copamarina based on the reviews here and we wanted the carribean side of Puerto Rico since the weather is more reliable. It's a 2 hour scenic drive from San Juan but worth the drive to be in one of the more beautiful areas of the island. The place is absolutely beautiful and not one complaint from my wife and two teenagers. One of our best family vacations. Find a nice lounge chair and let all your tension roll away. The resort offers something for everyone. I think the all-inclusive is the biggest bargain of all vacations considering the quality of the food. When my teenagers heard "all-inclusive" they immediately thought buffet and cafeteria style. Instead it was two restaurants with excellent menus and food. Dinner is served in a beautiful restaurant called Alexandra with superb quality and service. All drinks, day and night are included too! We have stayed in more expensive places in Puerto Rico and paid double the price for half the beauty and amenities. There is lots of boating and water activities. If you want a big ocean with waves this is not the place for you although other guests took day trips to nearby beaches where they could boogie board. Copamarina is on the gentle carribean sea, my preference. I especially enjoyed kayaking and sailing the hobie cat which is also included in the all inclusive. The grand surprise is the snorkeling. For beginners or experienced, it's only an 8 minute boat ride from the hotel dock and you will dive into a tropical paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Copamarina was a beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: greeneacr
Reviews.Content: The resort was clean and very beautiful to look at. We had the all inclusive package as it was required with the RCI timeshare folks. We used the Copamarina as our home base. We always had breakfast there (nice buffet most days and some days a made to order breakfast) If we were venturing out we had the resort make us a lunch as we were paying for it anyway. And dinner was always in the Alexandra Room at the Resort. The dinner menu got a bit thin with 7 nights to choose from just one menu but the food was excellent and I have to say I am actually tired of lobster and filet migon. Absolutley go out into the countryside! Don't just stay at the resort or you will miss the absloute beauty of Puerto Rico! The rainforests are breathtaking! The silence (except for the coqui frog and an occasional chicken) was amazing! I took sunset pictures from the north side, west side and south side of the Island. What an amazing place. Don't be afraid to venture out but KNOW that the maps are all horrible and directions are sketchy at best. I-10 stops completely in the middle and turns into a tiny little road. All roads are steep, skinny but breathtaking! Eat in Maricau at Hacienda Juanita. It is worth the flight to PR. I didn't spend any time in San Juan. The Torre Negro rainforest was spectacular but I didn't make it to the other bigger one. The resort is clean, beautiful and the staff is amazingly helpful. One staff person even had her aunt make us some Puerto Rican food to bring back to the states! The Bio Bay is a bit of a rip off. You really can't swim in it. One boat lets you and he doesn't have a laddder. My husband cut his leg getting into the boat via the motor. Gilligans Island is amazing. When there there are to water (rivers?) both with current coming from the ocean side. Pull yourself up by the mangrove roots and when you get to the ocean side float back down the other river. It was georgeous. Wear swim shoes as the coral is brutal. Have a wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place, Horrible Management”
Reviews.Author: sonjeroo
Reviews.Content: When our plan arrived late, we called the hotel and they (the manager) were absolutely unwilling to send another transport for us even though we had paid in advance, and was also unwilling to refund us. This was frustrating and this manager was the bain of our existence the entire time, but even the rest of the staff comiserated with us on how awful he was. Save the one manager, the place was fantastic! I'd love to go back (especially if the manager is no longer there)

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, but no five star”
Reviews.Author: momwith3kids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copamarina Resort in October to celebrate my in-laws 40th anniversary. My husband, 3 kids, (ages 7,5,3), mother in law, father in law and brother in law all spent four days there in the pouring rain. The resort is very pretty, very secluded and quiet and has a wonderful staff and restaurant. The things to be aware of, however, are these: -- the beach is not nice. Seaweed, and debris from all of the trees were all over the sand. The bottom was more like a lake than the ocean. My kids wouldn't have put a toe in, and they love the beach. It's true, there is a public beach a quick walk away, but not what you expect from the Caribbean. -- the Villa, which is two 3 bedroom apartments, one on top of the other has no air conditioning in the common rooms. Because of the size of our party, we had reserved this and we moved immediately. While nicely decorated and spacious, we couldn't suffer the heat anytime we weren't in the bedrooms. -- they advertise 4 pools. Two are tiny kids pools, and not the sort that keep any kids over the age of 1 occupied. That left two pools to enjoy. Just a note if you're planning a long vacation and want a variety of pools, with interactive things for the kids, you won't find it here. -- On the positive, the restaurant is excellent. We ate every meal there, and were not disappointed. The road leading to the resort is very winding and narrow. Because of the terrible weather, we never left for me

Reviews.Title: “Copamarina was great!”
Reviews.Author: mella1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Copamarina and it was fantastic. Even though it was rainly season and the weather was not too cooperative, we still had a great time. The resort is very lovely- clean and beautifully lanscaped. We were upgraded to a superior garden room however, we still had full view of the ocean. The room was also a great size and very cozy and clean. They have cable TV which, given the weather was a blessing. I cannot say enough about the staff. They are unfailingly nice and very helpful. From the front desk staff to the waiters, there was no one that wasn't extremely cheerful and helpful. I would recommend the all inclusive option. We did not find places to eat in the immediate area and the menu at the Copamarina was quite expensive. Here all inclusive means eating resturant style with snacks and drinks available any time. The only disappointment was Gilligan's Island. We found it to be a very small beach and the snorkling (equipment included in all inclusive) was very so-so. The water is beautiful however- crystal clear and just what you's expect from the Caribbean sea. Copa is definately worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Copamarina: very friendly place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copamarina from 08/08-08/14 with 2 small children, ages 5 and 2 and everyone had a blast. Food: it was delicious, I gained 5lbs in a week, rice and beans w/pork chops everyday and flan everyday. Yummy. Stay all-inclusive, it is worth it. Beach: that was the only thing which prevented me from giving excellent...the beach, although beautifull, is quite muddy. We went next door to the public beach and the Guilligans island which is very pretty. The children had a blast in the pool. All the pools are very nice. Activities: There was always something to do, thanks to Irving in the dive shop. He organized kayaking race for the kids, vollyball, treasure hunt, to name a few. He was very helpfull. Copamarina is definitely a place for families, couples, singles, seniors, everyone. Management: The management was very gracious. My 5ys old son sone stepped on a rusty nail in the outside resturant and the management and staff was very responsive and apologetic. They escorted my husband and son to the hospital, paid for his medicines, and even gave us an extra day for the rental car so we could do more sightseeing. Thank you all very much, especially to Mr. Jose Padin, the General Manager. Also, I left my credit card in the dive shop and they returned it to me while I was having the yummmy dinner. Your honesty is appreciated. BTW, the rusty nail was removed from the restaurant. The island of Puerto Rico is very beautifull. The rainforests are magnificent, the bamboo trees are so gracefull. The people are nice. Copamarina is a wonderfull place to stay while enjoying the beautifull island of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: happy2travel100
Reviews.Content: A great quite getaway. Easy to drive to. Staff are wonderful. Food is fantastic. Rooms are nice. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: wepagirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at Copamarina on June 5, 2005. We checked in and proceeded to go to our Garden View room. The room was on the small side but it had a beautiful view of the garden and ocean. The a/c was working great as well, however, we could hear a screaming baby that was staying right next door. It felt as if the baby was in our room so we decided we needed to move. We spoke to Hugo at the front desk and he was very understanding and quickly moved us to another room, however, the a/c in the new room was not working properly. As you can imagine at this point we were aggravated. My husband returned to the front desk and explained our problem. Hugo quickly apologized for the inconvenience and said he would move us to one of the best rooms at Copamarina. This was NOT an overstatement. When we arrived at our 3rd and final room we LOVED it. Hugo upgraded us to a Superior Garden View room. It was spacious and had an excellent view. The pool was steps away from our room. The staff was very friendly and the food at Alexandra was excellent, though I agree with others that it is a bit overpriced. The breakfast buffet is average at best and there were too many flies and birds around the eating area. Go to the Burger King on the main road for breakfast instead. Hugo was our hero and made our stay at the Copamarina an enjoyable one. We highly recommend the Copamarina for those who are looking to get away to a peaceful and relaxing vacation. Book a Superior Garden View it is definetly worth the extra money. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time, lush dinners”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An extraordinary time to relax, catch alot of sun, and enjoy wonderful service from all the staff. A group of 10 adults recently visited this terrific, all inclusive resort and found a very relaxing atmosphere away from the hustle and bustle of a big city like Chicago. The 2.5 hour ride from San Juan to Guanica was picturesque and quite lovely. The drivers spoke plenty of English, knew their way around to make a "snack" run, and even took you to a bakery for some deep, rich "cafe con leche". Don''t worry about the way everyone else drives in PR( fast/furious), these drivers know their business. The magic of the hotel restaurant, Alexandra, is in their cuisine- first class and easy going. Breakfast is a big buffet so enjoy!! Lunch and dinner are meant to be completed in several hours so remember this as you order your food. The service folks are outstanding so remember them as you tip! The grounds are lush, with plenty of chairs to sit at by the pools, on the beach( go to the public beach- if you want to swim in the ocean, or on Gilligans Island) and bring ALL your own supplies to use. The front desk staff are ALL friendly, helpful, and accomodating. Don't be shy- ask the staff for help in renting a car or van, be sure to plan with 24 hrs notice.( A car is really important if the family gets itchy to "do something") Ponce is 45 minutes away with a great Art Museum, lovely historical museum and a great area to do some bargain shopping near Fireman's Park(Parque de los Bomberos) People are friendly so ask if someone speaks English- Try your Spanish, it's appreciated. If you visit the Cave, be sure to wear sneakers, long pants, baseball cap, and gloves you will throw away. Any child over 12 would be fine to go into the Cave. Any child over 8 for the walk in the Dry Forest. Anyone under 8, visit the beautiful beach that is close by! The kyaking, diving, sailing and other activities are all arranged in the Dive Shop- the young, cute, beautiful and handsome staff will take care of the arrangements. Ask the Captain of the Diving boat about the "illegal" member of his family- Great storyteller! Overall, enjoy the pace of life in Guanica- slow and steady- Enjoy the drinks, delicious and lastly, enjoy "la isla del encanto".

Reviews.Title: “Was Amazing...”
Reviews.Author: giolo
Reviews.Content: How can you go wrong for an all inclusive for two people, $328.00 per day. All you can eat, all you can drink with gratuities included. I can not say it is a five star hotel, but it was clean, the room was large and very comfortable. The staff was great. I asked if there was anyway I could get a surprise cake for my husband for our anniversary and the girl at the front desk went out of her way and bought one for us. The food for us at least was not the best we have ever had, but we have had worst. Location can not be beat. The hotel was quiet and relaxing. There were two days when we had the pool all to ourselves, I mean how can you complain. We took a day trip to Bahena Beach (spelling probably wrong sorry) and the water was incredible. People did leave behing their garbage which is a disgrace but if you can see beyond that it was amazing. You can actually walk in the shallow water and see not only your feet but tons of fishes. The Copamarina was a relaxing vacation and that is what we wanted. Like others have said if you are looking for five star quality food, a nightlife this is not the place for you, but if you are looking for a hideaway with great staff and amazing views of palm trees and the bluest water this is the place. Any questions Please feel free to ask

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Piolina
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights last weekend at the Copamarina and it was a bliss. Although our room was supossedly garden view we were upgraded to an ocean view room. It was very neat, not pretentious, but with all the basic needs. Tropical decoration, soap and shampoo dispensers in the shower, wireless internet and cool drinking cups that make a nice souvenir. I also loved the futons on the beach! The staff was very friendly and the secluded location was great for those wanting to relax and feel away from everything. It is also close enough to take a day trip to Ponce and a visit to La Parguera and the bioluminiscent bay. The hotel beach was not good but next to it was CaÃ±a Gorda, a public beach great for swimming. Their kiosko had excellent local food (empanadillas) and cheap piÃ±a coladas, wich made a nice lunch. The only cons of the hotel are the beach and the pricey restaurant. Although food was pretty good, it was expensive. And the only option for breakfast is a buffet, so if all you want is some coffee and bagels/pastries it is definitely not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the Copamarina from May 9-13th. We loved our time here! We were in San Juan for four days prior and it was a great contrast. San Juan is busy and you are always running around, The Copa is quite and peaceful. The resort is beautiful with so lush gardens, a great ocean view and it is nestled in a scenic and nature filled area. If you are looking for some rest and relaxation or some advenuture this is the place for you. We found the English speaking staff so friendly and helpful. More than one time, they told us "don't worry we will take care of it, you are on vacation". It was music to our ears. We enjoyed their pools, beach, and activities such as the cave hike and kayak tour of Gilligan's Island. Just note, the other reviews are right, the beach on the property is not for swimming. You can walk less than 50yards to the public beach or drive 5 min past the resort to another beach. The gym was good and the massage at the Bioderm Spa a real treat. We opted for the all inclusive which worked out well. You have more than enough choices and options. The food is great. Dinner is in a nice restaurant with live music and excellent cuisine and service. We found that t his is a great place to relax and take it easy. Enjoy your stay! We look forward to our next trip to the Copamarina.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to unwind, hike, snorkel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Copamarina in April 2005 and had a wonderful time. The grounds are lush, the food was terrific, the rooms and the staff were very nice. A few tips: -- If you want to snorkel out on the reef, reserve as soon as you can. Spots on the boat filled up quickly the week we were there. -- Copamarina's beach is nice for relaxing in the sun and taking dips in the pools and saunas. If you wish to swim in the ocean, it's shallow and grassy. But not to worry. The lovely Cano Gorda public beach is right next door, a stroll of maybe 200 yards. It has a sandy bottom and lifeguards. -- The sandwich shop at Cano Gorda is great for a quick lunch. The sandwiches are just $2 or $3. The pina coladas are cheap. -- If you go to Gilligan's Island, there is a coral reef just off the island's western tip. As you walk off the dock, take a right (most people will be turning left), duck through the fence, and pick out a picnic-table shelter as close to the western edge as you can get. -- Gilligan's Island gets its nickname from the lagoon, which is actually a tidal stream moving through the mangroves. Going "up river" against the current is a bit of work, but your reward is a chance to snorkel as you float back down to the lagoon. Very relaxing. Lots of fun. -- The rooms were nice with fridge, safe and balconies or terraces. The TVs had English-language cable (CNN, ESPN, HBO, etc.) as well New York City local channels. -- The ocean is very clean because the resort is surrounded by the Guanica Dry Forest. It's a bizarre landscape, and beautiful in an austere sort of way. Lots of cacti. If you're a hiker, go on line and print out maps of the forest trails. Also, go to TerraServer and look at the aerial photos of the terrain. Hiking into the hills is a great time. Pack lots of water and then add an extra bottle. -- Had a good and reasonably priced meal at the restaurant at the main Gilligan's Island ferry dock (not the resort's dock). They also sell emplanadas, or meat pies, which make a nice lunch on the island. -- You need a rental car because Copamarina is miles from anywhere. Invest in a good road map and study it. We traveled all around the southwestern quarter of Puerto Rico and made discovery after discovery. Beautiful beaches. Lighthouses. Views that took your breath away. -- If you go to the bioluminescent bay, expect to be disappointed. It is nothing like the firefly-glitter in the final scene of Lord of the Flies (if you happened to see the old movie). But, we were there on a moonless night, and the boat trip under the stars was well worth the price. I don't know that I've ever seen more stars in a sky. -- Copamarina is on a narrow and torturous coastal road. (It is well paved with lines painted on the edges.) If you drive to the end of the road, there is a lovely but littered public beach. If you're a hiker, take the trail that follows the coast beyond the road's end. You'll be rewarded with dramatic views. There are not many places where you can walk for miles along the ocean and see no one else. Again, take lots of water. Also be forewarned: There were male prostitutes at the beach itself trolling for clients. -- If you get the craving, there's a Burger King in Guanica at the intersection to the highway leading to Copamarina. Come to think of it, there's a MacDonalds nearby, too. -- Copamarina is a place to unwind, relax, read books, play tennis. There is no nightlife. By 10 o'clock or so, the resort is asleep. Know what you're getting into, and you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Food off the resort!!”
Reviews.Author: WANTOTRAV
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to add..that I in no way want visitors to feel that they cannot eat anything anywhere off the resort. We ate in several places off the resort...but many of the IMMEDIATE places did not have a good level of quality of foods. I know because I tried them. One place I bought the meat pies--some of them were good others were not... they tasted "off" so I ate the ones that looked and smelled good but discarded the rest .My traveling companion and I walked to another nearby establishment and were treated well there..but after getting back to enjoy our take out dinner we discovered we had under cooked pork chops and fried chicken that could not be identified. Being used to Puerto Rican Cusines here at home..I could eat some of it ...and the rice and beans .but my travel companion could not manage any of it at all. When we traveled to Ponce we found Hamburger Restaurants, Ice Cream Stores....and the most lovely shaved Ice stands to enjoy the local flavor(and boy did we !!!!!)..but again ..immediately off the ..if you have tender tastes..be aware of the foods..you may or may not want to partake....but on the main streets..and busier areas..enjoy with Gusto!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to take Kids!”
Reviews.Author: jwhiteree
Reviews.Content: We spent the week before Easter at the Copamarina with our two boys, ages 8 and 6.5. We all had a fantastic time and would go back in a heartbeat. We rented a car in San Juan and drove to the resort. I highly recommend having a rental car. It is a long drive to Guanica, but very pretty. The other drivers are crazy, so be prepared. It is easy to get lost in PR because the roads are not marked well. You are best to know what town you want to go to next. There are signs that direct you to a town so you will have to go by that. The resort never seemed crowded. Sometimes we had to wait a little bit for a table at breakfast, but only if we got there later in the morning. Go early and you are fine. You need to prepare for the slower pace. If you are used to BAM BAM BAM service, things are a little different. And this is not just at Copamarina. Even Burger King is slow. It is just the way it is, so relax about it and enjoy. You are supposed to be vacationing anyway. The boat ride out to Gulligan's Island was not running. GI is/was closed, but the boat captain will take you out to Playa Ballena instead. Very worth it. (You can drive to Ballena by going down 333 past the resort, but take the boat. It puts you way out at the point where it is not crowded.) You will find a Caribbean beach with no one on it if you walk out to the point and around. Go to the dive shop and they will radio the boat to come to the resort dock and pick you up. The countryside is rather depressing. A lot of run down homes and buildings and wandering mangy dogs. I was told by a local, "why put a lot of effort into your house? Hurricane is going to come knock it down every few years anyway..." But look past that, and you will find wonderful kind people who are very accomidating. We only ran into 4 people the entire week who did not speak any English. If you plan on driving around, get a guidebook that has some common Spanish-all the street signs are in Spanish. My husband thought there was this town named Salida which all roads seemed to lead to. I told him, NO, salida means "exit" silly! Our room was very nice. We did not do all inclusive, so we only ate in the fancypants resort rest. one night. Our meal was okay. For the four of us, the bill came to $130 (that is with 2 kids w/meals from the kids' menu). Someone else mentioned in a review to stay away from local food. I disagree! Do some research and understand what you are eating, and you will find it quite good. We discovered Pinchos, which are basically chicken or pork on a stick, grilled with BBQ or Hot sauce. LOVE THEM! There is a vendor that sells them on the waterfront walk in Guanica. $1 each. We ate our last night in PR for $6 the four of us. There is a very good pizza place in Guanica called cleverly, Guanica Pizza. Ask at the front desk. They have info. The pizza place will deliver to the resort. We paid $16 for two "medium" pizzas that would be called larges back in the States. We did day trips to El Yunque and Arecibo and Camuy. It is quite an effort to get anywhere on the island. Plan on a whole day, but it is worth it. A drive to La Paragua just west of Guanica (which is where the bioluminescent bay is) is a good evening trip. We did the boat ride, unfortunately on a full moon night, so the bay was not very good. But we paid $20 for the 4 of us to have a hour+ after dinner moonlight boat ride, and that was fantastic. There were oodles of other kids for our boys to play with. All Puerto Rican children seem to speak perfect English thanks to cable T.V. The resort staff had organized activites for kids every day, and the guy who led them was FANTASTIC! It is true the beach is not a crashing ocean beach. The resort is in a cove, and the bottom is silty with grass. Cana Gorda, a public beach is a 2 minute walk down the shore and is a great place for swimming, but even here, the waves are not huge. The waves break way offshore on the reefs, so leave your surfboard at home. There are vendors at Cana Gorda where you can get cheap eats and $1 Medalla beers. If you have a car, there is a dirt road off 333 that goes down a cliff on the right side heading back to the resort. There is a green gate. This leads down to Playa Jaboncillo. GO THERE! The road is a little rutty and steep, but we got our Scion down there and back up just fine. At the bottom there is a gorgeous cove beach with cliff sides and no one there. Also drive down past the resort and there are more beaches, but go on a weekday. The locals flock to the beaches, and the areas around them are worn down and sometimes a lot of trash. Very sad, but try not to think about it. (I live on the East Coast and have been to VA Beach and Ocean City MD, and there they have to sift the trash out of the sand every night! Can't stand those places!) The ONLY bad thing that happened was the snorkeling trip on the dive boat. For our last day, we had made a reservation to go out on the snorkeling trip at $45 a head. It just so happened that I stopped by the dive shop that morning and happened to overhear that there was a problem with the boat, and the trip for the day was canceled. I was a little put off that they had not contacted us and told us. I asked the people in the dive shop what was going on, and they were very evasive, like they were hiding something. Was the boat broken? Problem with the Coast Guard? No one would really say. (The Coast Guard was there for some reason.) I told them that I would like to know b/c it is our last day, and I did not want to waste it. It ended up that the trip was canceled, so we went to Playa Jaboncillo instead and had a wonderful last day after all. I would go back to Copamarina without a second thought. If you want to plop at the resort and not move, get the all inclusive. If you like to go travel and see things, have a car. If you have kids, they will LOVE it.

Reviews.Title: “Go To Copamarina”
Reviews.Author: WANTOTRAV
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Puerto Rico. I stayed at the Copamarina in Guanica..this is the south area on the Carribean Sea...and it was a trip to remember. I went to Puerto Rico only because my friend and travel companion choose Puerto Rico...however I did some study and I choose the Copamarina Resort. I didn't know it then..but I had choosen heaven. But first let me tell you...don't let anyone lie to you about the travel time fron the Murin, San Juan airport.....IT IS A TWO HOUR DRIVE..and sometimes more. If you can afford to..or have kids or a larger group RENT A CAR. Where this location is...there is no public transportation and you will most likely want to go to other areas to sightsee.....however you can rent a car on the resort site..if you want to shuttle in first then rent a car. As a water nut..I was appeased..they have three pools..one for the kiddies a foot deep with a sprayer..and two full size pools. They are not super deep and thats a good thing because there are no life guards...you will feel comfortable having your older kids alone to the pool because they can't get into really deep water...someone will be able to help them out of the water if any problems occur..yet deep enough for an adult to swim in. Swimming at the beach is different..it has a lot of grass and vegetation..personally I'd move closer to the public area If you desire a sandy bottom for a better "sea swimming" experience. I wore swim shoes when I swam in the sea ..so the feel of the bottom was no problem for me at all. The grounds of the Copamarina are just plain beautiful...featuring all sorts of tropical plants and flowers that are a feast for the eyes......and your sight is then drawn to the sea...blue..blue waters. bobbing boats and off to the distance the breaking waves where the reefs are located. I cannot compliment the staff enough. Most of which not only speak english but are willing and able to help you in whatever way they can..within one day the breakfast men knew I wanted my coffee and served in right away(also I must add that the Puerto Rican coffee is amongst the best).Cost 20 dollars with tip. Beautiful buffet spread with omolets,french toast,sausage,bacon,fruit.oatmeal.muffins.waffles.scrambeled eggs..you'll want for nothing. Now..here's where some of you may have an issue.......the food is not cheap here and If you have a three or four member group you will either have to get the inclusive plan or have a car to travel many miles to fast food joints on Route 2. Unless you have a strong stomach DO NOT EAT THE LOCAL FOODS OFF THE RESORTS. I have tried several local places and the foods were not up to standards..........................but ....oh...the......Copamarina. One night I had a delicately fried and presented whole Red Snapper..w/ squash and other veggies(your choice) with 2 lovely glasses of Merlot(my choice instead of white) I still dream of that snapper..the bill 45-50 dollars without tip. The food was worth it..the presention itself well worth it.. and the staff is impeccable.. I had to almost pinch myself to be sure I wasn't in a high end casino eatery or a New York Restaurant.. because the staff was so highly trained ....excellent for me...but a big family or short funding will make it painful. The rooms are well appointed ..ours had a small refridgerator. ...no tub..but large tiled shower...issues here... large lovered ventilation grid right out to walkway...anyone passing can hear everything your doing in the bathroom.... we'd immediatly run water in sink upon entry....I believe this is only a problem on the second floors..because on the 1st foors it's palced higher up the wall..and you can't hear everything. Also a pass through door connecting the rooms sometimes allows for private conversation and sounds to be heard.But again the rooms themselves are really comfortable and nice. We even had a painting (probably local) of swimmers snorkling among the reefs-a great touch!!!! The pride of the Copamarina is the dive personel.......knowledgable people that have your safety and success in the forefront..and they know these waters.Well cared for FREE snorkling equipment...well cared for boats. Prime AAAAA dive experience here!!! Though the last few Hurricanes have damaged the reef these folks know who and what is still around to see and visit from striking Blue Tangs the size of dinner plates to starfish to all the other fishes you'd expect to see at salt water aquariums..only here they are wild and free ...moving around the coral for you to marvel at..and believe me I did just that!!!!! Its been a long time since I'd been snorkling. My friend that traveled with me is not a outdoor type...she longed for the bright lights and big city and fast foods THAT AREN'T HERE !!!!!!! BUT FOR ME............................................. I LOVE THE COPAMARINA !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Go there...... take your family Aand rest,relax..take a boat ride.....dive, snorkle eat 4 star foods..gorge at breakfast....sleep on the beach..swim in the pools just veg out. You will love it too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relax and Enjoy Copamarina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to copamarina, I went two years ago in the winter. I traveled with My husband, mother, father and a four year old and we loved it. There was so much to do except for the evenings. Guanica is a quiet town and there was no night live at the hotel. So if that's what your looking for go elsewhere this is not the place for you. We had dinner at the Alexandra our first night and service was slow. My mother and daughter was falling asleep while waiting. The food was good and compared to New York prices I didn't find them to be expensive, $26.00 for filet mignon and lobster tail, not bad. The breakfast buffet was very good, they had everything you can think of. Also the rooms had mini refrigerators, so you can stock up on snacks if you are on a budget. I was dissapointed to see that the Parrots that where once there were gone. According to the front desk visitors complained about the noise. Hello, we are in the carribean. That was part of the hotel's charm, my daughter was looking forward to seeing them. If you are traveling with kids, see Miguel at the dive shop. He plans activites daily for the kids and he is wonderful. I must say that the staff tried their best. We had a great time and we plan to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “pretty hotel, horrible beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We drove over 3 hours from San Juan airport to Copamarina, past beautiful mountains and pretty small water falls along with many old small houses with or without people in it. Along the way it scared me, it looked like an unsafe place to be in if your car broke down. I did not ever thought I would feel this way, but I did. Thank God when we got to Guanica near our hotel, there were three police station, one fire station and I felt relieved. Everytime we drove around the next couple days we saw police cars one after another, some pulled tourist people giving them tickets for speeding, while we spotted residential (beat up cars) with badly cracked windshields driving without being stopped. People driving 25-75 miles an hour unlimited speed, they cut in front of you without signaling. Where's the highway patrolmans, I keep asking myself. I hope we make it back with our little 3 year old home in one piece, I prayed. At night we drove into tiny streets just looking for a restaurant or souvenier shop, except to find gambling joints, people drunk standing around, houses with bars all over this entire island!!!! Now, I got depressed, I said to my husband this has got to get better. No more next time. Back to the hotel the activity desk clerk would not let us have the trip to Gilligans Island, told us and everyone that it is closed for the whole week. We reserved the ferry ($5.00) days ago with receipt and today it just got canceled, only the $45.00 trip is available to that island. Tomorrow we have to go home. We all looked at each other feeling angry, lied to and cheated, and felt that if we all (hotel guests) would spend more money we can go its not true. We're just stuck, so we decided to go to the other not-so-famous beach the ferry goes every hour. This made the activity guy really angry!!! He gave me a hard time borrowing our hotel life jacket, snorkling gears, etc. Everyone on the boat felt angry too. We added all-inclusive to our over price room the 3rd day. We were informed by the reservationist that the plan includes foods, drinks, gratuities. My husband and I asked twice about the gratuities, just to make sure so we wouldn't look stupid. They said that the only people you tip are the bell-boy and the bartenders. We felt unjust so each time we got served we tip a few bucks or more. The next day back to the same restaurants they ignored us. So I said maybe their employers cheated them, why are they not jolly anymore. All-in-all this 7 day trip was boring and the people here are lazy, because the service was incredibly very slow. Breakfact is buffet style, but you had to stand and wait (5-10 min.) to get seated. No exaggeration, lunch and dinner took alittle over an hour for food (even for take outs). We got sick of looking at the same crowd. Thank God we made it back home safe and not sick thats all that matters. Amen.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to escape”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being a one-half Puerto Rican stuck in the midwest, I love to get back to the island and have some good beach time. The beach at this resort does have sea grass and is not for swimming. But anyone who complains about that needs to drink less, drink more, or walk 100 yards west to Playa Cana Gorda. The public beach there is fabulous for swimming and (especially if you aren't all-inclusive at the resort) the beers are $1. Our first night there was a Monday (we stayed until Thursday am) and it is true that during the week it is very relaxed. The restaurant is good for breakfast and lunch, but EXCELLENT for dinner. Each of our evenings at dinner, the same hostess took our reservation and seated us. Each time, she remembered our names and our room #. The first night, Raul, the bartender gave me 2 hand-rolled cigars and the owner had a few drinks with us. Let me tell you, the service here is great. Middle of the week and not crowded yet there was a server at the pool area. This resort is also recognized for its environmental awareness. One thing to keep in mind (whichever type you are--I am somewhere in between): Even though there is an all-inclusive option, this is not a party-hearty environment. You get your meals, you get your drinks. However, the bar opens at about noon and closes around 10:30 or 11. One thing about that. Some said the drinks were kinda watered down. I didn't find that to be the case at all. Like anyplace else, tip the bartender fairly well and make conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for Families”
Reviews.Author: teedeeandchelchel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at the Copamarina resort and really enjoyed it. We have a 12 year old and 9 year old and it was fabulous for them. The rooms are nice, the staff extremely accomodating and friendly, but best of all we loved the activities set up by Irving. Each day he plans 3 activities for families and kids. For example beach volleyball, kayak trips, nature hikes, a treasure hunt and all this is included with your stay. It was a wonderful way for our kids to meet other children without going into one of those big hotel "Kids Programs". The grounds are lovely, the area beautiful, the only place I could see room for improvement was in the restaurant where I felt our dinners were a bit of a let down. I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We wanted a quiet place where we could sit on the beach, gaze at the sea and get some sunshine on our pale, northern bodies. This was just right! The Copamarina has comfortable, clean rooms; a friendly, accomodating, laid-back staff; gorgeous landscaping and pools; and a nice, quiet beach. The dinners at Alexandra's were delicious, too. We had not expected much after reading other reviews, and were pleasantly surprised! Dinners were no more expensive than dining here, and by stressing that we wanted our meat "very rare" it was perfect. The beach does have grass in the water, and the bottom is a bit squishy in places, but it's not off-putting or unpleasant. Do get to the beach early to get one of the big beds, they're very cool, make you feel like royalty. We should have gone with the all-inclusive plan, since we never wanted to leave! We did take a trip up to Areciebo and took a "scenic route" instead of Highway 10; took all day but we saw beautiful countryside and many small villages. Weekends are very busy, lots of families & kids, so if kids bother you, choose somewhere else. But if you want a relaxing, sunshine-filled, lazy vacation at a reasonable price, the Copa is the place - we plan on returning!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis”
Reviews.Author: liketotravelAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Cold and windy in San Juan so rented a car and drive south into the calm sun. Arrived 2/15/05 and stayed 2 nites and really enjoyed the interlude. Probably the quietest facility we have ever visited. Beautiful grounds and nice rooms with unusual windows that we opened to the sea breezes. On a bay with wonderful sailing-rented a hobicat. Beach bottom mucky and full of sea grass. Two pools and two jacuzis, very nice. Everything very well maintained. Lots of humingbirds! Did not opt for the all inclusive plan and did not regret it. A la carte meals very expensive; with limited selections. Meal service very good. Enjoyed one romantic evening in the restaurant-there was a classical guitarist adding to the atmosphere. There was one coin operated washing machine and dryer (handy!), and a small work out area and spa. Spent one evening in La Parguera and took the $5 tour of the bay-probably a victim of it's success-not many sparkly plankton left, but $5 worth of diversion, to be sure. We had no problems driving once we left San Juan and everyone matched our Spanish with their English, with grace. This is probably more of a vacation spot for those who live on the island, but we really enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we aer still at the Copamarina”
Reviews.Author: sjkoen
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Copamarina for our honeymoon. Loved it! The gounds are great. The beach is pretty, but not a swimming beach - we knew that before reserving the hotel. The staff were very friendly. Walks in the dry forest were fun. We'd agree with most everyone else that the all inclusive is the way to go. No nightlife...but that was one of the best features - so peaceful. Diving trip was great too - very well run and fun dives.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Copamarina is a beautiful, quiet resort tucked between the desert hills of coastal PR and a calm bay in the Caribbean Sea. Our one bedroom suite had large rooms, an attractive tropical decor and views of the gardens and the sea. All of the facilities, beach and amenities were in excellent condition. This is a quiet resort in a remote area with limited nightlife but an extremely pleasant atmosphere and a great climate. A snorkel and/or diving excursion leaves from the resort daily. There are interesting sidetrips within a short drive. The resort is next to a national park with easy hikes and great views of the Caribbean. Public beaches (with waves) are on either side of the resort. Gilligan's island was closed during our stay, but would be an interesting spot to snorkel and swim. Nearby Parguera is a small tourist town with 3 or 4 restaurants, boat rentals and nightly cruises to a bioluminescent bay. Don't expect to spend much time in Guanica. We did not have the all inclusive package, and found the restaurant to be somewhat overpriced. The food was good, the service slow and amatuerish, but the kids were trying hard. Manana

Reviews.Title: “ahhh”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a looow key vacation spot for folks who need to veg. The service is impecable, everyone friendly and accomodating. Their chef even bent over backwards to prepare vegetarian meals for us. This place will lower your blood pressure and turn your type-A personality into a type-B. We may very well return for more next winter! :)

Reviews.Title: “Copamarina - aplace to stay, relax and explore”
Reviews.Author: zippidydo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Copamarina yesterday. The rooms, the grounds and the staff are exceptional. The room is decorated in tropical colors, large beautiful bathroom, wooden shutters to the deck or patio, good a/c and an adequate television. The maid staff was efficient and the rooms cleaned daily (we tipped daily, and our room seem to be cleaned very well), the gardens, pool areas and beach seemed to always be clean without seeing lot of cleaning activity. The gardens and pool areas are very large and uncrowded. The resort has a lot of acreage for the small number of rooms (approx. 120 rooms). There was never a problem getting lounges at the pool or beach. Besides chairs and lounges on the beach there are also a number of large futons - yes futons on the beach. One is on a low wooden platform, the other two are on raised frames with drapes that you can pull closed all around for privacy, including a drape on top to protect from the sun. Great for a nap on the beach or more?? We did not take advantage of these. There is a dive shop/gift shop on the beach with dive and snorkel trips gear, towels. They also have kayaks, paddle boats and some other available watercraft. Everything up till the edge of the water is top shelf. The ocean water comes up short. It is very shallow, very grassy and kind of like clay bottom. So going to this resort to use the great beach would be a disappointment, but knowing this limitation leaves you options to either sit on the beach (great breezes and the sound of the water lapping on the sand) and swimming in the pool, while exploring the island for great beaches (of which we found many). There is also a public beach just a short walk away - it was a little better, not much. I did a little snorkeling on the far end of that beach.
